description:
While waiting for our seat at Lapisara Eatery, my friends and I decided to come here for a quick coffee break. Instead of coffee though, I found the sweet potato latte which sounded interesting so I ended up giving it a try.

The sweet potato latte was pretty good, but it is a bit on the sweet side. It tastes a lot like blended sweet potatoes with whole milk, heated up really well and sweetened. The sweet potato itself is already pretty sweet, so if I had to do it again I'd probably ask that they don't sweeten it in any way.

It is a bit heavy of a drink though, since you're getting the calories from the milk, sweetener and the carb-heavy sweet potato. So the drink itself can be quite filling.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Got the iced caramel latte, it was pretty good!

Free wifi and outlets, but the outlets on the wooden bench weren't working unfortunately. Enough seating, and overall a pretty good place to study/get work done. Definitely want to try one of their desserts the next time I come.
author: Michelle P.

description:
I love their fruit tart- it's so good and the fruits are always sweet. I've also tried their shaved ice- the green tea and the strawberry. The ice is more crunchy than I would like and they serve the small in a cup which makes it hard to eat. I've also had their honey bread- delicious but very heavy. Best to share it with people.

Overall nice local cafe and is the only place nearby with shaved ice. Seems to be a popular place for people to work.
author: Jenny J.

description:
Got here around 8pm on a Tuesday night and there was surprisingly a lot of people, not a full house but only a few tables were left open. 

Friend and I weren't that hungry and wanted something to satisfy our sweets craving so we decided to share a small green tea shaved ice ($5). The shaved ice came out super quick (I just finished paying, and it was ready)! The shaved ice was meh - it's literally a bed of crunchy ice topped with green tea ice cream, red bean, some mochi and peanuts and I believe condensed milk and caramel (could be wrong). Even though I wasn't impressed with the shaved ice, other items on the menu seem good! I would try the waffle or honey bread next time! 

On another note, parking in this area is actually quite difficult (it's located in downtown SF). After circling a few times we were lucky to get a spot right in the front! But I'd imagine during busy hours, it would be nearly impossible.
author: Stacey Y.

description:
I've been here several times for sweet potato latte which is really delicious! It may sound weird but once you take a sip of this warming and soft drink, you may love it!

This time I got green tea shaved ice ($9). It has green tea ice cream, mochi, red beans, some kinds of nuts and shaved ice! It is your typical korean style bingsu which you can't go wrong with!

If you've never had shaved ice or sweet potato latte before, I highly recommend it! If you love sweet potato, you will love sweet potato latte for sure!
author: Clare L.

description: It's getting hot in here! So this place is really cute and intimate, but it's so hot. I stopped in to grab a quick latte and noticed how packed this place was on a Sunday evening (6pm). There are quite a few places to sit and work, which is great! They have a decent sized menu of coffee and teas, and some delicious looking pastries (cheesecake and fruit tarts). Prices are pretty reasonable, and the chai latte I had was amazing. The only reason I give this place 3 stars is because of how hot it was. We decided after a few minutes that we would just take our drinks and go outside, as it was much cooler. Overall, pretty cute spot, just needs air conditioning.
author: Alexus S.

description:
A cute little cafe that serves familiar coffee beverages, but is not afraid to stray from the routine pound cakes and muffins.  Three types of shaved ice desserts, because why not?  And a lot of other sweets that look too fancy for a coffee house.

Green Tea Shaved Ice: This was so refreshing on a warm-ish day in San Francisco.  Flavored ice (vanilla?) that is shaved thin.  Then comes a really sweet glob of red beans.  A very rich matcha green tea scoop of ice cream on top of that.  And some little mochi pillows to add a chewy texture.  Once I ate all the solids, I had what seemed like a bunch of ice cold matcha-flavored cereal milk leftover.  No shame in slurping that up!

Honey Bread: It's basically three thick slices of crispy toast that are drenched in butter and honey then covered with loads of whipped cream.  And, of course, there is a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the side and another mound of whipped cream for good measure.  I really appreciated the simplicity of this, like a dessert you could put together at home when you don't have any traditional desserts.  It did feel a bit too carb-y about half way through though, so probably best to share.

Green Tea Latte: This was just ok.  A little light on the matcha and heavy on the sweetener.  But maybe I'm just spoiled from Stonemill Matcha!
author: Adam B.

description:
Came in somewhat late on a Wednesday night to have a bite of something sweet. I was intrigued by the concept of "Honey Bread" which from the painting in the store looked like some kind of pound cake dessert. 

The honey bread took them about 15 minutes to make, which I was not expecting because Joy's Place is a coffee shop and they rarely produce that kind of wait time.

The honey bread is actually 3 slices of toast with butter, cinnamon, sugar, whipped cream, and nuts, served with a side of ice cream. There is no actual honey.  It's actually a substantial amount of food, so you get your $7 worth and it explains the wait time somewhat.  I was quite surprised, however, since I was not expecting this kind of dessert.

I think it's a good dessert for those who do not want something too sweet and who don't mind carb loading - the flavor does not fully permeate the bread so you have some plain bread alongside the sweetened bread.
author: Nicole R.

description:
It took my Maui Yelp friend/CA Maria to point me to Joy's Place.  I saw her picture for an ube latte in Maui and immediately wanted to try it.  However, a 2300 mile distance was a bit of a challenge and to be honest, a hot drink probably isn't what I would go for when it is 80-90 degrees outside over there.  So when she told me she was inspired to try that ube latte after having the sweet potato latte in SF, I knew I had no excuse not to cross the bridge since I didn't have to cross the ocean for this one.  After indulging in French pastries and croissants at Les Gourmands, I needed a non coffee chaser and immediately thought of that sweet potato latte.  

A cute hangout for locals including families especially on a weekend morning, honestly I would have walked past it if I wasn't specifically looking for it.  You can really taste the sweet potato puree with each sip of the latte and in some instances, even small pieces of the pulp.  It was a perfect treat for this non-coffee drinker.  Mahalo Maria for turning a sista onto this neighboring gem.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
Mmhmm good! I felt joy coming into Joy's Place during a calm Saturday afternoon. It's a hidden, hip cafe where some people come to either to work on their laptops or eat desserts with friends. 

The only thing not as joyful was the customer service but the green tea shaved ice (small) was worth the stay. It was about $5.42 and you get condensed milk mixed in the ice at the bottom and a scoop of smooth green tea ice cream at the top. There's red bean on the sides of the ice cream and chewy mochi hidden like gems. There's also drizzled honey and nuts on the top which was a nice touch. There may have also been some sort of toffee in there--overall, it was delicious!
author: Leona C.

description:
~Food~
Waffles: it comes with a Belgian waffle sprinkled with syrup and nuts, a scoop of ice cream, and a mound of whipped cream. Put everything together in one bite and you've got moms homemade dessert. Nothing fancy, nothing crazy. Waffle was made fresh and crunchy on the outside.

~Price/Quality/Quantity~
Price was a little steep for the waffle plate $7. The shaved ice was $5(s) $9(l) though so that might be a better deal.

~Atmosphere~
For some reason it's really warm in there but that is terrific when you're looking for some shelter from the chilly sf evenings in the middle of Tenderloin. It's cozy and people like to study here.

Cozy cafe but pricey homemade waffles/ok desserts.
author: Lily L.

description: Gorgeous, delish desserts! Quick service. Good coffee. Service could have been a tad more friendly but not a huge deal. Only down side was that it was sooo hot in there! Worth the stop for dessert though!
author: Christy F.

description:
After I had myself a feast at a nearby restaurant, I wanted a hot drink to top off my last night in cold cold San Francisco.  I read about this place a few days before and the first mention of sweet potato latte had me at HELLO (!!).

I walked into the shop and I got the impression that this was the spot to hangout for the college-aged group and people who need a place to get work done at night.  They are open past midnight and this is a cute space to hangout -- especially if you're like me and have late night cravings for sweets.

They have a big menu board display and ordering is fast and easy.  They quickly whipped up my latte and I was on my way in a matter of minutes.  Thankfully so because any minute sooner and I probably would've been tempted to eat one or two of the cakes left in their dessert case.  Haha.

My latte was incredibly tasty and the more I sipped, the more the sweet potato taste became prevalent.  There is zero caffeine value, but I loved it so much that I can't wait to visit again next month while I'm in the city.  It's the perfect thing to warm you up and I may just have to try one of the many sweet treats they offer as well :)
author: Maria P.

description:
Searching for desserts around the area near our hotel we came here because there was Green Tea Shaved Ice.  However, sadly, the Green Tea Shaved Ice was a little too much on the sweet side for our tastes. When we came in, we were surprised by how many people this place had. There were all types of students there studying into the late night burning the midnight oil. 

I think the takeaway of this place is, come here for the drinks or studying, and then if you have a sweet tooth get a dessert. I wish they had more options on the desserts, however I had to settle for the shaved ice, which is on the sweet side. If you like sweet, perfect. If not, then I would say try some of their other desserts.
author: Bruce K.

description: I always stopped by here for coffee and desserts every time I visit San Francisco. The coffee is great and the desserts are the bombs!!
author: Twee W.

description: Kind of a mixed experience. It is a small, cute place, but crowded by millennials, so what would have been a romantic and cute vibe was completely drowned out by the number of people crammed into this small cafe. My strawberry mousse/short cake was served to me nearly frozen, which is definitely a very, very wrong way to serve a cake. I really wanted to like this place and this was a bummer.
author: Gracie J.

description:
Amazing desserts!

I came here with three other friends and we split a green shaved ice and a honey toast. I also got a sweet potato latte and another friend got the green tea latte.

Green tea shaved ice ($9)-Delicious! We got the large size, which is very worth the price. It seemed to be almost three times the size of the small size. The shaved ice had a scoop of green tea ice cream and a scoop of red beans, along with a lot of little colorful candy mochi pieces.

Honey bread ($7)-I personally liked this one better than the shaved ice, because I liked the contrast between the warm, slightly crunchy bread and the cold, smooth ice cream.

Sweet potato latte ($5)-Tastes like they liquified a sweet potato-amazing and delicious. Highly recommend if you love sweet potato.

Green tea latte ($5)-My friend found this drink to be too sweet, and the rest of us tried a sip and agree. Don't recommend unless you have a major sweet tooth.

Overall delicious desserts, and the cafe itself is adorable. There were also cute cakes/pastries that were on display, but we didn't try them.
author: Elaine Z.

description: Didn't enjoy the ice cream. Pictures are different from why they serve. The interior is fine, decent place to sit for a nice chat.
author: Arjan N.

description:
My friend and I went there to do work. He got a coffee and I just sat down (I was going to buy something eventually).

The bartender came to us and in a very rude manner said that if I don't buy something, we have to leave. We were pissed at the way she talked so we just left.

Really bad experience.
author: Tony C.

description: Smells sweet, this is my favorite cafe at Post street. With WiFi and charge, you can work here for a long time by a cup of coffee. But always so crowded with Korean guys, that's difficult to get a seat time after dinner and holidays. I like this environment and friendly staffs there, the location is also perfect near the Union Square.
author: Shun Y.

description:
A good place to get dessert after eating in Chinatown. They have a variety of desserts, from patbingsu to hot drinks to pastries. 

We got one of the patbingsus and a fruit tart. The patbingsu was huge and was hard to finish even among three people. It had plenty of toppings, and the shaved ice was nicely coated with condensed milk. I think they also had a strawberry flavor patbingsu as well. The fruit tart was pretty good, but it tastes similar to any other bakery's. 

Seating is somewhat limited, but it doesn't get super busy. Lots of people go there to work on their laptops or just catch up with friends. Wifi is pretty good if you want to work there as well.
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Joy's Place is the coffee shop and hangout for the Korean/art school community that's popped up around this street.  It's an interesting blend because they offer Asian inspired deserts and food as well as hot and cold drinks.  I always get the hot citron tea which to be honest is basically hot water and yuzu mix that you can get from 99 Ranch.

I really dig the ambiance and clientele of this coffee shop so I generally go here once a week.  It's located in the tendernob area so sometimes they have to usher away homeless people who are disturbing the patrons outside.  It can get very busy at times and difficult to find seating.  Just a nice place, wish there were more of them in San Francisco.
author: Mark C.

description:
I was so excited about eating here when I was looking up a late night dessert spot and was sorely disappointed.

(Part of me is writing this review because this most recent time was actually my SECOND visit and I had forgotten I had been here before.)

I'm pretty sure I ordered shaved ice but what I received was dessert soup. It was practically all melted when it was served to me. I didn't see dessert soup on the menu, so I'm fairly positive they didn't get the order wrong. Unacceptable.
author: Charles L.

description:
Popped in here for dessert after dinner. First thing we noticed is HOW WARM it is inside. I mean, it was very comfortable because it was very cold and windy outside, but it was almost too warm. 

Had their green tea shaved ice which was okay, and the belgium waffles. The waffles were pretty great, loved the cream and ice cream it comes with. The shaved ice was fine, I wish the ice was more like snow, and wish there was more mochi and condensed milk. Overall a decent dessert though!

The place is small and was jam packed for the evening, with everyone working on their laptops, but we found one small table to sit at to enjoy our dessert. 

Not sure if I'd come back again, but I'd recommend.
author: Shelley C.

description:
Great spot for a late night dessert in a casual, cozy cafe setting. They serve a variety of coffee, pastries, desserts and Korean style shaved ice here. I don't go out for dessert much, but this place stood out to me as a great find in Lower Nob Hill.

There's plenty of small tables and couches here, a lot of people were working here late at night so it was a big harder to find space for a bigger group even at around 10 PM. It'd be good if there was a time limit for those simply working on laptops while there was lots of people waiting around for seats. 

Green Tea Shaved Ice - Green tea ice cream, red bean, mochi, cereal powder, nuts. The large is enough to satisfy a group or 3-4 and was reasonably priced at $9. Pretty delicious overall.

Waffle - Comes with 4 slices of waffle, a large scoop of vanilla ice cream & whipped cream. Comes with nuts and honey on top of the waffle. Would recommend!
author: Chelsea W.

description:
I hate driving into the city, but I really wanted Korean shaved ice and there's really slim pickings in the Bay Area. 

For four people we got 2 large shaved ice: green tea and strawberry ($9 each). They're huge! We didn't quite finish either. The strawberry one was simply topped with sliced macerated strawberries and strawberry ice cream. The green tea one had green tea ice cream, mochi, red beans, grain powder, and nuts. I liked the green tea one more because I enjoyed the additions of red beans and grain powder which are authentic toppings. However the bingsu here falls flat compared to those I had in K-town in LA. 

The place is pretty crowded with people on their laptops so seats are not a guarantee. We got lucky with street parking a couple blocks away, but I wouldn't count on it either. If I happen to be in the area, I might stop by for a coffee to go, but I wouldn't drive here to get bingsu again.
author: Kim W.

description:
My fiancé and I stopped by Joy's Place tonight to grab dessert after our dinner. It was close to our hotel around the corner, plus really nice that it was open until midnight.

The place itself is really cute with a lot of chalkboard art depicting the menu and coffee descriptions. I also saw that there was free wifi for customers. I ordered the large green tea shaved ice and it was huge. My fiancé and I easily finished it. It was really good and had bits of red bean, mochi, green tea ice cream and matcha powder. It wasn't the best shaved ice I've had but it was definitely the most creative with all the toppings.
author: Jessica N.

description:
Open Late: Past Midnight for that sweet craving

Parking: Street Parking. I suggest park at Union Square and park, gurl!

Order: Strawberry w/ condense milk

Setting: Small so prepare to order To Go
author: Ryan R.

description: The sweet potato latte is DELICIOUS! It has real sweet potato in it. It is textured, which I actually really like. I will be coming back.
author: Kelley R.

description:
Cute place. Nice haven in the area. We had dinner up the street and had an hour to kill before going to a show. We ducked in here - it was cute and serene. There were many people on their laptops. 

We had the waffle. It's define sized for sharing. They had a great caramel? Honey? Syrup? On it and served it with whipped cream and ice cream and nuts. Made for a YUMMY dessert.  

Really lovely!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Joy's Place is a treasure off of Post. If you're staying in a hotel/hostel nearby this is definitely worth the stop for your morning coffee fix. I've stopped by multiple times during my stay in SF for breakfast or a pick me up before I venture around The City. 

There's a neat picture menu on the wall to describe the different espresso options they make. Their dessert menu seems to be popular as well with their pastry and patbingsu (Korean shaved ice) options. Their waffle is more of a dessert version than breakfast but I had it for breakfast anyways! As an adult you can opt to have ice cream for breakfast haha (#treatyoself). There's free wifi and it seems to be the popping spot for the local students to come study and hang. 

As a fellow barista it was a mission of mine to find nice, quaint, and unique coffee shops during my travels. Joy's Place was a treat. I wish I'd opened up convo with the baristas here (I still have a couple days to do so). Is it weird the sound of milk steaming and beans grinding makes me excited to get back to work? I'll definitely frequent this place again if ever in SF.
author: Joshua R.

description: Ive been frequenting this place since it opened and have always enjoyed it. This time was a total 180. First the place was filthy. Not sure what was worse this time around, the horribly stale bread or the insanely loud trap music with dancing barista. People wanna relax and get their work done dude they don't wanna hear music with gunshots and offensive language and racial slurs while they eat their lunch.
author: William S.

description:
Great atmosphere, friendly, clean, and they have tasty drinks! 

Why I love this place // This adorable shop was an anniversary tradition with my boyfriend for the first two years we dated. Don't worry, we're still together (in case you were curious), we just venture out of the city since we live in the city now. 

Atmosphere // at night it has a very cozy yet clean feeling. I've only been here really late at night, but we always counted on this spot to be our go to since we knew it would be open late. This place has a great vibe and there were always other couples or casual older men reading books in this shop.

Drinks // On a colder night, I love their sweet potato latte ($5.00), not only is it unique but it has great mouthfeel and flavor. Goes down warm and makes me feel all cozy. 

I've also had their matcha green tea latte ($5.00) which was tasty, but I definitely preferred the potato latte more. 

Overall, I definitely plan to come back and I'll probably drag my bf with me, too.
author: Emily T.

description:
Pros:  
Open late, good coffee at low prices (but servings are small)

Bad:  
It was so insanely warm inside that we were nearly falling asleep. At one point a girl at a table nearby did slump over and fall asleep for a bit. 

The food is terrible.  I ordered a grilled cheese which was nearly inedible.  It was literally just a 1/3" slab of partially melted shredded cheese stuck in a barely toasted sub bun of some sort - no butter, no seasonings, nothing.  Just an inordinate amount of cheese on a piece of mostly tasteless bread.
author: Jason F.

description:
My fav place for dessert in Korean style, especially Red bean Bingsu (shaved ice toped w/ red beans) it was so fantastic 

Also the waffle was really wonderful. We do like its texture, crunchy and soft appropriately . 

Price,,reasonable 

I'd say here is the place my friends and i will go back definitely!!!!!!
author: Tiratiwan L.

description: The aesthetic of the shop is very cute and I love the chalkboard walls and the cafe ambiance.  As such, the cafe was definitely mostly populated with people studying. The menu seems quite limited to me and I wasn't blown away by the dessert options. We ordered the strawberry shaved ice, which was disappointing mainly in the sparing amount of toppings it had, so we were left with plenty of ice.
author: Naomi J.

description:
Came to Joy's Place just for the sweet potato latte. 

Sweet potato in drinkable form? This definitely peaked my curiosity! 

This drink legit tasted like real sweet potato mixed with hot milk and sugar, served in a paper coffee cup. It was the perfect fix for a sweet tooth after a 10 tapa Korea dinner. It was more sweet than I'd prefer, but delicious nonetheless!

The consistency was slightly more viscous than a regular cafe latte, but not as thick as what you'd imagine blended sweet potato to be. I'd say it had the viscosity of a really well blended smoothy. 

At $5 a cup - def recommend a try!
author: Janice K.

description:
Cute Korean cafe! 

Very nice interior, albeit small for my group of five. It was crowded at 9pm though, so you know it's good! Has Wi-Fi and plenty of outlets so you can chill with your coffee and do work. 

We got the red bean and green tea shaved ice which were good portions and very good. I only wish the place was bigger so there were more places to sit!

I would love to come back with a laptop to do work here.
author: Christine K.

description:
Came in here recently with my family to get dessert...

Shaved Ice: the matcha has red bean in it!! This was never specified on the menu and I probably wouldn't have ordered it had I known that. The strawberry is a much safer choice.

Honey toast took 30 min to make and I am not entirely sure how?? It was still good, but just lacking in presentation for the time it took to execute (and no, they were not busy with 10 other orders; our was literately the only order they had at 10pm on a Wednesday night)

My biggest issue with this place? All the tables were occupied by people on laptops who had clearly been there for hours and weren't consuming anything. I know that's basically every Starbucks, but when a place serves plated desserts that take 30 minutes to make, having to eat them standing up because people are using the space as a public library is not the best customer experience. There needs to be some sort of time limit on table residency.

Hey Joy, why are you allowing your "customers" to camp out for hours on their laptops when they're not even ordering anything and only blocking seats for new, paying customers? You should probably do something about that, the surprise red bean in your matcha, and the honey toast execution.
author: Nikki I.

description:
No need to make reservations for a sauna when you can find a public walk-in one like Joy's Place!

Joy's Place is a cute little coffee-shop that, unfortunately doubles up as a steam room. It has all the best features of a solid work spot (wifi, outlets, lots of workspaces, music, food), but has absolutely no ventilation. As amusing as it can be watching beads of sweat form on the foreheads of my study buddies around the table, I'd prefer not to have to take "AC breaks" every 30 minutes by stepping outside the propped open front door, which was of no avail, to embrace the cooler temperature by at least 20 degrees.

If Joy's unbearable indoor heat is merely a tactic for their customers to buy a second or third order of their shaved ice dessert, which definitely hits the (hot) spot - I commend them on their attempted creativity.
author: Jenni H.

description: Oh goodness what a great find! Came here after dinner and ordered the sweet potato latte and waffles. Both were great! The sweet potato latte lived up to my expectations from Korea and the waffles were delicious--the batter wasn't too sweet like most of them but instead had this great, buttery taste that meshed really well with the vanilla ice cream and whip cream that came on the side. I also really liked that because it prevented my waffles from getting soggy. The interior was really cute too! Would love to come back to try more from their menu in the future.
author: Allison T.

description: The strawberry shaved ice cream is soooo good. Americano coffee is good too . Nice little shop and decent hangout for dessert.
author: ChinTuFat P.

description:
There is surprisingly a dearth of cafes in the city that open past 10pm, and just for that, Joy's Place wins. They open until midnight on most if not all days of the week, making for a nice spot for night owls to flock to. The 10pm crew of patrons usually consist of individuals, either single or in a cohort of others, working on laptops. There's the occasional small group of those there for a late night hangout.

Their coffee was quite good. I had the iced latte that was equally strong and aromatic. I'd definitely order it again.

It is indeed like a sauna here. Come in layers and expect to peel down to a tank top.
author: Cici T.

description:
I just happened to be around the area after visiting Color Factory. Since it was super warm there, and my friends and I were heating up, and SUPER parched, we wanted to grab some ice cream or drinks. We walked over, so I couldn't comment on the parking, but it seems like it would not be super fun, since it is SF. Anyway, we arrived at around 10 pm, and the place had maybe half the tables full with people working on their laptops. Seemed like a chill place. Very cutesy interior and menu drawn on a wall that is basically a large chalkboard. As we ordered the green tea shaved ice, we were told that they were out of vanilla ice cream, and that they would have to substitute for matcha ice cream. Not a big deal since I love green tea! 

At $5 for a small sized shaved ice, it is a bit pricey, but again, I get that it is SF. It is probably as big as a regular sized boba cup (not those regular-sized-auto upgrade-to-a-large cups). I was also a bit sad that they didn't fill the shaved ice and fillings to the top of the cup, and then overflow it with the ice cream that they add to top the dessert off. Instead the entire dessert was as tall as the cup itself. But it is what it is. The green shaved snow comes with a scoop of vanilla ice cream usually, red beans, mochi, peanuts, and condensed milk. The shaved ice itself is pretty good--I like that the ice pieces are really fine compared to other places, but it's not quite on the level of shaved snow. The scoop of green tea ice cream was also good! It was creamy and complemented the shaved ice well. Overall it was good, but I still wish the portion was bigger for the price. Maybe we would have gotten more value for the large at $9? But then again, I feel like it would need more than 2 people to finish that comfortably. It definitely looked at least twice as big as the small.

I would rate this place 3.5/5, but rounded up to 4/5.
author: Cindy M.

description:
Nothing really JOY about it. 

This place is for quiet people. Very small space too. The photos make it look like they have tons of dessert but they really don't. It's more a coffee joint.

I had the strawberry shaved ice and it was really good. 

But there was hardly any seating and the trash cans were super full and over flowing. Gave it a dirty vibe. If the strawberry shaved ice hadn't been good this place would have got 2 stars.
author: Wendi J.

description:
I went to Joy's Place, looking forward to hanging out at the nice cafe that opens late with Asian desserts and nice coffee last night. But when I get there little before 10 PM, they told us that they were closing... It says it opens till midnight everyday on Yelp, though... 
Joy's Place - please edit your business hour on your Yelp page if you don't open late as it's stated here...
author: Mariko H.

description: Love coming to this cozy cafe on the weekends to catch up on work or on my WFH days. They have great coffee and a wide variety of coffee drinks. Their wifi is super reliable and a lot of available outlets if you nab a table alongside the wall. If you come early when they open, you usually have a choice of any spot in the cafe. In terms of food, they have waffles (served with ice cream!), basic sandwiches (grilled cheese, tuna melt, ham & cheese), and shaved ice desserts. I also dig that a ton of students come here to work. It gives off that college library vibe without being overly quiet. Definitely come here to get some work done on your laptop and enjoy a cup of coffee.
author: Frances P.

description:
Looking for a cute coffee shop with an Asian twist? Well this place may be right for you. With the standard coffee drinks like, Americano, Cafe Mocha, Caramel Macchiato, Cappuccino, etc. they have it all including some shaved ice desserts and waffles. My Mocha tasted good until I got to the bottom where the coffee bits remained. Their coffee is pretty flavorful and smooth, but I think the desserts is what sets them apart.

We ordered the large red bean shaved ice since they ran out of green tea everything. Unfortunately, they ran out in the middle of the day so I guess you have to come earlier? It came with a huge bowl of shaved ice and condensed milk, topped with vanilla ice cream, red beans, mochi, and peanuts. It all tasted really yummy and for $9, 4 of us shared it so it wasn't too bad. Oh and their menu art is cute too. So if you're trying to find a chill place to study, give it a shot.
author: Ryan J.

description: I'm honestly confused as to why this place has such good ratings. For a city like San Francisco, this was not an exemplary cafe. The drinks were pretty good, but the desserts were not. Also, it was super dirty and sticky everywhere. The bathroom especially- the sink had a few days worth of dust and hair on it. Don't think I would go back here.
author: Parisa G.

description:
This place has that very cute and cozy feeling so it's easy to get sucked in on a long cold night. I wanted to get the waffle because of how good the picture looked on the wall but since it was almost closing, the only thing I could get was their shaved ice so I got the red bean. I was accompanied by two others so I got a large so we could all share that costed a total of $9 something. 

Service was is okay, wasn't bad nor something I'd consider good. 
PSA: they have free wifi here as well

The decor in this place was definitely amazing, has that urban outfitters vibe to it yet still very cozy. 

Couple minutes later, the shaved ice came out and it was picture time. You really get what you pay for because the size is humongous. We were in a group of three so I assumed we would finish but didn't end up doing so since it was drowning in the condensed milk. It's nothing special nor something I'd order again. I'd come back to try their waffles.
author: Lisa W.

description: Grilled cheese we ordered was completely burnt. The milk in the coffee was bad and broken and I showed the guy at the counter and even though he could see that there were flakes in the milk and it tasted sour he claim s that's how soy milk looks in coffee. Ended up throwing both away.
author: Namisha B.

description: Green tea shaved ice isn't what I excepted and normally get. I expected the shaved ice to be green tea flavored. But it was green tea ice cream on top of red bean and regular shaved ice.
author: Vanessa N.

description: My friend and I were kind of tired of ice cream as we had it everyday :) so we decided to get something different. This place showed up on our Yelp search so we decided to check it out. It was a hot day so we were excited to get something cold and refreshing. We opted for the green tea shaved ice which came with green tea ice cream, red beans and mochi and some sort of nuts. We got the large to share and it was pretty large. Overall though, it was standard, there was nothing special from this place other shaved ice place I've been too. The only nice thing was that they added nuts so there was a crunch which was good. One thing though, the place itself had no AC so it was piping hot being in the cafe and the shaved ice melted pretty quickly as well
author: Huong L.

description: Saturday afternoon, really wanted a dessert. Came to Joy's since the maps was showing it was close to home. Saw the pictures and everything looked really good. I ordered the waffle and it is really well presented, but the flavor is ok.If they'd had options to add fruits or chocolate it would be much better ! Positive side: good sized portion , reasonable price. As I work in the food and beverage area I tend to pay attention to the details of costumer service. If I knew the owner would give him/her I would give a piece of advice: details make all the difference!!!
author: Marina B.

description:
- Good seating/workspace
- Decent, not great coffee, albeit fairly inexpensive
- Open late
- Decent music/vibes
- Tasty dessert & macaroons
author: John L.

description: I stopped in to grab some tea before turning in, and got a mousse cake, too. The cake was amazing, and the vibe of the place was peaceful and friendly, perfect for this evening.
author: John R.

description: Enjoy a nice Caramel latte with a side of waffles. Oh and don't forever the vanilla ice cream !!!!
author: Janay O.

description: Wouldn't let me piss in their toilet without buying a green tea first. Drank it 6.73/10. Now I have to piss again.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Been here a few times to study and this place is fine for the most part. It has free wifi, a reasonable number of seats, and a homey vibe. There's a few tables in the center of the room and several more along the walls. Only the ones by the walls have access to the outlets though. This place also always seems to be crowded. I've been here on weekday nights and weekends during the day and it's always packed. Somehow I did manage to get a spot both times. Service isn't fantastic. Usually they seem to be chatting amongst themselves but they've always gotten what I need. Parking in the area is also pretty awful. There's a lot of parallel parking spots but of course it's the city so they're all taken. I circled several blocks for 20+ mins on a Sunday for a spot.

As for the food/drinks, both times I came I got the green tea shaved ice. It's very standard but I always crave it. It's a bit pricy for what you get but it's a great pick me up since it's refreshing but not too heavy. Overall Joy's is a nice spot to get some work done. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if I'm in the area I'd stop by.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Ambience: Quiet cafe setting. Lots of people studying.

Food: We got the Green Tea Shaved Ice. It was pretty good. I am not a fan of the red beans that much so I will most likely take it out or replace it with more mochi.

Service: Workers were quiet and looked like they did not want to be there but they were fast in fixing our order.

Parking: We went on a Saturday night so street parking was really tough. We found a parking structure at the next street over for $4/hr.
author: Christian E.

description:
This is my favorite late night dessert place. The waffles and ice cream are definitely my favorite. The waffles are a bit pricey, but I think the quality is just so amazing that it's worth it. This is not your granny's waffles, but a polished dessert waffle. 

The ambience usually consists of people studying, and the odd group coming in to chill. It's a very small space that's super warm and cozy until the door is opened and late night SF winds hit you.

I personally don't get coffee here, since I usually come in late at night, but I have heard great things about their coffee from my friends who do drink coffee at all hours.

The service is nothing special, but also nothing to complain about. So far, most of the baristas/cashiers haven't tried to make small talk or anything, but they're not unfriendly or mean, they just do their job.
author: Sao B.

description:
Came in on a chilly night in SF. First off, this place is tiny and VERY warm. It was uncomfortable to sit in this cafe for very long.

Got their snow (green tea and red bean), and it was WAY too sweet! You can tell that they're probably using good quality ingredients (their ice cream was so creamy!), but the overly sweet nature was too much for me. What's more, the snow lacked enough of the toppings (the texture and flavors ended up all running together) to make it interesting considering the quantity. I also made a second order for their grilled cheese, and it was also quite disappointing/meh considering the price.

Overall not impressed with the food nor the ambience :(
author: Katherine L.

description: Their affogato was the pick me up I needed! Nice atmosphere, quiet with delicious sweets and great coffee.
author: Jen N.

description:
Stopped her for dessert after dinner. It was pretty chilly out side and when we walked in we were overwhelmed with how uncomfortably warm it was. 

The place was packed with people on laptops. The vibe was weird and it was unusually quiet.  Is there a no talking rule here?  Not a exactly a place to hang out and chat. 

We got a few macarons, strawberry cake, and a strawberry shave ice.  Luckily we found a tight space to enjoy them. They were ok. Nothing special.  Left a lot to be desired. Strawberry shave ice was the best option... a little soupy... maybe because it was sooo warm. 

Highly unlikely to would return. Not really kid friendly. Clean.
author: A T.

description: If you are looking for a coffee shop to go kick it at, read, work, chill, this is your place. The city doesn't have too many cool coffee shops that are open late but this place is good. Coffee is okay and food is average but the place and ambiance is excellent.
author: Vinayak P.

description:
I didn't have much time to evaluate this little cafe. Based on what I observed, the atmosphere and shaved ice were amazing! My friend and I got the small red bean shaved ice and the green tea shaved ice. They were both $5 each. The red bean shaved ice had a scoop of red bean ice cream, red bean and misugaru powder (?) over ice. The overall combination was good. The green tea shaved ice had delicious green tea ice cream, however the shaved ice portion was not as flavorful and sweet as the red bean shaved ice. 

The cafe itself had plenty of tables and seating. The place was packed for a Tuesday night. There were tons of people working on their laptops, catching up with friends, etc. Definitely a great place to hang out and get work done. Their menu consisted of savory items such as sandwiches, a lot of interesting lattes/ coffee, teas and desserts. Desserts and drinks come in different sizes for sharing or sampling. I was drawn here by instinct because my cousin frequents this place. Before stopping by next time, I will definitely try to be more prepared by looking for more popular items listed on Yelp.
author: Jennifer Z.

description: Nice cafe with good desserts and welcoming setting. Lots of people in here working, even late night on a Monday. Ordered the red bean shaved ice. Quite good, coming with shaved ice, condensed milk drizzled over, small pieces of mochi, and red bean. Large is enough to share between a couple people. It was a pretty classic fruit tart, good but nothing extraordinary.
author: Jacob D.

description:
My bf and I stumbled upon this place looking for a late night dessert spot and are certainly glad we went in!  Very cute and intimate cafe spot- luckily it was quiet enough to relax and chat with other people.  Wait-staff were also attentive and seemed to be pretty quick in preparing your orders.  Didn't get to try out the internet connection but looked like people around us were satisfied with it.  

We both got a small shaved ice- I got the red bean shaved ice and my bf got the strawberry.  It was a perfect size for an individual.  

I liked how the red bean version included almonds, misugaru and mochi in addition to the shaved ice, vanilla ice cream, and red bean for texture.  

The strawberry version was sweeter than the red bean version because of the strawberries and strawberry syrup (it had strawberry ice cream, strawberries in syrup and shaved ice) but didn't have other condiments.  

There were so many other things on the menu that I wished I could have tried as well (waffles, sweet potato latte, honey bread, savory sandwiches)- already planning on making another visit to try more items on the menu

All in all, a very cute cafe to work in, chat, or go for coffee/ tea/ muchies.  I'll definitely be back in the near future to taste some more items on their menu and will probably bring my laptop to do some work there too.
author: Audrey H.

description:
this is the place where I usually get my Asian desserts if I don't feel like going to the Richmond District.
their shaved ice are pretty good even if it's kinda overpriced.
author: Rudy H.

description: I loved this coffee shop and went here almost every day during my stay as it was near my hostel. The coffee was on the small side but strong and delicious. Also, there was plenty of room for me to grab a table and work for a bit without feeling like I was being rude to other patrons.
author: Chris F.

description: very very sub par ice cream / coffee shop .. Came here after dinner for some dessert while in Nob Hill the other night .. the yelp page made it seem as thought they were over flowing with choices .. but once I got there , they had two cakes and three flavors of ice cream .. that was it
author: Micah W.

description: Cute little Korean cafe in the middle of the city. I came across this place, looking for somewhere to recharge my phone and chat with my friend later in the night. This place was one of the few places that served were open at 11pm-ish and fit the ambience we were looking for. I only ordered their small serving of green tea shaved ice (patbingsoo) and i have to note how ingenious this idea of a single serving of patbingsoo is. Granted, the aesthetics of a huge bowl of patbingsoo is more pleasing but I was the only one in the mood for some shaved ice so I got the small serving. It still had all the toppings it needed and I enjoyed it just as much. Wish I could return to try some of other things they offered. It's a nice small place to just chat or study!
author: Gina B.

description: This is the only place in SF that has authentic Korean bingsoo! Very simple yet delicious. $9 for a large green tea bingsoo which can serve about 3 people. They also have really cute cakes that are delicious as well. I have been here about two times and I get impressed every time.
author: Grace H.

description: Affiagato was great. Chocolate dessert was thick and silky. We also got cafe latte which was decent. May grab a coffee if I am in the area.
author: Nidhi D.

description:
Popular place for a weekday evening! Lots of people connected to their wifi doing work. 

Came here to catch up with some friends over some Korean shaved ice. We opted for the green tea flavor with nuts taken out (allergy issue). Ours came with green tea flavored ice, red beans, mochi and a scoop of green tea ice cream on top. The first half of the dome was good and very flavorful. The flavored ice is creamy and blends well with all the flavors. However by the time all the flavored ice is eaten, all that's left is regular ice, pretty bland and tasting like straight up ice - which it was! 

We saw, or should I say smelled, an order of honey brick toast sent over to the table next to us. It smelled so good! Will have to try that next time. 

Very Korean. Would come back if in the area again or craving shaved ice or brick toast, however, not running to return right away
author: Carissa G.

description:
A cute little cafe!

Decided to go for an adventure across town from union square to try this place out. A friend of mine recently went here and loved this place so much that she suggested that I go too. It is about a 10 min walk from union square. If you are like my sister who was busy catching Pokemon, that 10 mins is nothing. 

When we got there, it was a small cute little cafe. The atmosphere and decor was very inviting. There were a lot of people who were on their computers, reading, and socializing. A downside is that there is limited seating here. My sister and I ordered a small green tea shaved ice. I noticed that the prices on the sign was a little different that those that previous people have posted on Yelp. A little price jump. We got lucky and got a place to sit, since a couple had just left. When the green tea shaved ice came it was so cute looking. IG worthy! There was mochi, red bean, and almonds with the green tea ice cream. It was really good! It didn't look like there was a lot but even a small my sister and I had a difficult time finishing it. 

Overall, it was a pleasant experience. Will be back in the future to try another shaved ice or drink!
author: Jeanette Q.

description: Nice ambiance, fun music but the greens in the sandwich were so wilted they were beyond inedible. May come back for drinks but most likely to avoid the food.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Good shaved ice and coffee. Fast free wifi. 

Our green tea shaved ice was yummy. Lots of ice, ice cream, red bean, almond and some other stuff. My caramel latte was good as well. Open late and a good stop for some tasty shaved ice. We didn't order the waffles but it smelled awesome.
author: Ticha B.

description: This place lacks authenticity, trying to be something its not.  Everything was just a bit off. Service cold and unfriendly, my Espresso con panna was just sad. Even my wife's naked juice was partially frozen.
author: Ryan B.

description:
I come here every day for lunch and order a ham and cheese croissant. Its always delicious and comes with a tasy side salad. Its very reasonably priced, and the service is always excellent!! 

Today i got my usual ham and cheese croissant and cappuccino, the cappuccino was really good too! Bravo!
author: Christopher R.

description: Really cute place to meet a friend or study/work for a while. Good amount of outlets and WiFi. They have some sandwiches and desserts, but I just had coffee. It was delicious
author: Allison G.

description:
My husband and I went on a late night adventure in sf and decided we wanted something sweet to eat. I looked up some places and found Joys Place, it had a lot of good reviews so we stopped by. 

Parking was such a hassle! Of course, since it is a Saturday night and sf gets pretty busy! It took us almost an hour to find parking.

At last! We finally arrived to Joys Place 30 minutes before closing time (11:30pm, they close at 12am). This is a very small cafe with cute decorations on the wall. I was so disappointed that we were only able to order drinks and whatever sweets they had left since it was closing time. 

Darn! If only finding parking wasn't such a pain in the butt. Either way, I ordered myself a carmal latte and my husband got a chocolate milk espresso mocha along with a slice of cheesecake and a tiny strawberry cake.

Even though I couldn't order what wanted...I was still very happy with the desserts. The cheesecake was delicious and fluffy...not too dense, which I like. The strawberry cake wasn't overly sweet...it was very good. My husband enjoyed it very much. The drinks weren't too sweet. I have a sweet tooth so I thought my caramel latte could've been sweeter, but i was still very pleased with my order. 

Now I HAVE to come back and I'll make sure to come back a few hours before closing time haha.
author: Sandra L.

description:
Great Mocha and good ambience. 
Just not so fancy coffee place. Good service as well. This place is busy normally, as I went around 3 pm and there was rush.
author: Tushar A.

description: Cute coffee shop & coffee was good & quick service. It's also more than coffee...there are also sandwiches & desserts & cute artwork. I almost ordered the hot chocolate. Maybe for next time!
author: Dana W.

description:
This is my first time in this place and I really love it! It's really hard to find caffe shops with this type of ambience, free wifi and nice coffee open until midnight in town. 
The ambience is not noisy, good size Cousy room. It's the perfect place to study, work in the computer or only have a good conversation time with friends. 
About the food:
The chicken spiced panini (I think that's the right name) was ok. Not great but not bad, it is served with a salad.
I confess that over look at others people's tables and the asian deserts look great, definitely next time I will try them.
The latte was good. 
I like the environment and music, the place is clean and the staff is very cool also. 
This place was my salvation last night and I definitely go back. I'm very happy I found this place.
author: Bella C.

description: This is the second time we are in SanFran and we had to stop at Joy's. We had the waffles with ice cream, the red bean shaved ice and the cheesecake and everything was amazing!
author: Ari Y.

description:
Came by before dinner on a slow and easy-going Thursday to try their patbingsoo. And what an extremely awesome first experience with Korean shaved ice! Thanks Joy's.

We were in the Tenderloin area waiting for a show later on that night at Social Hall, so we got a green tea/matcha shaved ice SMALL for kicks while we did some planning and google mapping in their wifi-equipped cafe.

I didn't think I would like their shaved ice, since I don't like Hawaiian shaved ice. BUT this is completely different. I loved the green tea ice cream because it wasn't overtly sweet, and their toppings were perfect. Where do y'all get your mochi--I loved it. Their azuki beans were perfect in amount because they tend to be pretty sweet. ALSO for those with nut allergies, they can take out the sliced almonds and almond powder!! SCORE :) this wins me over because dietary restrictions are no fun, and your modifications helped this girl out!

They had a lot of other cafe items like varied coffees and baked goods. The two baristas/cashiers there seemed super bored and happy to make our order. Thanks to you two for the friendly and helpful service! I would totally come back to chill here or do work since they don't play obnoxious club music or anything.
author: Jodi H.

description:
Great atmosphere.

Friendly staff.

Good place to chill, hang out with friends.

Delicious drip coffee.

Definitely will come back
author: William W.

description: First time trying here. After eating mensho tokyo. The green tea latte stood out from all the other drinks. I got it in hot and it was delicious. Much recommended.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Pretty nice korean coffee spot, there's not too much parking around,  but that's typical of this area and you probably know that if you are headed over here.

The drinks are all pretty standard, I wish I had tried the sweet potato latte because that seems to be a signature drink of this place, but instead I got the Dutch Coffee and was left a little unimpressed.

There's stable and reliable wifi, but the seating is quite limited here, so as long as you can find a spot, you should be good to do some work for some time if that's what you want to do!
author: Andrew T.

description: Omg words can not explain how delicious this red bean shaved ice cream was! I've had red bean shaved ice all over and I have never had one like this, absolutely delicious
author: Gabriella S.

description: Got shaved ice here. Good place for late night desserts, but the actual shaved ice itself wasn't amazing. It was just decent like other shaved ice places and honestly needed more toppings and to be slightly bigger! It was a little small for my liking.  However, it was still a good shaved ice - ex. wasn't clumpy or tasted too diluted. Flavorful. The space is small through so it is hard to find a seat and likely might have to get take out or wait a bit. Also had to find parking - tough to find parking in the city.  But it was a clean spac.e
author: Okapi C.

description: Went for the honey bread, was pretty good.  Husband got the waffle, and it was a bit overdone, tasted slightly burnt... Decorated cute on the inside, looked like it had a lot of good coffee options, including a sweet potato latte.  We went around 8:30-9 pm, the place was packed, but only had one employee to take orders, make drinks, and bake waffles.  Thus, it took a while for the food to come out, and when it did, the two desserts came out 15 min apart.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Joy's has an adorable atmosphere with cute artwork and friendly employees. I always get the red bean or green tea shaved ice. A small is enough to share for two people, especially since I've never sen anyone finish a large. 

The cafe also doubles as a good place to work and catch up with friends.
author: Stefanie K.

description:
Cute spot that kind of removes you (physically and mentally) away from the busyness of the outside world. Looks like a place you'd find in Korea.

The green tea shaved ice ($5) was okay. Ice was in slightly bigger chunks. Red bean was smooth and creamy. Green tea ice cream was a bit light. This whole thing actually tastes better when it's mostly melted because it turns into a pleasantly sweet drink.

The cafe is filled with mostly individuals working on their laptops, a few pairs at the tables, and a couch for two.
author: Shannon L.

description: A cute little cafe in an area that needed a place to take harbor from the storm. Nice decor, friendly service and good prices on their coffee and pastries. I'll be back next time I'm in the area.
author: David A R.

description: Joys Place was cute and cozy. Service was fast, the lady working was so kind and sweet! Great coffee and sandwiches. Macaroons are amazing also. Highly recommend for a quick stop
author: Victoria H.

description: Good little cafe. Coffee is "good" but not fantastic, but overall the service is good and they have good food options. The cheese croissant is a good option, as are the waffles. Check it out if in the neighborhood and looking for something simple.
author: David P.

description: The desserts are good, but they're not fresh. The person working the counter took one look at my group and kind of rolled his eyes and had this look on his face like we were sub-human. I got a pretentious vibe from this place.
author: Susan C.

description: I came here with some friends to grab some sweets. From other yelpers, they have shave ice, and we were stoked about it. They also have coffee and waffles, other options you can choose from. We wanted to get their green tea shaved ice, however they were out of it so we decided to go with their red bean shaved ice. The portion was big, good to share with 2-4 people. I expected the shaved ice to taste like red bean, but it was just condensed milk over ice. It was topped with vanilla ice cream, peanuts, mochi, and sweet red beans, presentation was nice. Price was about $9, not too bad if you're sharing with others, but still pricey. Overall, this coffee shop has a cute vibe to it but dessert wise was mediocre.
author: Noel K.

description: This place is known for their bingsoo and other desserts, but I've only tried their sweet potato latte (and multiple times at that), which is incredible. I've never come across anything quite like it - it actually has sweet potato puree in it and tastes so real (and not cloy or artificial). Nothing like a good sweet potato latte to warm yourself up. Note - the coffee part wasn't really apparent to me, they really emphasized the sweet potato flavors (not even sure if there is coffee in this?). My friend tried the green tea bingsoo and she loved it. The venue is super cute and has amazing late-night hours. Lots of people flock here to study and hang out, so it's been packed every time my friend and I dropped by. Free wifi, outlets, what more could you ask for? You've got to check this place out!
author: Katherine Z.

description:
What a cute lil coffee shop. I came here for dessert after dinner at Sanraku after seeing the delicious shaved ice photos on Yelp! To my surprise, most of what's on the menu are coffee related products. I came here with a group of 5 and none of the larger tables were available so we decided to take it home. Most customers appeared to be doing some kinda work even though it was a sat evening. It didn't seem like the best place to chat and catch up with folks. 

My large green tea shaved ice came with mochi and red bean. Kudos to the staff-- they were nice enough to box it for me when they realized I wanted my order to go. We enjoyed it a lot! It's not overly sweet and satisfied my craving. I like the soft sweet red bean that came with it. :) I would totally come back again if I'm in town!
author: Rosana C.

description:
The coffee here was great, nice and strong, this includes in the affogato. 

The shaved ice was very underwhelming. I've had it before in a number of other cities. This was the plainest janest version I've ever encountered. I can't speak to the baked desserts. The service was good. Staff explained that the caramel machiatto was an espresso shot, not a big drink. It was nice to get the heads up.
author: Chad R.

description:
Preface: One of my new fav desserts is shaved ice cream, NOT hawaiin shaved ice. 

When I got here, I saw that they just shave regular ice and was like ugh, I'm going to hate this... but then when I got my green tea shaved ice, i was like HMMMM, this is pretty good!

Only thing is, it is SUPER sweet. I shared a small with a friend and together we ate maybe half. It was way too much, especially after a big dinner.
author: Angela L.

description: Ridiculous place when they overflowed my cup of coffee and asked me to drink it. Really? They also talked to each other that they would change another cup or make the new one for me? I believe if I didn't watch them, they may have put my coffee to another cup after they messed it up. Bad job!
author: Helen K.

description: I had a yummy Caramel Latte with such a pretty foam design here! The cheesecake & fruit tart are tasty, as well!
author: Jasmine G.

description: Got kicked out of here at 11pm on a Saturday; seems like is not open until midnight on the weekends contrary to what it says here on Yelp. I haven't been through all the menu but what I tried is ok-ish or below yet overpriced. Yelp needs to add one more dollar sign to this place because this is not what I consider cheap. I just keep coming here because I haven't found any other place that is open as late as this one and I wish I find one that is open even later than 'midnight'.
author: Alexandra T.

description:
I bought a strawberry shortcake and a green tea latte. After I was the review, people said that sweet potato latte was good, was planning to go back tomorrow morning but I found a mold on my strawberry in the shortcake!!!!! This is absolutely disgusting and I will never ever go back there again! 
Giving a customer a MOLD cake is simply unacceptable, how long has the cake been in the display fridge?!
author: Jacinda C.

description:
Super cute korean cafe in SF near Union Square. 

I ordered the green tea bingsoo (large $9). Portion sizes are huge (SPLIT WITH A FRIEND!) and they don't skimp out on the toppings which include green tea ice cream, almond slices, mochi, red beans, and more! Really delicious and would come again.

Also a really cute setting to get some studying done (most people around have their laptops out)
author: Alicia L.

description:
My husband and I were around in lower non hill area for lunch which is 10 min walk from our house. After a nice sushi lunch, my hubby was craving for something sweet and found this place. Initially I was skeptical but when I saw the red bean shaving ice, I was like " let's go right now ". 

Their red bean shave ice did meet my need for Korean dessert ! It just tasted like the ones I was having in Korea except they didn't put enough Mochi but it was good enough to feel nostalgic about Korea.
author: grace k.

description: Nice coffee shop with decent chocolate mousse cake and nice decor indoor and free wifi to study in. Service is normal, not the friendliest staff but they do have shifts so it's probably by chance.
author: Kira L.

description: This place started to grow on me until tonight with my most recent visit. I paid for a large tea,$3 right? Got a small. Without the tea...I put in my own bag as soon as I got home.
author: Abe M.

description: Sooo good. Went there with my family when I came to visit them on a Work trip and we all got something different. The coffee was bomb and strong and my fruit tart was super tasty
author: Apple C.

description:
We found this place on Yelp while looking for a desert spot on Christmas night...LOVED IT!!! We're from LA so we're very familiar with the awesome desserts Koreatown has to offer and this place definitely compares! We got the strawberry shaved ice with mochi, the waffle, and the honey bread. Everything was delicious! The waffle and honey bread come with huge sides of whip cream and vanilla ice cream...heavenly!!! I highly recommend this place which opens late if you're looking for a sweet treat in Union Square. 
Also the prices are pretty good!
author: Marcela M.

description: First time here, it was alright. Despite the fact that i saw a really good friend of mine here but other than that, bleh... the food was good but maybe because we came kind of late so not much of a selection. The hot drinks was a no no! Maybe i'll give this another try and i'll forsure come earlier than we did last time
author: Mary A.

description:
It's hard to be unbiased when you trek across town for a waffle and the shop's machine is broken, but on top of that, this coffee cafe doesn't offer vanilla syrup even though they have almond, mocha and sweet potato lattes.  WTF

On top of that, no non fat milk so they get 2 stars for the ambiance which is hip and clean.
author: Lucky S.

description:
That sweet potato latte is dope! Milky, smooth & full of flavor but not utterly sweet. Perfectly blended w/ sweet potato, yum!

It was so good that I came back twice while visiting for the weekend. ...Need I say more?
author: Olivia S.

description:
Good study spot right by union square! I came with a friend to get some studying done around 6pm on a Thursday and we were the only ones inside the cafe except for one other girl. But beware, by the time we left at 8pm the whole place was filled. I didn't even see where all those people came from! 

Joys is a good place to study or to catch up with a friend...or even meet up for a tinder date? Which I believe I witnessed while there. There was a really strong connection too! (Talking about the wifi, not the potential couple....really, the wifi was strong and fast.)

I ordered the sweet potato latte while my friend ordered the matcha latte. I asked for mine to be made decaf, to which the worker responded, "it's already decaf." Umm...I was confused by this...what cafe uses decaf espresso as their default in drinks. Unless there's not even espresso in it? Idgaf at the time though - the drink actually tasted really good! It's definitely a unique drink and there were tiny chunks of sweet potato in each sip, which was awesome. And it wasn't overly sweet, either. But definitely do NOT order this if you're looking for a caffeine rush. You won't get it.
author: Cheryl N.

description:
Good late night treat stop when you're out and about after dinner. It can get packed sometimes so get in where you fit in.

All the treats delectable and tasty, always go for the waffle with ice cream, total fatkid status
author: Ikaika F.

description: Repeat after me, HONEY TOAST. HONEY TOAST. That's what you MUST get here. I heard about this place from my friend whose obsessed with their honey toast and guess what, now I am as well. Perfect sweetness balanced by the honey and cinnamon. Not to mention, the vanilla ice cream elevates the toast to the next level. LOVE IT. I'll definitely be coming back just for that, and I'd love to try their shaved ices as well!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
underwhelming

The shaved ice was bland and watery.

Workers didn't seem to want to be there

just a bad vibe man
author: Phillip S.

description: i was craving for a korean ice dessert and behold! this cafe had red bean shaved ice and made for an individual size! The space is filled with college/start-up type customers.. all clacking away at laptops and smart phones.. enjoying coffee and iced drinks. I was in and out in a hot sec, but it seems like a nice space to work or grab coffee!
author: Tiffany L.

description: This cafe is incredibly cute and the worker was very helpful!! Definitely recommend for good food that not only tastes good but looks good as well!!!!
author: Sidney C.

description: The $2 coffee has died almost every where else in San Francisco, so it's refreshing to see a place still maintaining great, low prices and long hours. The grilled cheese is also quite good at $8.
author: Zachary T.

description:
Honey bread. If I had a mic, now would be the time to drop it. But seriously, the honey bread is ridiculously amazing. I wasn't expecting it to be that good. I wanted more, but the serving size was so big that I could barely finish it (and didn't want to seem like a fatty cake getting another order for the road). Not to mention, I just came here as a chill place to study. I definitely wasn't expecting to find good eats along the way.

Great place to go if you need to hit the books, looking for a nice day date or a place to just hang out and people watch (this place always has a nice crowd rotating in and out). Despite the heavy rotation, it's not too loud, so you're able to still get some good studying completed. 

Likes:
-HONEY BREAD
-hot tea with Honey bread
-any food or beverage option with honey bread
-good place to study if you're looking to capture that coffee shop vibe (or just like studying in coffee shops)
-variety of small bites and sweet treats to fuel your study endeavors
-moderately priced
-oh, and did I mention the Honey bread??



Dislikes
-doesn't cater to groups larger than 4 (some people try and meet in bigger groups here, but it's hard to find and/or together seating for everyone to engage in a natural manner)
author: Tracy T.

description:
It's a great place for coffee and desert. 
First time visiting in San Francisco and I have to say, the best desert I've had all week. 
The red bean shaved ice was delicious, my boyfriend had the waffle with ice cream and that was delicious too. 
It must be a popular coffee shop for students because my boyfriend and I were the only old people there. 
I would definitely recommend it, and will return before heading back to NJ.
author: Lorna C.

description:
Joy's Place is arguably my latest Korean crush...

...It's a modern, charming cafe that would be the perfect place in a Korean drama for the CEO's son to bring his girlfriend, and the girlfriend would be hungry and blissfully devour an expensive dessert. Actually this is sort of what happened, except my boo is not the heir of a corporation (as far as I know). Moral of the story: girls like pretty and tasty desserts P:

I usually do not fall for shaved ice, but Joy's Place makes green tea red bean bingsoo like a work of art. 
- The green tea shaved ice was mildly sweet (to my liking) and was very refreshing and light like the satisfaction you get with eating watermelon. 
- The red bean topping was like the soulmate of green tea ice, and the almonds added a nice crunch. 
- Don't expect anything fancy for the green tea ice cream (I know, all San Franciscans are spoiled with all the craft creameries); treat the ice cream scoop on top like an appetizer for the shaved ice entree underneath. (Also, you must give credit for the aesthetic, perfectly round scoop) 
- The mochi topping was tasty too and I want to say I would have liked more, but I think it's better for me to eat less candy with this gigantic mountain of a dessert.

$8 seems pricey for a dessert, but the fact that it is shareable, undeniably photogenic, and extremely satisfying concludes 5 stars.
author: Edna C.

description: Nice little cafe! Got here a little after nine at night and it was still somewhat lively. Quite a lot of people around, mainly on their laptops doing work. It's nice that they close at midnight, giving people a place to do work late out. My friends and I shared the large green tea bingsoo. It was so yummy! Very large portion! Shared between three people and we still weren't able to finish it. It had mochi, green tea ice cream, caramel, red bean, and shaved ice. So delicious! If only it was located somewhere more convenient, I'd always come here.
author: Annie H.

description: Came here to sober up on their cozy couch with a mocha and dessert with my man. Loved the ambiance, really quiet and chill with good vibes, nice staff and clean environment to relax.
author: Emilie P.

description: I ordered a sweet potato latte and it was so delicious! Very unique and sweet. They have variety of dessert such as maracons and cakes. Also this cafe has plenty power to charge laptop!
author: Yujin J.

description:
LOVE their shaved ice and honey toast!! Super chill and cute cafe in SF Union Square!

FOOD: The 3 of us shared a large red bean shaved ice ($9) and a honey toast ($7). The portions were huuuugee and we were SO FULL by the end. I HIGHLY recommend both!! I loved everything that was in the red bean shaved ice - a scoop of ice cream, red bean, mochi, almond slices, taro pieces (?) and shaved ice! Everything went so well together!! The honey toast, which came with a bowl of vanilla ice cream and a giant whip cream with cinnamon powder, was just as tasty. You should definitely try eating the toast w/ the ice cream! Yum! 

PRICE: With tax the total was around $17 (about $5.5/person), which was not bad at all!! Definitely worth it for the quantity, and more importantly, the quality of the desserts!

SETTING: There are 5-6 tables inside and a few more chairs. Very spacious and but kind of hot inside too...There are street parking available but just make sure to read the parking signs! 

SERVICE: You order and pay up front and they'll call you when the food is ready. We waited about 5 minutes.

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Love it! Probably the best dessert place I've been to so far in SF.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Yummy food/drinks, great atmosphere, awesome service, and fast wifi! This place has everything I could want in a cafe. It's a great place to work or study - there are outlets and individual tables to do so. It stays pretty quiet too, despite a constant flow of customers throughout the day. People also come to hang out, but everyone was very respectful of the quiet atmosphere. The tables are small so there may not be places to sit if you come with more than 4 people!

There's a pretty simple menu, and everything on it is good. There are a couple types of sandwiches, some desserts, and some beverages (coffee/tea). The different types of coffee are displayed on the wall with pictures of their different proportions of milk/cream/foam/espresso. Super cute drawings and helpful when deciding what to order! 

My favorite thing was the green tea shaved ice ($5 for a small, $7 for a large), which is green tea-flavored shaved ice topped with red bean, mochi pieces, almond bits, syrup, and a scoop of green tea ice cream. All of the food here is presented beautifully and is made to order. The employees are super nice too. Would definitely be back for many reasons!!
author: Kathy C.

description: Joy's place saved this sweet tooth's life as she couldn't find any place nearby (except some chain stores) open on a Sunday night. And then this place made her extra extra happy with the big portion of strawberry Korean shave ice cream. Some people like the shaved ice more blended but I quite enjoyed the graininess. The quantity of strawberries was more than sufficient but a little more ice cream would be nice. The coffee looked promising being demonstrated in cool wall art but this girl had sleep to catch. From the interactions with staff, it seemed like this place enjoys regulars who come to hangout or get work done. Always a good sign. Only cheesecake and macaroons were on display, so I may have to come back at less ungodly hours for more dessert fixes.
author: Sadia I.

description:
Such a cute little Korean coffee shop, and let me tell you why:

1. Awesome ambiance: great for a catch up session or getting some work done. (Majority of the people here are coding - very typical SF.)
2. Service is friendly and smiley.
3. Their chalkboard art is amazeballs!
4. Paninis are $8-9 and comes with a salad.
5. Patbingsoo aka Korean shaved ice ($8) comes in red bean or green tea flavors. One order serves 2.5 people!
6. Coffee ranges from $2-5, and they have sweet potato latte!
7. Free wifi: password is at the counter.
8. They take credit card! #win

Check out this place and enJOY! :)
author: Christine S.

description:
This place is super cute! Even though it's near Union Square, it wasn't really crowded at all around 7pm on a weekday. Their portion sizes for food are much bigger than I thought. I actually shared a small green tea bingsoo with a friend and it was surprisingly filling even though there were two of us.

Comes with wifi and places to charge your laptop so if you ever need a cafe to study at, this is it :)
author: Cassie Z.

description:
Cute, chill, cafe! 

It was a full crowd on a Monday night with people either drinking coffee and catching up or studying. I loved the chalkboard wall art and the ambiance gave off a cool, cozy, relaxing, JOYful vibe. 

My boyfriend and I were trying to find a late night dessert spot and discovered this place! I like that it closes late. We shared the waffle with ice cream and whipped cream. My boyfriend thought it was too sweet for his liking, but he still enjoyed it for the most part. I thought the combo of ice cream, whipped cream, and waffles was a nice night snack. 

I want to come back and try their drinks and other desserts!
author: Kristal D.

description:
Green tea ice cream patbingsu with roasted almonds, mochi, adzuki red bean toppings! I am in dessert heaven.
It's highly recommend to share this with somebody since the portion can be intimidating (especially post dinner, dressed in your tightest skinny jeans)
The place is cozy to hang out in with a good book.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Joy's is such a hidden gem! I found this place via word of mouth and not yelp, and was surprised that as a dessert connoisseur, I had never heard of it before. But ever since, this has become one of my go to spots after dinner especially because of its convenient location!

The vibe was not what I expected from a dessert cafe, but I personally like it. It is quite quiet, and the decorations make it feel very homey and comforting.

The menu is also nice and simple, with not an overwhelming amount of items. I've tried their red bean and green tea shaved ice, waffle, and honey bread. Their shaved ice is korean style (delicious), waffle includes ice cream (pleasant surprise) and honey bread is huge, though a bit sweet.

I would recommend Joy's to everyone I know, but then I'd also like to keep this place a secret haven
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Tried the small green tea shaved ice and even though it didn't look like too much it actually tasted great. There was a drizzle of something like honey over the green tea ice cream and the shaved ice itself came with red beans. Overall quite delicious but would prefer that the ice itself was more shaved.

The ambience of the cafe was really nice and many people were studying. The sweets also looked really appealing and will come back to try them!
author: Louisa Z.

description:
I have declared this place as my favorite cafe in the city, despite the neighborhood and average-comfort-level chairs.

I love how it's a bit noisy and crowded with fobs here regardless of the weeknight. (Yes, I've been here Mon-Sun.) It's a very nice place to do work and eat patbingsoo (aka. Korean shaved ice). The green tea one is definitely the best. The service is great and I love how there are some holy books on the shelf. Praise Him. 

I also really like how people speak Korean here; it creates this not-in-sf-back-in-asia vibe that I really appreciate. The sweet potato and green tea lattes are really creamy and good, not that high on caffeine - I think. The pastries on the other hand....will not be included in this review so that it can be set at 5. (Hint: It's not that great.) 

Good wifi, open until 12am.
author: Juliana P.

description: I came here to try something out at 4:45pm on a Sunday, but there were no seats. All of the tables were taken by hipsters on their laptops. Not going to give them my business if they don't even have seats...
