author: Gilda W.

description: Got the waffle w/ Green Tea ice-cream! Super tasty! I would recomend getting the red bean ice-cream though.
author: Brett J.

description:
Joys place! I can't give a full review but GF wanted dessert with our wine at the hotel so I ran up here to snag something. 

We had the chocolate mousse which was really good! 

The other photo I posted was of some type of red bean ice cream dish which looked amazing.
author: Willard J.

description: I have only gone here once but it's was very pleasant. The food and drinks are great. If you are into taking pictures the food and drinks are very photogenic. This cafe also just has an overall fantastic appearance. It also has almost zero line which compared to Starbucks is a huge plus. Five stars!
author: Stewart C.

description: Came there after wandering around nearby Union Square. Pretty interesting vibe -- went on a Saturday night and found mostly students hacking away on their laptops. Wish they had more chocolate on the menu! :)
author: Zachary T.

description:
Patttbiinnnngsoooo! Get me in on that green tea shaved ice!

Shaved ice w/ all goodness on top- green tea flavoring, condensed milk, green tea ice cream(!), mochi, sliced almond, red beans, etc. There was a hint peanut butter taste in there, which I love. 

Shaved ice prices- $9 large, $5 small. Other flavors are red bean and strawberry. 

They also serve paninis, drinks, and other desserts. My friend got a spiced chicken panini (comes w/ side salad), and she really enjoyed it. 

I came around 5:30pm on a weekday, and it was 90% full with most people were on their laptops. It seemed like more a working crowd. My friend and I were catching up so felt slightly outta place chatting as everyone was zoned in to their screen.  Place sits about 20- 25 people. 

I would come back again for the shaved ice!
author: Joanna L.

description: Nice little cafe. It was very quiet when we visited although there were people hanging out on their laptops. We loved the comfortable sofa while we drank our hot chocolate and ate our macaroon and fruit tart. Highly recommend stopping by if u want to take a rest from walking around. Cheap too.
author: Nessa S.

description: While looking for breakfast on a public holiday I noticed this place was open and decided to give it a try. Latte was good, and so was the croissant. Tuna roll was huge, so be prepared to share it or save some for later.
author: David D.

description: A cute, relaxing Asian-style cafe with adorably tasty desserts and drinks. We split the large green tea shaved ice among 3 people. Generous amount of ice with a light green tea flavor and piled with sweet red bean paste. Ice was a little clumpy but easy enough to break up. The green tea ice cream on top was not too sweet with a strong cream flavor - my favorite part of the dessert! It was wonderful to find a cafe open so late (until midnight), and it was a perfect, warm space to chat, relax, and hang out at night after dinner. Gentle classical music and free wifi would make it ideal for studying as well. Definitely will be back if I'm in the area to try some of the honey bread, waffles, and sweet potato latte!
author: Hali M.

description:
One on my favorite dessert places in the city!

Delicious Taiwanese shaved ice with red bean, condensed milk, mochi, and green tea ice cream! 
$5 for a small, which is plenty for one person, or $9 for a large, enough for 2-3 people.

They also offer coffee, baked desserts, fruit tarts, and more. I recommend their child veered "Dutch coffee," oji style.

Lots of students work here, which can make seating hard, but has a nice vibe. 

Parking is a pain since its in Nob Hill, but worth the effort!
author: Greg B.

description:
Awesome little coffee shop. Lots of tables available so you can study! Against one wall is a long bench seating, and there are some outlets under the seat. The place is really clean and comfortable feeling. Tasteful decor. Open early AND late!

Their sweet potato latte is $5, and I decided to give it a try since I love sweet potato. It actually tastes like sweet potato. I think some sweet potato bits in it? It's sweet, which suits me just fine.

Came around 9 AM on a Thursday and plenty of seats available, but I can definitely see this place filling up later in the day. Free wifi available. The food menu looks short but sweet (if I were hungry, that honey bread would sound quite tantalizing).

Epic instrumental music. THEY JUST STARTED PLAYING THE LORD OF THE RINGS SOUNDTRACK. I am officially in love.
author: Josephine L.

description:
PACKED! Small cafe with a decent amount of tables, it was hard to maneuver around the place. It's cozy, that's for sure. Lots of people saying it's a good study spot. Personally, I like space. So if you don't mind being pretty close to someone, then Joy's Place is a cute cafe for you! It's a slightly quiet atmosphere. For conversational reasons, it may not be a great idea to be talking too loud or anything too personal.

Menu is simple. Drinks an dessert. No real food though. That can be a pain while studying hungry. I ordered their Affogato. DELICIOUS! The espresso was very strong so the ice cream worked well. It's more of a dessert than a drink though. So beware. 

I also ordered a Honey toast w/ green tea ice cream. Presentation was pretty. The first bite was super sweet with a second taste of butter. Yes, too much butter. The toast began to be very very soggy. Not sure if it was due to the whipped cream or butter on top, but it went through all three layers of the toast. Not a super big fan. I like the thicker toast which is crispy from beginning to end. In the end, I felt like I was eating honey bread instead. 


Not my ideal place for coffee in S.F. area. But it's cute and I like the decor. I'll be back for their Affogato whenever I'm in the area.
author: Fiona L.

description:
After going out pretty much every night while on vacation in SF, we were looking for a more low key place to hang out on a Sunday night. We found Joy's Place and it turned out to be a nice cafe with a really chilled out vibe. They had free WiFi and were playing R&B slow jams from the 90s and 2000s the entire time we were there. Bonus points for that. A couple of Asian guys seemed to be running the place and they were both really friendly. 

I'm not a big coffee guy at all and I learned more about the various preparations of coffee from their illustrated menu board within a few minutes than I ever knew before haha. A bunch of us just decided to share a few of the their desserts. 

Affogato - It's like a root beer float, except with coffee. And they gave a double scoop of ice cream...I like their style.

Red Bean shaved ice - This was way bigger than we thought it would be. It was a good thing we were all just sharing it. This reminded me of a Filipino dessert called halo halo. It was basically plain shaved ice that's sweetened with sugar and then a ton of different types of toppings thrown on it. At the very top they threw on a scoop of vanilla ice cream too. The sweetened shaved ice was my favorite part. It created that sweet/cold combination without being overly rich like ice cream. Despite the name, I wasn't really a big fan of the red bean part of it. I just wanted to eat that shaved ice with those little pieces of mochi mixed in. 

Honey bread - Talk about a decadent dessert. I'm pretty sure these slices of bread are basically just soaked in butter and then toasted. You really do taste the butter in every bite. It's simple yet so delicious. Butter soaked bread with whipped cream and ice cream on top? Yes please. 

Overall Joy's was a nice cafe with a cool vibe, great music, and huge tasty desserts.
author: Mike M.

description: Great desserts! The fruit tart was good, but should have had the waffle! Looks amazing and everyone there had one!
author: Dave B.

description:
We stayed in Hotel G for our anniversary. While we were out for a walk around night time, we wanted something sweet and I found this on Yelp. I got the small red bean shave ice and husband got latte. I enjoyed the shave ice and devoured it so quick. Red bean was a bit too sweet for me though. Husband liked his latte coz it was strong and had good flavor. 
Only complaint is the place was a mess. Garbage overflowing. It was pretty busy when we came but still important to keep the place clean.
author: Claire J.

description: Came here on a Saturday night after eating at Mensho. Decided to get the green tea bingsoo and it was about $5.50 for a cup. This place has wifi and lots of seating. I would come back again just for the bingsoo!
author: Tina C.

description: Had the waffle, comes with whipped cream and ice cream. So delicious! Split it with a friend because it's huge!
author: Shondra M.

description:
This place is so cute! I'm loving the chalk menu and it's a cozy place to study. Seating is comfortable and cute.

I got the red bean shaved ice and I'm actually glad it's ice bits and not snowflake ice. I like the crunch and the mochi is a nice addition. Also tried the sweet potato latte. I was impressed and truly fell in love with it. Legitimately tastes like sweet potato puree. Next time I'll be back to try the cakes!
author: Rachel L.

description:
The bingsoo here hit the spot after a nice walk around San Francisco. 
Only thing that was not too great about the place was the limited seating, but other than that I have no complaints! 
The cafe was very relaxed and quiet; the workers were quick and kind; and the food was delicious.
author: Gabby O.

description: I'm only giving this place 4 stars because of how packed it was and because people don't know how to give personal space! -_- Anyway, the honey bread was AH-MAZING. Buttery, sweet, warm...everything you could dream of in a dessert. It comes with two big scoops of vanilla ice cream as well! I can't wait to come back!!!
author: Jaclyn M.

description:
Had the honey bread for $7.00 and it was overly sweet. This is coming from a person that thoroughly enjoys all sweets. It came with 3 slices of white bread, 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream on the side and topped off with whipped cream. Most other places that serve honey bread or bread box/houses offer it very soft and fluffy. It was toasted here and was very toasty and crunchy.

Between each slice of bread was lathered with honey which made it too sweet. The ice cream melted too quickly after getting it. Not worth the money. 

The place has free wifi and lots of seating area for people that want to study or chill.
author: James H.

description:
What is this piece of poop. 

Keep in mind I am a huge bingsu fanatic (had bingsu from all over the world, including the motherland-- Seoul). I came in here expecting some nice bingsu due to the great reviews left by others, but had to eat a pile of poo instead. 

Not only was it just crushed ice (with random large pieces of ice still intact) with red bean, pieces of mochi, and an ugly scoop of green tea ice cream with scattered almonds, but the presentation was terrible. Maybe I just came in at an off day. Maybe the "shaved ice" just sucked. 

Whoever eats pieces of crushed ice with basic toppings thrown on- kudos to you. This place just did not meet my expectations.
author: Bernice X.

description:
Went for a snack this evening.

We had the spicy chicken panini, which was basically a curry chicken salad sandwich on dutch crunch with some greens with a little splash of raspberry vinaigrette on the side. We also had the red bean shaved ice, the green tea shaved ice, and the honey bread. 
The red bean shaved ice came with vanilla ice cream, toasted almond, condensed milk and mochi.  The grean tea shaved ice was basically the same, except with green tea ice cream. The honey bread was a huge pile of warm bread with ice cream, honey, cinnamon, whipped cream and toasted almonds.

I ate more than I should have and now I dont feel good about myself. In fact I feel about how I feel after a meal at McDonalds.  

Finally, a word about the people here. The counter help are nice, but the patrons appeared to be a mix of East Coast and SF doosh ( who sits at a small crowded cafe with their stupid blue tooth in having a loud phone conference? Go outside already bud. )

I almost added a 4th star just because they're open late which is a really good thing, but then I sort of got stuck at the mediocrity that was the panini and Mr Big Important Loud Conference Call Guy. If you end up here because it's late and nothing else is open dont get a sandwich. Get the red bean shaved ice to share. It will be enough, and you might not end up feeling totally gross after you eat it.
author: El B.

description:
Came here last night to try out their shaved ice since it was quite convenient. We got the green tea shaved ice to share amongst two people.

The ice, itself, should not be called 'shaved ice', but rather 'crushed ice'. I believe that the ice should be fluffy, but instead I was welcomed into chewing on some hard bits of crushed ice. The green tea ice cream was a sizeable scoop, but tasted rather standard. There were also red bean, almonds, and a skimpy mochi toppings. Overall, the taste and presentation was okay, but I really found it a chore to be eating the ice (which was scantily clad with green tea syrup). 

Not my cup o' tea and for $9, not too great.
author: William C.

description:
Cozy spot with free wifi, great for travelers - Joy's Place is near two different hostels I've stayed in. I really liked studying here, it feels tranquil. It does get loud at times though.

Not a lot of food options but it does the job. The grilled cheese isn't bad!
author: Pamela S.

description:
Honestly, everything here tastes like crap, either too sweet, too dry, too icy, or too watery. 

I ordered pretty much everything on the dessert menu, namely honey toast (which was lathered in way too much cinnamon and syrup), green tea shaved ice (too chunky with ice bits, and the green tea flavor tastes artificial), opera cake (this type of cake is my favorite chocolate cake, but Joy's place completely destroyed what a true Opera cake should be), green tea latte (way too sweet, couldnt even finish 10% of it).
author: Betty T.

description:
I've come here twice with friends to satisfy our late night bing-su craving (Bing-su = Korean shaved ice!). Goes without saying but parking is a NIGHTMARE (do not be like us and think parking at any time of the night downtown would ever be easy). We came late, around 9-10PM and the place was still pretty packed with people. It can get pretty stuffy and warm in there and given how loud it is I personally don't think I could study/work here. But moving on to the most important question...is the bingsu any good? And the answer is yes, very much yes! 

We split two large bingsus for a group of 5 (a small size is like in a cup the large is definitely more worth it!), the red bean bingsu and the strawberry bingsu. I've had the green tea before but they ran out this time (so disappointed...) but the red bean bingsu was so good, even better than the green tea actually! The shaved ice was kind of milky and sweet and the red bean and vanilla ice cream was the perfect compliment! We ordered the strawberry next and definitely not our cup of tea...the whole thing was blood red drenched in so much strawberry syrup. Waaaaay too sweet and artificial :(

Overall though, super thumbs up on their bing-su (except for you, strawberry bing-su) and I would definitely come back whenever my sweet tooth acts up again :)
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Joy's Place is still one of my favourite cafes in San Francisco. Good drinks, great sweets, clean, reliable wifi, and pretty consistent service.

However, had I tried their Grilled Cheese on my first visit I never would have come back. It looked pretty.... but damn, can looks be deceiving. For starters, it's a bit expensive for what it would be if it was good.... which is really a problem when it's awful. The bread isn't much grilled.... it's more a soft squishy grease sponge and it's just not the right bread for this sandwich. If I was rating the sandwich alone it would be a regretful 1 star. I think this may be the only meal lately where I ate my salad first. I tried to eat the grilled cheese but the texture actually made me gag. I didn't have the nerve to send it back though. That's the problem with food that looks tasty but actually isn't.

I should've gotten the waffles (which I also had recently when there and was determine to order food but never again a sandwich). Now those are good! Fresh made perfectly cooked waffle goodness with whipped butter, syrup, fresh fruit, and a bit of ice cream. That hit the spot nice.

I also like their lemon sweet tea.... it's name is too long but it's a nice little warm beverage when I'm having a sweet tooth but not wanting something either warm or not as artificial as soda.

The really need to take that grilled cheese off the menu, though. It's a huge black mark of awful on an otherwise dependably decent to excellent selection. I tend to finish my meals or take them to go.... that's one of the first ones in months I didn't and I felt relieved throwing it away. Should've taken it back for a waffle. Live and learn, I guess.
author: A J.

description:
Strawberry Ice Cream w/Shaved Ice

Nice place, l needed some  cold before  Zzz and Work. Excellent Ice Cream to Shaved Ice ratio.
Worth the 500 calories.
author: Food Sage W.

description:
I came into the shop because it was close to my hotel and I read the previous Yelp reviews. Anyway, I came in at 10:25pm and just went straight to the counter. 2 Asian guys were working, one is in the kitchen organizing and the other was the cashier/barista. 

The guy at the register was finishing the customer before us and in the mean time we were looking  at what they had for dessert. 2 little cakes on the bottom shelves at the top right corner were some French Macaroons. 

The guy finishes his cash transaction and begins to help us. 

My BF ordered  a small hot chocolate and the chocolate little cake. I went with a bottle water and 4 Macaroons. He stall for a few seconds, shrugs his shoulders  and decided to just grab my macaroons with his BARE HANDS. Knowing that his hands were dirty. I probably would have been okay with it if I saw him wash his hands 1st, but he just didn't care.  I call him out on it and I tell him I want new ones and to please use gloves. He got upset and began to say something in his native language. (Koren, Vietnemese, or Mandarin not sure) I'm almost positive he told the guy in the back that he was going to make the hot chocolate extra HOT!! He did! He made it extremely HOT. It was boiling hot!! 

Fortunately, that drink wasn't for me! Once he finished making it he remembered that I ordered the water bottle and was just upset. I told my BF not to even drink the hot chocolate anymore because i knew what you did. 


CASHIER GUY: BY LAW YOU HAVE TO WASH YOUR HANDS whether you like it or not. If you don't like your job QUIT! Stop being so revengeful!!!!
author: Lillie S.

description: Came in here to get some work done and loved their seating by the window.  The menu is on the wall, literally, which threw me off at first until the guy behind the counter explained it to me - which was super nice of him.  I had the mocha which was deliciously sweet.  Only thing that annoyed me was a group of people having coffee there were all watching Japanese cartoons on their computers very loudly...without head phones.  It was hard to get work done even with headphones in because of the loud volume. Kind of which the employees would have asked them to turn it down, but again that is nothing against this place, and I will be going back again.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: I love this place and the sweet potato latte but haven't had it for awhile. Last night I went there and get myself a sweet potato latte, I was so happy till my first sip, the milk taste like it's bad but I'm not very sure so I take a second sip, after the second sip I'm pretty sure the milk is bad. I was so disappointed, also my stomach been sick all day today.
author: Wanion J.

description:
A quiet place to grab a drink or snack. Both times I've visited in the evening, it was packed with quiet people and reminds me of a starbucks with no seats. Great place it seems to sit and read, study or work (if you can get a seat).

The first time I tried the sweet potato latte which is a pretty rare concoction. It wasn't particularly spectacular. The green tea latte I got the second time wasn't very good for $5 - I've tried many better ones before (last one was from never too latte). The bread was an interesting treat and there are some good looking desserts in the fridge. I guess it's a good take-out place if you are nearby, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go to Joy's place, and it hasn't proven worthy of a 5th star.
author: Alfonso C.

description: This place was great. Good prices and good desserts. Don't let your eyes get too big. One guy works the place. He was a stud doing it all on his own.
author: Tony L.

description: Shockingly tasty and very flavorful! Expected this place to be just another mediocre coffee spot with just an okay taste but was very surprised to find out it is VERY delicious. Their matcha green tea latte is just a tad too sweet for me but oh so very very rich and tasty. I also got to try their mocha which was robust in rich chocolate flavor but did overpower their espresso (which was also not bitter as with most other coffee drinks) good balance and unique in flavor that differentiates them enough from other coffee shops. Only thing is, the staff was not too welcoming. Other than that, glad I randomly tried this cool lil joint! (Not hipster at all, in a good way!)
author: Anna C.

description: Came here for breakfast and it was peaceful and quiet. The waffles were great and the caramel latte was amazing. This place seems great to enjoy coffee in the morning.
author: Alyssa C.

description: The treats were absolutely fantastic. Between our waffle and whatever other chocolate delight we had, it was a 5/5. The latte we ordered however was more warm milk than anything else. Maybe there was coffee in it? Maybe there wasn't! That was definitely a 3/5 and so here we are, a total of 4/5. I'd definitely go back though and even give the coffee another try.
author: Sohrab O.

description:
Joy's Place is a pretty cute coffee shop. I came in with a group of friends after dinner to try their green tea patbingsoo (shaved ice). It was $7 for a large and $5 for a small. Since I was sharing w/ my friends, we got the large one, which was enough for 4 people. The patbingsoo consisted of red beans, a small scoop of mochi, and a big scoop of green tea ice cream. It wasn't served in a round bowl like it traditionally does; instead it was put into a boat shaped bowl. 

Anyway, I noticed that a lot of the customers there were Korean-speaking and many of them were studying or conversing among themselves. This cafe wouldn't be the best place to study if you cannot tolerate loud music. I have to say that their coffee menu is on the cheaper side so I would probably come by here if I'm ever in the neighborhood.
author: Emily L.

description:
Honestly, just order the coffee. lol 

Green tea shaved ice - nothing to rave over. The ice was barely even shaved lol. Don't get it. ($8)

Waffles - Tasty! Comes with a side of ice cream & whip too. ($7) 

Ordered both for my boyfriend and I to share... and the cashier said, "that's a lot for two people." Needed to make a quick excuse because my boyfriend and I could probably finish a whole pig if we wanted to, tbh. 

I ended up just saying,"we're not from here, so it's ok." LOL :-(
author: Leana E.

description: Great coffee shop with good service and reasonable prices. My favorite is the fruit pastry.
author: John L.

description:
This place is really CUTE! It's a very clean, bright spot - perfect for meeting with friends or getting some work/studying done as a number of people were on their laptops. There were still plenty of seats when my friends and I stopped by early afternoon on Saturday. The service was very quick and friendly.

I ordered the caramel latte ($4) and cheesecake which both hit the spot. What I really wish I had gotten was the red bean shaved ice. The people next to us ordered it and it was a HUGE serving that could easily be shared among several people and looked so delicious.

I would come back here for trying the more unique items like the sweet potato latte, honey bread, or shaved ice.
author: Linda X.

description:
Mocha - 5/5
Service - 5/5
Ambience - 5/5

Perfect neighborhood coffee shop for your morning or late night caffeine cravings....haven't tried their shaved ice options but then I can't eat that much ice cream in one sitting either. 

This is my regular go to place whenever I am in union square.
author: Vikas J.

description:
I ordered a waffle and an earl grey tea here for a total of $10. They made my waffle to order and also had soy milk for my latte! I saw the guy mixing it up and making it, it's nice to know my food was going to be fresh :)

The waffles were topped with almonds and powdered sugar and came with whipped cream, syrup and vanilla ice cream. They were more dense than light and fluffy since they're the square type but they were REEAALLLY TASTY!

A lot of people were doing work in the cafe on their laptops so the place was pretty busy but still calm. They have really lovely SF drawings on the wall and adjacent to that have the menu written out along with drawings of the different coffee drinks and what they consist of. I thought this place was nice and quaint, would come back if I was in the area...but the seats weren't the most comfortable haha
author: Hana S.

description:
Fan of their internet and hours! Good place to get a drink and get some work done.

Enjoy 17.81 Mbps down / 2.68 Mbps upload speeds!! That's possibly the fastest speed I've seen at a coffee shop. I'll gladly take that with nice ambiance and music at Joy's Place. Not to mention their desserts can be a pretty guilty pleasure...

I think a lot of others feel this way as well, because the cafe is usually packed in the evenings after 9pm (yes, even on Fridays). Try to get here before 8:30pm to snag a seat with a table!
author: Audrey L.

description:
Perfect place for Korean Bingsoo (shaved ice)! Whenever I buy shaved ice, i get more ice than anything else. But not in Joy's Place! 

I tried their Red Bean Bingsoo (small $5 and large $9) and it was soo good! They dont overload your dessert with ice, they were generous on the condensed milk, redbean, mochi and ice cream! Real good deal for $5

This is a cool cafe to study too! If you're a college student and your room is too distracting, come here! They have free wifi and large tables.

Cheers!
author: Inge C.

description: Ok so it's not terrible but the bagels are Kirkland bagels and it's a five dollar minimum to charge to a card.  Pretty average.
author: nancy w.

description: The waffle was made fresh, and served with ice cream, whipped cream, almonds and syrup. Its very reasonably priced, and the service is always excellent!
author: Neriah K.

description:
3.5 stars

Green tea bingsoo until midnight in the heart of the city?  What? I don't have to go all the way to the Inner Richmond/Sunset to fulfill my craving for shaved ice?  Great hours and location serving a niche.  But, with that comes high prices.  The large green tea bingsoo cost a hefty $9.  Sure, it was delicious.  Green tea heavenly ice with deliciously creamy green tea ice cream, topped with almonds, red beans, condensed milk (basically the magic ingredient in all Asian desserts), and mochi (chewy rice cakes--trust me it tastes much better than it sounds).  When our order came out, I noticed it did not have mochi...which is like the most important bingsoo topping ever.  Thankfully, when I asked the servers about it, they gave us a cup of mochi because a mochi-less shaved ice would be so sad.

I was pretty surprised by how crowded the place was around 11:00 on a Friday night.  But, it's smart for them to stay open late.  Now I know where to go to get my late night shaved ice fix without having to drive too far!  I've definitely had better $9 bingsoos...but this is pretty much the only one you can find in the city without driving to Inner Richmond/Sunset.
author: Jess Y.

description:
I loved their shaved ice! Two friends and I shared a large green tea shaved ice and thought that it was big enough to make all of us quite full afterwards. They were generous with the red beans and mochi as well. If I lived somewhere close I can imagine coming here almost everyday. 

Next time, I'll try the sweet potato latte! 

Also, I noticed that most people here were studying/doing their own stuff. My group was the only one there to chit chat and chill. It didn't bother me but I'm concerned we could've bothered other people studying. Something to consider.
author: Becky M.

description:
Bruce is an amazing barista! So helpful! And so knowledgeable! He taught me a lot about coffee, lattes, espressos and cappuccinos. 

I ended up getting the cappuccino with some honey. It was so good I came back the next morning for the same thing.

This place has a great 'city coffee shop' vibe. Very inviting! I highly recommend this place.
author: Rachel M.

description: In the day and age of coffee, we just don't. Which leaves us in a pickle because we order hot chocolate and you never know whether you're gonna get Swiss Miss or a sad, burnt milk, gritty soylent mixture that they're passing off as hot chocolate. This place doesn't do that nonsense. It's actually a really good cup of cocoa and you can get waffles and ice cream in the middle of the night.
author: Heather R.

description: The place had a very good sweet potato latte, very rare to find it anywhere. It's a Korean coffee shop, so tons of Asian customers stay inside for cup, chat with friends or study on their laptops. It gets very crowded on weekdays. I like the atmosphere and nice music. Overall pretty relaxing place.
author: Alice S.

description:
Stepping into this cute and cozy cafe, I was already lifted by its welcoming and charming decor!

The cafe shop is centered around the theme, JOY and you can see it visually displayed on their cups and artwork!

I enJOYed the selections - particularly the specialties of offering shaved ice, waffle, honey bread and affogato on their simple, chalkboard menu.  Their Green Tea Shaved Ice with Red Bean and Mochi toppings and Affogato was made with careful attention to detail of quality and flavor.  Their espresso was surely strong.

It was a JOYful experience with their convenience of complimentary Wi-Fi!  I lingered here for quite a few hours and they offer plugs for whatever you need to charge - in my case, my laptop.

You can feel the JOYousness of the staff members here!

I was definitely overJOYed!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This would be my new study spot before work starts, as it's not too far of a walk from downtown. I adore this place! The environment reminds me of those cafes you see in Korean dramas. I couldn't stop marveling at the decor when I paid my first visit. It was like stepping into someone's house for a cup of coffee/tea. I couldn't help but compare it to YakiniQ Cafe but there's some differences. 

Joy's Place is quite small so the seating is limited. Also, like most Korean places, you get your own utensils and water by yourself. It's a good spot to get some work done or catch up with a friend or two. 

SWEET POTATO LATTE: Love it! Definitely my new favorite drink if I don't need coffee for the day. It's not too sweet and has small bits of sweet potato in the drink. 

HONEY BREAD: It's good when you have your first few bites. Then it starts to get sweet and will end up as leftovers if you don't share this with at least three people. My friend and I only reached halfway. It's a heavy treat as it's served with whipped cream and a side of vanilla ice cream. Probably won't order this one again... Once is good enough. 

GREEN TEA BINGSOO: I've had my fair share of bingsoo and this place tops all the other places I've tried. For $8, you get a massive amount so it's definitely worth the price. I couldn't stop plowing my way through this dessert.. Makes me want another one right now. It's also aesthetically pleasing so pictures were definitely taken. 

Do check this place when you can! Oh, and they accept card. That's a win in my book.
author: Emily M.

description: Walked a good distance to grab some coffee and sweets. No waffles available, no nonfat milk, no vanilla latte. The coffee mocha was okay, very average. The chocolate mousse was pretty good but I don't believe they made it.
author: Dean P.

description:
A nice place for coffee and studying. The internet can be slow sometimes. The quality of the coffee or the Tea or the desserts is great. 
However it can be very hard to find a seat at night. It's such a small tiny cozy place.. They have amazing desserts if you're in the mood. Baristas are Korean and speak Korean. The whole atmosphere is so nice and exotic a little. I love how they wrote the menu items on the walls in such an artistic way.. 

I used to go there a lot because it's one of the rare coffee shops open late and yet decent in SF..
author: Ahmad A.

description:
Yay for yummy sweet potato latte and being open late! After a show at the Orpheum...wanted to have some dessert...and this place was one of the places open late. 
Tried their cheesecake which was ordinary but the one thing you should definitely try here is their sweet potato latte. Its so unique. It has chunks of sweet potato in it and your usual latte...SO good!
author: Sharon Q.

description:
4 STARS because of free wi-fi, awesome lattes and cozy space! Less a star for no sockets.

The Joys +'s:
+ LATTEs ($5) that include an awesome green tea. Sweet Potato Latte is my fave though.
+ FREE WI-FI. Unlike some cafes, they welcome patrons who need to log-on.
+ MUSIC is audible and not blaring. Bring your own headset if you don't like soft jazz.
+ EDIBLES seem tasty. Haven't tried but grilled cheese, tuna melt, honey bread ($7?!) and red bean shaved ice ($8?!) sound fetching.
+ COMFY bar stools that face the window or find a spot against the wall. Plenty of tabletop for either type of seating.

The Humbugs -'s:
- Electrical sockets? Where are they? Don't have a hand crank or solar power to revive my laptop or phone.
- HIGH PRICES for edibles. I don't get it. Why does ice cost $8?

TIP: Much joy at this place. Consider having a fully charged device since sockets do not abound. Great wind-down or pick-me-up that is off of Union Square mayhem.
author: Yiven C.

description: I love Joy's place! Such a great ambiance - definitely a great place to study or catch up with friends. I definitely recommend the sweet potato latte - it tastes just like a sweet potato. It's amazing.
author: Jessie Y.

description: Nice Korean shave ice! Pretty good portion even for a small, two person can share it and feel satisfied. My five stars still goes to Taiwanese style shaved ice though:p
author: Julia Z.

description: All I ordered here was a bagel, but it was still cold in the middle when I ate it, and it was more like a bun than a bagel. It was fine.
author: H M.

description: This place had good quality coffee. I had a mocha and after a few minutes, it actually woke me up. I like the menu on the wall! It demonstrates what in each drink is, and for a visual guy like me it was perfect. I personally thought that was pretty cool and helpful if you can't decide what you're in the mood for! I'm not from SF, so I'm not sure if I'll be back. But I would recommend this place if you want good coffee!
author: Milad S.

description: Not sure why Yelp bills this as a dessert spot bc it's more like a coffee spot with 3 desserts and juices to choose from. Regardless, it was small and clean with friendly servers. I have to admit they only got 3 stars bc the coffee was just not good. Cheap beans with a sour taste. I'm all for supporting small businesses but I'd honestly go to Starbucks before coming here again.
author: Discretio ..

description: The environment is super warm and joyful, with good Wi-Fi connection- a good place to work/study/chat with old friends!! I ordered red bean shoved ice (small), and it's unexpectedly good!!
author: Lingxue H.

description:
The place is pretty good for reading, talking, studying, or simply relaxing. 
The employees are pretty and friendly. 
The drinks are good. 
The environment is pleasant. Good music. 
This is a good place to be productive. 

There are not many coffee places that would close at midnight near downtown and Nob Hill. This place is great and I hope it stays open for many years. 

So, let's support this place =$
author: Alberto W.

description:
Cute cafe filled with a young crowd of people hanging out with friends or with their laptops. We came after our dinner and the entire place was filled up so we were standing around for a minute trying to figure out how to gather enough chairs for a small round table. Magically, however, four tables slowly left the place and suddenly our choices for chairs and tables opened up. 

The bingsu (shaved ice) here is very reminiscent of the ones I had in Korea. We got the large green tea bingsu to share among the five of us. There was a lot of red bean as well as mochi and roasted almonds and some peanut powder. A big scoop of green tea ice cream went on top and it was just amazing. I am pretty sure we devoured that dessert in less than five minutes with all five spoons digging and carving little caves in the bingsu. 

This is a great spot to hang out with friends and just bond over a big bowl of shaved ice as you catch up. Place is very cozy and has cute plants and coffee art on the wall. Only downside is that it is near downtown so parking would suck. Bonus is that they open late!
author: Diana C.

description: I got the waffle and omg each bite was like the first so yummy I definitely recommend trying it out I also like the environment really cozy and comforting
author: Destiny A.

description: Had the strawberry  shaved ice. Was tasty  but think  it could  have been  better with fresh fruit instead of frozen fruit. Good flavor nice  ambiance and music  and a nice place to hang  out.  unfortunately,  chubby korean cashier was a little rude . Thats what affected my 2 star rating.
author: Bekah Cow ..

description: Favorite spot to stop and grab a coffee before I get to work. The espresso is excellent and the prices are very good as well.
author: Nathan B.

description: Awesome cappuccino and ice latte!! Can be a cozy place to stay for a while for working/ reading/ etc.
author: Yeseul S.

description: Simple but refreshing shaved ice. There's a decent number of seats and free wifi so it's a pretty good study spot. Service does their job but has never been super friendly. Overall not somewhere I'd go out of the way for but I would stop by to get some work done.
author: Noor V.

description:
One of the highlights from a recent trip to San Francisco, Joy's is a cute, comfy and un-obtrusive coffee shop with great coffee/desserts/atmosphere.  Perfect for a quick coffee or a long study session.

We tried the affogato and the shaved green tea ice cream - both were wonderful!
author: Mary W.

description:
I came here with my friends after we got some pastries from Mr. Holmes Bakehouse and wanted to grab some coffee to eat with.
The guys working there clearly saw us walking in with the box, and while we were grabbing seats. 
We ordered our drinks, and ONLY AFTER we were picking up our drinks did he tell us "oh, we don't allow outside foods here." SERIOUSLY?? You couldn't have told us before we placed our order? . 
What a cheap way to make sales.
author: JungIny M.

description:
The desserts here are sickeningly sweet, one dimensional, and unauthentic. I've tried the bingsoo and several cakes/pastries. None were worth the carbs. The place is also filled with the smell of smoke because the managers allow people to smoke outside.

Nevertheless, I come here all the time because it's a very convenient place to study at night! It's open until 12AM! I typically just order the tea -- can't go wrong with tea.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Desserts: Strawberry Shaved Ice

After dinner, my bf and I came here for some sweets.  We ordered the strawberry shaved ice.  It can't go wrong right? No, we got a strawberry soup.  It was not shaved ice but literally soup.  I don't know if they forgot the ice or was being cheap about ice, but it was disappointing. However, they do take credit cards!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
No star/zero rating. Desperate eaters only!

Chose Joy's based on late hours open & previous ratings (can't figure out why 4 stars?!?).
FOOD: see pictures. Horrible, like airplane food. Coffee menu on wall NOT available?!
Grilled cheese tasted like it was taken out of a vending machine. And salad tasted very commercial. See pictures. Coffee was fair. Tasted like it was made from instant.
SERVICE:
Minimal. Trash overflowing.
author: Jeanette A.

description:
Called Joy's Place but it's the exact opposite...new name should be called No Joy Allowed - SHHH Be Quiet, You're Blinking Too Loud Up in Hurrr :(  Also, don't carry any $20 bills to this cafe, they actually don't have change. I ordered a latte for $5, but had to pay by card since they didn't have $15 to give me back as change when I handed them a $20.

Came here a day before and had a nice time with a girlfriend on a Thursday. We had a sweet potato latte and patbingsoo. Both were good at the time but so sweet we were in a coughing contest afterwards. 

Came back another day, this time a Friday night to hang with a group of friends. Everyone around us was loud with chatter, and the sound system was blaring so we had to talk loudly to communicate across the table. After a few minutes we got a hang of the volume, so we finally could hear each other, had good laughs...but then came the lady shusher. She walked up to our small cramped table and shushed us and glared at our backs!! If this was a library, it would have been more appropriate. Of course, it was so loud in there I couldn't hear what she was saying, but my friends relayed that she's telling us to be quiet. After some time, another guy came - this one looked like he worked at the shop - the man shusher. He came over and shushed us :( He was rude and condescending...and when we got quiet, the other groups around us were being super loud. ..but we didn't see the man shusher running up to them and acting rude to them. I guess it was even ruder, since they pick and choose who to yell at.

Being nice and courteous to your customers go a long way. Based on how oppressing the experience was, some signs that need to go up: SHHH!, No laughing allowed, no cash allowed, no joy allowed. I guess this place will be good to study since there are professional shushers here - but then again you might be typing too loud and they'll yell at you for that too.
author: Lynn L.

description: I'm from Southern California, and this place reminded me a little bit of LA. The vibe here similar to the vibe you find in K-Town coffee shops. It is a nice little place to just get drinks/desserts and hang out.
author: Do P.

description:
They have a limited menu but their drinks and food are delicious. Not to mention, they have a steady and strong wifi connection so it's the perfect place for studying so freeload away!

I was there for a long time and enjoyed a latte, waffles, and a caramel latte. Their drinks are nice and strong, my style.

The place is large enough to accommodate a decent amount of people, but because it's such an excellent place for studying or just reading, you might not be able to find a seat. 

I was there during the holidays so they were able to fit a cute Christmas tree smack dab in the middle of the cafe.

Would definitely come back, next time for the food.
author: Cam C.

description: BY FAR MY FAVORITE DESSERT PLACE IN THE CITY. Get the honey bread. You won't regret it. The hot honey bread mixed with the vanilla ice cream and whipped cream seems so simple, but it's like an explosion of happiness in your mouth.
author: Jessica J.

description:
This is a pretty cute cafe place to go to for late night dessert in the Tenderloin area, I come here quite a bit just because I stay around the area for SF excursions with the boyfriend. 

I unfortunately have not tried any of the drinks, but have had both the shaved ice and honey brick toast for dessert before. 

The Staff was very accommodating with our requests to switch ice cream flavors every time we've asked that of them. 

The shaved ice tasted really good with green tea ice cream substitute, a perfect compliment to the red bean inside as well as the nice texture and flavor of the sliced almonds and Kinako (soy bean powder). I've had fluffier shaved ice before, but it still tastes pretty good. (:

I am not the BIGGEST fan of the Honey Brick toast -- the toast is crunchy on the outside but quite soggy and a little too sweet because of the amount of honey drizzled on it as well as the amount of unnecessary whip cream placed on the plate. It takes more than 3 to finish that sweet beast. Again, I asked to substitute the ice cream for green tea, and the staff was very nice about letting me swap it out with out extra cost. BEWARE, if you do not like Cinnamon (like my boyfriend, whom I was sharing it with) they sprinkle that on the dessert. I did not know this, it wasn't on the menu... 

Overall, friendly service but the dessert may be a little on the sweet side at times. Very cute atmosphere, many students studying and cute decorations all around. (:
author: Maggie Y.

description: Yelped this place for a quick breakfast on a Saturday morning. I got a latte, which was very good and my friend and I split a ham and cheese croissant. The croissant was huge!! It's definitely a sandwich and comes with a side salad that was dressed with this strange sticky sauce...  The croissant was very good and service is fast and friendly.
author: Yenny D.

description:
It's been called to my attention that I never reviewed this place, despite the number of times I've visited, which is... surprising. Honestly though, there's not too much to say: I've only ever come here for the patbingsoo, which is massively generous in portion size, and fantastically delicious in flavor, and definitely ideal for sharing. But hey, everything can be a personal serving if you try hard enough.

As for the place itself, it's a nice, chill little cafe that's been packed every single time I go, so seating can be a little hard to find at times. You'll usually find it occupied by folks busy working away on their laptops.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - On the smaller side, as far as cafes/coffee shops go, with about 2/3 of the seating being accessible: those along the walls were bench seating, and there's lower coffee table seating towards the right as well, leaving only the middle aisle and outer seats along the sides accessible.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: The only basis for this review is the Belgian Waffle I have had there. They are close too perfect. Not too crisp, not too soggy, with syrup and flaked almonds, served which a scoop of ice cream! Perfect for sharing. I am not a big fan of whipped cream so I was happy it was on the side and not on the waffles! We came in from the biting cold during the christmas week and the warm waffles and coffee just made our day!
author: Y J.

description: Sweet potato latte was quite good but $5. A lot of people doing work over the Wi-Fi. Good ambience but high temperature.
author: Alison D.

description:
Convenient location near Union Square, this is a great place to study or get some work done! Free wi-fi (with password at the front counter)!

I like how there's a chalkboard menu and chalk art on the wall. Unique! I like the ambiance here. Very cute and not too noisy.

They don't have sizes for their drinks. It comes in a standard mug or paper cup. Their drinks are a bit more expensive than the standard coffee shop, with drinks going up to $5 (green tea latte + sweet potato latte). Definitely try the sweet potato latte just because you can't try this flavor anywhere else! I didn't really like it though since I don't like the taste of sweet potatoes (and the taste is quite heavy).

Honey bread $7 was pretty delicious. 3 thick toasts, whipped cream, and vanilla ice cream. The toast itself was okay. Very filling though.

Waffle $7 came with 2 waffles, vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, and syrup. The waffles were so hard I could barely bite it and ended up not wanting to eat it. The ice cream and whipped cream were good though!

I believe this is a Korean based cafe because most of the staff and customers are young Koreans in their 20s. There are not many places in SF I've been to that are predominantly Korean so this was interesting!
author: Vicki L.

description:
Price - 4 stars (cheap by SF standard)
Food - 3 stars (tastes so average and stingy in the portion)
Service - 1 star (deal killer)

We walked in and had to initiate the conversation to get our orders in. The lady who works here is clearly unhappy and couldn't bother with ANY customer service. When we placed our order (30 seconds top) her face showed absolutely no emotion and it was as if we owed her money. Would never come back and seriously regret even tipping them!
author: Alan N.

description:
Yikes!!! Couldn't find any Joy at this place.  It was a nice Friday late night, my friends and I decided to come in and try out their coffee. This place was so ridiculously packed. While my friends and I finally found a tiny spot to sit down and enjoy each other's company, this Korean worker walked up to us and literally said "KEEP YOUR VOICE DOWN!!!".  Holy cow!!!  He got super pissed at us for just laughing out loud. The problem is that other people were loud also, I don't understand why we were targeted. People here were very rude.  Another female customer who was obviously friends with worker at this place, kept giving us the death stares while I simply waved at her and smiled.  She doesn't intimate me at all, silly bitch.  

Coffee: it was mediocre... Nothing special.
author: Pauline M.

description: BEST INNOVATED RED BEAN SHAVED ICE EVER!! I take one bite and I'm immediately blown away by the Flavors and textures that totally complement each other! I have eaten many shaved ice places but this one brought me to my childhood with a modern twist on it off course. I also took a bite of my friends strawberry shaved ice, it's reminiscent of the frutista in Taco Bell. I like how they use real strawberries and overall the strawberry shaved ice is light and refreshing especially after eating something heavy. The green tea shaved ice is another dessert I recommend here! It's green tea with a serving of red bean, Mochi, and this sugar milk powder along with toasted almonds and honey with a scoop of green tea ice cream.
author: Roseanne V.

description: absolutely delicious! took a strawberry shortcake and a chocolate fudge with raspberry filling to-go and they were so good! (my personal favorite it the strawberry shortcake) the staff is also super friendly :)
author: Sid V.

description: I really do hate and rarely do give poor reviews but here it goes. Upon entering, I immediately felt ostracized. When I walked in, everyone looked up and I felt out of place. The one worker was on his phone and I was not getting a very welcome feeling. Everyone was on their computers and there were no tables. They advertise as a desert place since we were looking for some good desert, but all they had was a couple pastries and waffles. I can't judge the food because the vibe and lousy service had me turning back around and out the door. I would only go back in there and feel ostracized if all other desert places in the area closed. The food is probably good but the atmosphere just was not welcoming at all.
author: Marco M.

description:
Good dessert, though hard to find a table.  My friend and I split the $7 waffle, and it was a perfect size to share.  It was delicious, and the toasted nuts were a perfect topping.  My latte was also good.

However, there were only two tables available when we went in, one of them being squished between two people working silently on laptops (as many people in the establishment were).  After watching other customers come in, seems that we were lucky to have gotten a table at all!
author: Leigha A.

description:
Cute little cafe with lots of customers on their laptops!

Came here for the bingsoo(shaved ice) and it was pretty good! My friends and I ordered a large green tea shaved ice. It didnt look as big, but will great for two people to eat:) The almonds were fresh and sweet while the shaved ice was perfectly sweet! The core of the shaved ice is unbreakable haha!

U CANNOT GET THIS ANYWHERE ELSE IN SF! so far this is the first place Ive eaten bingsoo at. Even korean stores/restaurants do not serve this
author: Josie D.

description: The green tea shaved ice was super tasty. The almonds on top gave it a crunch while the ice cream gave it texture in addition to the green tea shaved ice. Must try if you're a Green tea fan.
author: Christina T.

description:
Sweet potato latte.

If there's one thing that will keep you coming back to this Korean-run coffee shop, it's their $5 sweet potato latte.

Yeah, the sweet potato purée probably comes from a carton, or is a powder reconstituted with milk...but who really cares, it's so good. Rich. Creamy. Frothy. Subtly sweet.

Their $7 honey bread, which is thick toast all honey buttered up and served with ice cream, whipped cream, and slivers of toasted almonds, is overwhelming but delectably delicious. Their whipped cream is bomb.

How people do productive work here, I dunno. I just food coma for the next hour or two. Will sleep for their sweet potato latte!
author: Adele F.

description: I run a Thursday evening Meetup at a cafe in the same part of town.  The current location is now on winter hours, meaning they will close at 8 pm instead of 10 pm for the next few months.  One regular attendee suggested Joy's Place since they stay open late, so I checked it out earlier this evening.  As others have noted, it.s small, clean, quiet and charming.  Unfortunately, as at least one other reviewer pointed out, they keep the room temperature up high enough that you feel a warm blast as soon as you step inside.  That's probably okay if you're planning to be there for 10-15 minutes worth of snack and drink.  Unfortunately, it would be impractical for a Meetup where every attendee was planning to get at least two hours of work done.  Hopefully I can find a recommendation for downtown cafe that stays open until 9 pm or later, with maybe at least one large table where a pretty quiet group can get together on Thursday nights.
author: Dean L.

description: From the reviews, I was super interested in trying the sweet potato latte and honey bread. Both are as good as they sound!! But! I will say i was sad they didn't offer a soy substitute because it's all pre-made :[ is it worth the stomachache tho? YES.
author: Sayoko O.

description:
Great waffle!! Comes with ice cream and lots and lots of whip cream! More like a dessert it's not breakfast but I'm on vacation so for me it was the best breakfast. Caution though it's big so you have to share; only if you want.
My husband got the ham and cheese croissant, it comes with a side of greens it was very good. Cheese was melted over ham perfectly. Customer service great!! Very nice young lady and man.
author: Abby S.

description: Sooo yummy, the place has a cool vibe and open late. Good portions and quick service. Lots of people doing work here
author: Camly T.

description:
One night, I was really craving for shaved ice /bingsoo so I dragged my friends with me to satisfy this craving. Mind you, this place was extremely hard to spot, not to mention you're going to have 0 luck looking for parking. 

The portion of the bingsoo was huge, quality wise?... It was eh. I've had better. The worker were nice though. :)
author: Tracy V.

description:
I though this place was going to be amazing because of the Yelp reviews I read but everything was just ok. 

It's a small place with a very small menu and very few option. We were there for desserts. There were only 3 pastry options. The Opera chocolate cake was yummy but the strawberry shortcake used egg white frosting instead of whipped cream which for a strawberry, it's a disaster . My latte was good.  

The service was terrible. I ordered everything and they charged me. They gave me each item one by one so I had to go back and forward between the register and the table like I worked there. A small tray would have helped or if they brought our orders to the table it would be better. One of our pastries never came so I asked for it and the girl told me we hadn't paid for it. I asked for a receipt and she didn't know how to do it. I wanted the pastry anyway, I paid and she gave me the pastry with this look like I had made the mistake. Ridiculous!
author: Melody K.

description: Go to Joy's. Eat the damn waffle. I gained 10 pounds over the weekend because our hotel was dangerously close to this place. The waffles are serious business.
author: Shelly B.

description:
Get the green tea shaved ice! Best eaten after a full meal of cheeseburger, fries, and buffalo wings. The toasted slivers of walnut and the mochi were nice touches - my favorite was the scoop of red bean dolloped on top. I thought the waffle tasted oddly grainy, but I was nearing physical pain at how unbelievably stuffed I was, so maybe my taste buds had just given up and died. I had my eye on the honey toast to try for breakfast the next morning when we first walked in, but given that I nearly had to be carried out of the place in a wheelbarrow, I decided to eat lettuce for the rest of the trip. Jk, my bunny diet lasted until dinner the next day. 

Seems like a cool place to do homework and grab coffee and dessert if you're not into alcohol or the bar scene. Very Korean. The waitress gave a Look at how much food we ordered and subsequently demolished - she mentioned that the shaved ice was meant to be split between 3-4 people (probably on empty stomachs). I felt bad chattering and generally carrying on like a half-starved animal while people were studiously typing away, but then felt less bad when I looked closer and saw that nearly everyone was on facebook or watching House of Cards.
author: Joy G.

description:
Lovely korean café, something I did not expect to find in SF. I had the red bean shaved ice and it was so good, even though it was a chilly night outside it was just what I wanted after the big dinner we had just before. My friend got the honey toast, it was absolutely delicious, but it was B.I.G, so keep in mind that you should order it on an empty stomach. The coffe was pretty average, nothing to write home about, but I think american coffee in pretty bland in general so don't take my word for it. They had lots of options though, which is always nice.

The interior was lovely and they had wifi available, I definitely recommend.
author: Cecilia H.

description: I tried the green tea shaved ice and it was delicious!! The cafe is quite small but overall its a nice place to do work or study. There is also free wifi and limited seating. I would come back again to try the strawberry shaved ice.
author: Wendy C.

description: Stumbled upon this place on our search to find an alternative to Honey Honey - which had a long line that we didn't want to wait on. It's a small, unassuming cafe which was great because we got to seat ourselves right away. They have a small selection of sandwiches, salads and desserts. I got their Honey cake and my boyfriend had their tuna melt and mocha drink. The Honey cake was delicious and plenty to share between 2 people. It consists of 3 slices of toast drenched in honey, topped with whipped cream, nuts and cinnamon, and served with a cup of vanilla ice cream. The tuna melt was one of the best we've had - well-balanced in flavor and portion, not too much mayonnaise and we could tell the bread was fresh and of good quality. Overall, I would go here again for a casual meal.
author: HM N.

description:
Got the small green tea bingsu to share as dessert with a friend and it was DELICIOUS.

The small was already pretty large for two people, but I've heard the large is a good size to split with a group. The interior of this store is adorable, but I could see the tables being filled at busier times of the day. 

Overall - great place to get an Asian dessert fix. I'll be back!
author: Anna M.

description: They don't use fresh strawberries in the strawberry bingsoo and it was swimming in liquid.  Ordered the honey toast and they don't use one large chunk of bread hallowed out like  how it's supposed to be made. Instead they just put together a couple of slices of bread with honey in btwn.  Wasn't hallowed out or well toasted.  I tried to order the red bean bingsoo and asked if I could have green tea ice cream instead of vanilla.  Server said no.  I asked if they were out of it.  He said no.  When asked why they could not do that even tho we offered to pay extra if that was the issue, he said the boss won't allow us to do that!  Even tho u see it that way in many of the photos that way!  disappointing.  Won't be coming back.
author: Diane T.

description: One of the best study spot in downtown area. The place's pricing is average. The staff is really nice and let you stay there a long time. Really like the greet tea shaved ice and especially the matcha green tea latte!
author: Kat C.

description: This is one of my favorite cafes in Nob Hill. They serve great coffee and desserts. I am also a fan of their Spiced Chicken Panini Sandwich. The cafe also offers fast internet so it is a great place to unwind and study/work over the weekend.
author: Anurag S.

description:
I wanted some red bean shaved ice (patbingsoo), and this one definitely hit the spot! I got the smaller size because I had just eaten a huge meal. 

It featured the best green tea ice cream that I've ever had - absolutely delicious. The mochi and almond toppings were good, but I think it could have benefited from some fresh fruit. A suggestion would also be to make a new bingsoo -- fruit. For this reason, I am giving this establishment 4 stars, and also because I wish the cup for the small size would have been wider. It's filled to the brim and difficult to eat without spilling everywhere.

I didn't bring my work materials, but the internet seemed good. There were a lot of people working, and the hours open are long. I would definitely frequent this place more if I lived here!
author: Anton E.

description:
Love the red bean shaved ice! We came here after having a Korean dinner at 707 Sutter and I was craving some sweets.

The red bean shaved ice is a layer of thin fine shaved ice mixed with chewy mochi, ground peanuts, likely some other sweet sauce, and topped with ice cream (I asked for green tea flavor). The small size is perfect for me. 

The place has wifi and I see several folks parking there with laptops. The place is clean, well lit, and friendly feeling. They also have something called honey toast that I would come back to try next time!!

Also kid friendly. I went with my 16 mo old toddler!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
So, there made from scratch waffles, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, are what waffles are supposed to taste like. Sweet, but not too sweet, with a slight crisp and plenty of flavor.

What really sets this place apart is the true to form, straightforward, and interesting coffee selection. Instead of 30 flavors, they keep it simple: true lattes, cappuccinos, and other espresso drinks, proper foam ratios, and good prices.

The decor is a perfect city cafe feel, and the staff was very friendly. We will definitely return here again!
author: James B.

description: The green tea shaved ice here is awesome!  It's a very big dessert that can feed two.  Just make sure to ask for no red bean on it if you're not into that.  My girlfriend and I scraped the red bean off ours after trying a few bites to get to the sugary goodness of the green tea mountain of ice.  I didn't study here but it looks like a great place to at night.
author: Jane H.

description: Came here with my girlfriend on a Friday night.  Great atmosphere and amazing food!  I will definitely be back!
author: Ronnie J.

description:
This is a really great cafe near downtown, though it seems everyone else has discovered that as well, so it can get pretty crowded. It's open 7 days a week, 7am to 12am which is pretty much as good as it gets when it comes to cafe hours.

Aside from free wifi, coffee, and a cozy atmosphere, I think people come here for the desserts. There's a waffle option, Korean shaved ice, and honey bread. The honey bread is served hot and delicious, and definitely big enough to share with four or five friends. What is honey bread, you ask? It's thick toast lathered with honey butter and served with ice cream. Indulgent? Yes, a little bit. Fantastic? Yes, very.

Come by to hang out and get some work done, or drop by after dinner for some great dessert options.
author: Brittany C.

description:
This is a great cafe if you're looking for a nice light dessert or a coffee/tea and nothing more. Myself along with a couple of friends ordered a green tea latte, a sweet potato latte, tuna melts, and the waffles. The green tea latte tastes good but seemed as if it was just powder and hot water. The sweet potato latte on the other hand was incredible!! Didn't even know a concoction like that existed!! As for the tuna melts, $8.50 seemed a little pricy for tuna, cheese, and some greens on the side; expected a sandwich with a little more sustenance. With that said, it did taste good but was expecting a bit more. The waffle was great and it came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

I'll definitely stick to just getting a dessert and tea next time I visit.
author: Rodrigo P.

description: Perfect end of the evening coffee and desert.  Great cheesecake.
author: Jim M.

description: Not a large selection, but we had a chocolate mousse. The waffle looked good but we were after a dessert
author: Lee L.

description: Ordered the green tea shaved ice and didn't expect it to taste as delicious as it did! They add a layer of shaved ice with matcha sauce and a scoop of green tea ice cream on top. The great thing about this place is that it's open until midnight, so if you're in for a late night snack or dessert, this is your place. I also saw a few people studying at this place, so I would say the ambiance is pretty similar to that of a coffee shop. It's worth a visit if you're in the city and close to Union Square!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Joy's packs a lot into a small space. 

They have freshly prepared desserts that are big enough to share with your friends. They have honey bread, waffles (both served with ice cream and whipped cream), and bingsoo (Korean shaved ice) in a variety of flavors. Their bingsoo, though not authentic, is tasty.

It's also a great place to do laptop work or to just chill with a friend. They're open late (until midnight!), have good wi-fi, and a clean bathroom. They make great espresso drinks here, as well as some Asian favorites like sweet potato latte and matcha green tea latte.

The only downside, you can probably guess, is that Joy's is always pretty packed!
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
The owners/employees smoke out front of the shop then return back inside to handle the food/beverages with nicotine fingers, yuck!
Then customers smoke without any ashtray provided so the butts go on the sidewalk/gutter which goes into the water drain system on the corner not to mention its just dirty and litter in the city we don't need...
author: Dante D.

description:
Cute Korean cafe in SF! 
They have varieties of dessert options including patbingsoo and honey bread!
Their lattes are on the small side and have nothing special to it. 
Usually it seems to be always full with students studying. 
I recommend this place if you're looking for a small quaint cafe!
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description: Nice place to get a dessert but not relaxing! People are toooooo loud, I ended up getting a migraine because of the noise!
author: Kari Z.

description: Today was my second visit here with friends (3/18/17), first time I didn't order anything idk why? But I regret it after ordering the honey toast today OMG! Party in my mouth! Definitely shareable. My friend remembered she got it to go last time and she mentioned they didn't serve her as much. My order came with three pieces of toast and vanilla ice cream. So satisfying!!!
author: Aliyah D.

description:
My husband and I were vacationing in San Fran when we found this little local dessert/coffee shop. So glad we stopped here! They have the best waffles served with vanilla bean ice cream. The waffles are sprinkled with thinly sliced almonds and some powdered sugar....and not overly sweetened! When you take a bite into the waffles, it's freshly warm and soft. Then combined with the creamy vanilla bean ice cream....it's pure "JOY"! 

Also, Joys is a very cute, small, and cozy place so it's great for date nights and/or even study days/nights. This will definitely be one of my go to spots for waffles and ice cream when I visit!
author: Kristine N.

description: Worst dessert place ever! The shaved ice are horrible. I tried the strawberry and green tea and they both disappointed a lot. They tasted artificial and were just so bad. I feel like SF needs to get better dessert places.
author: Esther Y.

description: This is a pretty hole in the wall, moderate sized cafe. There are a few seats along the wall, 2-3 tables in the middle of the store, a couch, and few bar stool type seats by the windows. Once you enter, the menu for drinks/food is on the side wall. The cakes and sweet treats are up in the display case by the cashier. I tried the caramel latte here and it was pretty good. Smooth caramel flavor melded into some classic coffee. The price seemed appropriate for the size as well. The inside of this place felt super cozy and the heat was turned on to the perfect temperature. It's a pretty quiet atmosphere inside, making it very conducive for working, studying, reading, etc. The wifi seemed work well for me on both my computer and my tablet. I definitely hid in here longer than I needed to in order to avoid the rain. I'll definitely be back to try some desserts and chug some more coffee while I read or get some work done.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
If you're looking for a proper bingsoo (Korean styled shaved ice) in SF, this is where you'd find it. They also have great looking waffles loaded up with toppings, the sweet potato latte (also very popular in Korea) and yuzu citron tea (a favorite that I make regularly from home). 

Warning, it gets quite crowded here so I'm not sure it's the most ideal place to study and/or get some homework done. Perhaps daytime during a weekday or later in the evening might be a better time to go.
author: Esther A.

description:
Green tea shaved ice during my homework, is the BEST! :)

Great place for sitting and hanging out with friends. I love café mocha here, and all the shaved ice with ice cream!
author: Nakmuay K.

description: Cute little place with a comfy amount of space. Places in SF are usually way too tiny for comfort. They don't have many options on the menu but the Affogato I ordered was delicious. Strawberry Shaved Ice was okay. I'd give this place 4 stars if the reception/employees were more friendly and helpful when it comes to making a selection. One guy wearing glasses with a man bun was a bit rude. I had a question about desserts and he immediately just pointed to a board even before I could finish asking.
author: Hara A.

description: This place is like a furnace, it's super hot. I thought I ordered a matcha latte, but got a regular almond milk latte, which is fine, but the coffee sucks. It's sour/bitter and just not tasteful. They do have food, but I am definitely not feeling this place at all.
author: Minerva L.

description: I've been craving green tea shaved ice for a while but nothing has been settling my craving.  I came across this place on yelp and wanted to check it out.  Unfortunately this didn't have classic asian flavors I was hoping for.  First of all what is up with all the funky ingredients together.  There's a brown glaze..is that caramel?  Isn't it usually condensed milk?  Almonds?  That's a nice touch since it gives a contrast in texture, but unusual.  The green tea flavor isn't that strong either.  For close to $10 for a large, I would say there are better options.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Awesome red bean shaved ice ! Beta than the ones I've tried in Korea or Taiwan!  Also got my fab sweet potato latte at this cosy little place ! Friendly Korean owners too!
author: Angelina A.

description:
The first thing you'll notice when you come here is how Asian this cafe is. Most of the customers and all of the employees are Asian. Which is fine, except that I felt like the cashier guy was friendlier to the Korean customers. To us, he just took the orders and moved on. Oh, and another thing was that he gave us our orders as take-out even though I wanted it for-here, in a bowl rather than a plastic cup. But other people got their desserts presented all nicely on a plate or bowl.

Regardless, this place has really delicious dessert that's not too expensive. And it's open until midnight, which is another plus. If you have dinner around the area, in SoMa, Union Square, Tenderloin, or Civic Center, you can walk around for a while, soak in San Francisco, and then finish the night here. The place is pretty tiny, but I mean, most SF places in that area are. And most of the tables are taken up by a person sitting by themselves on their laptop.
author: Alice H.

description:
I think I've been here once before a couple years ago. 
It was actually my first time here since I have to send out a few emails quickly.

I ordered a non fat latte and a spicy chicken sandwich. It came with alittle green and the sandwich had a hint of sweetness to it.
The bread was soft and not dense. Almost with a fluffy texture.

I was really impressed with the sandwich.

Free wifi and comfy sitting. Not too loud and great for work or an afternoon tea.
author: Alui L.

description:
I came here to try their shaved ice desserts but they deterred me, saying it was too big for one person and no one ever finishes it by themselves, so I got the mediocre waffles instead. Very generous cup of ice cream, lots of whipped cream but the 4 waffle quarters weren't anything special. Like something you could make yourself at home with a belgian waffle iron. Not like a real belgian waffle with the special batter that makes it go all crispy on the outside. Not pleased with spending $7 on average waffles - even if they were generous.

I think they were just trying to be helpful - and they were super nice - but I'm not some teenager who's satisfied with a simple sugar kick.

Cute cafe though. Very full. Mostly with young students from the same school (not sure which one but they all seemed to know each other).
author: Jean K.

description: Great coffee but selection of breakfast items could be expanded. Fast wi-fi but they need a new couch.
author: Pablo M.

description:
SWEET POTATO LATTE. 

Any place that has sweet potato thingers as desserts = KOREAN. C: 

No words can describe my new found love. As an out and proud lover of all things goguma, this super sweet latte hit every Seo-licious (kudos to you if you know what I'm talking about) note on my tastes buds. It's definitely not a "coffee" of any kind - it's just a sweet, comforting starchy drink that makes you see and believe in unicorns and rainbows with every sip. 

I also devoured the waffle with ice cream dessert, and it was super yummy as well. They sprinkle almond flakes onto the waffle, which is oh so complimentary! Gives it a nice crunch. 

TLDR; If you have a chance, It's a cute little place to stop by. Simple menu with a small variety of coffees and desserts. They have a little bakery case with assorted mousses and tarts near the register as well. 

GOGGGUMMMMAAAAA~
author: Kero D.

description: Green tea shaved ice is incredible!!! Bursting with intense flavors! Servers are friendly!
author: Arous Y.

description: Bad service. Although a restaurant staff came out the restroom, there was very dirty and wet. The staffs are impolite to the customers. I think you should revise your customer manual.
author: Lisa M.

description:
I love Joy's Place. If I want something for dessert, I'll go for their red bean shaved ice. It's a perfect little cup of goodness. You've got the shaved ice, the sweet red bean, the little mochi bites, and then the ice cream. My teeth never fail to scream at me after they've been bathed in the cold treat. 

I also really enjoy their sweet potato latte. It tastes just like a sweet potato, with just the right amount of sweetness, and with the creaminess of the milk. It's thick, especially when you get to the bottom. 

The cafe is also nice because of their late hours. You can come here to study, read, or work if you need to. Certain times the space is a little crowded, but they normally have plenty of seats after 7.
author: Sarah B.

description: HONEY TOAST.  Do it.  The green tea shave ice is a close second.  The HONEY TOAST was so good.  So buttery and crispy with whipped cream and cinnamon on top.  And a side of vanilla ice cream.  SO YUMMY.  I would come back just for this.  We didn't try their waffle - but next time!
author: Chris L.

description:
Korean ran, very cozy with about 14 sets of seating that sits two or three people each. Refreshing decor, good bean grinder and espresso machine, good variety of cakes yet also have a few good quality sandwich options, either to stay or takeout. 

I had the ham and cheese croissant and I loved it.

Got a regular latte and it was delicious. Their beans are Central African beans, fair trade organic ones.

It's always busy, but most of the time you could still find one or two opening. 

Everyone comes here to work on their laptop, some also come here to kill an afternoon with some magazines, overall very quiet and elegant ambience!
author: Richard Y.

description: Rich, rubust coffee, served by kind, loving souls, in a clean and comfortable cafe. Open till midnight, free wifi with purchase, takes plastic.
author: Frank L.

description: Desserts are amazing here, casual environment with tons of people on their laptops.
author: Y L.

description:
A great place for a study party!

WiFi? Check. 
Outlets? Check. 
Tasty noms and drinks? Check. 

A craving for a sweet potato latte first drew me to Joy's place. Their latte was exactly what my heart had been missing - light sweet potato flavor, warm, comforting. 

I was surprised by how packed it was on a Sunday evening. The cozy atmosphere made for a productive study session. I'll definitely be back for another study session! And to try the rest of their menu :3
author: Michelle J.

description:
