I don't really see the hype about the honey bread,  I can totally make it at home.  Though the red bean shaved ice was BOMB!!! I do want to go back to try the sweet potato latte, green tea shaved ice and waffle...

It was pretty packed we had to wait for somewhere to sit and It was warm out and it was super hot inside, place needs a fan..
author: Maylene M.

description:
Two thumbs up for their Green Tea Patbingsu! The pictures posted are mostly of the Large size and it is substantial. They're quite generous with the topics (azuki and mochi!) More than enough for two to share for a satisfying dessert post-dinner.

As others noted, free wifi! So you'll find a lot of people with their laptops and headphones. They play classical music in the background, so they're definitely setting it up as a study/work space.
author: Joanna H.

description: Their sweet potato latte is really, really good, and I can't find anything like it elsewhere. Their wifi is fast and they're open quite late - what more can you ask for?
author: Jiwon K.

description:
While there may be plenty of asian dessert spots in the city, there are scant few outside of the Richmond/Sunset.  Joy's is a cute little coffee place in lower Nob Hill (tendernob?) that's open until 12AM most nights, has free wifi, AND asian desserts:  honey toast, waffles, shaved ice.  

My friend and I shared an absolutely massive bowl of Korean style shaved ice with red beans and green tea ice cream.  Absolutely delicious, but seriously large enough to be a meal!

Crowd seems mostly to be students and staff are super nice.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Green tea shaved ice very good. 

Fruit tart delicious. 

Fun little spot with lots of young people hanging out.
author: Jingo Django J.

description:
Exciting place to be if your meeting friends for a drink a coffee.

 
It's a place where you can meet interesting people and talk about Interesting things.  Love it. Will be back to visit 

Nice
author: Angela F.

description:
Three stars for the green tea shaved ice, and the burned macaroons. Such a disappointment. Apparently the coffee was not good either, which is a real shame given the expectations we had after reading all of the gleaming reviews. 
Now I'm a bit of a fanatic when it comes to macaroons, and these were a decent try (it's a tough cookie) but for an established cafe, charging a decent amount - I'd expect them to be a little uneven but at least cooked through evenly and not browned on the outside. 
So for the shaved ice (which is what we really came for) I have to say it was borderline inedible. The flavours were unmatched, clashing and almost bitter. A real disappointment. 
Maybe we just missed something totally amazing here, as it does always seem to be busy.
author: Andrea F.

description: The waffles come with ice cream and whipped cream. Perfect size for a brunch. It is a bit too popular comparing to how many seats they have. I saw people walked out because all chairs are full. Well, take-out is always an option.
author: Jiayin L.

description: We tried two panini today, the grilled cheese and tuna melt.  Both sandwiches were toasted perfectly and were very tasty - yes, they are on the smaller side but we found them filling and just fine as they are.  They each came with a little salad with a vinaigrette. We enjoyed both panini very much.  Joy's Place is definitely a neighborhood find that we will be frequenting as much as possible for panini, dessert and late night drinks like the sweet potato latte.
author: Maile N.

description: Too many people reading and using computer in this place. Some people buy only 1 drink and use the whole table (4 seats).
author: Orange S.

description:
The staff and customer service are great, both prompt and friendly.

For the limited amount of space, the seating is diverse and plentiful.

The coffee and espresso drinks are high quality, and the food, while very limited in scope, generally tastes delicious.

It's the cleanest and best-maintained cafe in the neighborhood, and among the independent cafes, by far the cleanest.

It's open until midnight, a rarity for the 'Loin.

Why only 3 stars, then? Simple. The drink prices are steep, and the food prices, at least for pastries, are an affront to dignity and decency for which the owners ought to be brought before the Hague on human rights charges.

The funny thing is, if the prices were lower, people might feel less justified in camping out with a single coffee for endless hours, they would sell more food, and they wouldn't need the "All Seats for Paying Customers" signs.
author: James D.

description: If you stay in Union Square, it's an easy walk. There are not too many places open late on Sunday night, and fewer on New Years Day, but these guys came through in the clutch. I was on vacation for the New Year, but I will return the next time I am in the city. Highly recommended! Great coffee, delicious waffles, and surprisingly low cost (for San Francisco).
author: Danny M.

description:
Free wifi!
Friendly waiters
Decent prices for the delicious shaved ice and sandwiches they serve
A great place to hang out, relax, or catch up with a friend.
Usually packed with Koreans, though, if anyone is uncomfortable with that.
author: Grace P.

description:
Pretty good food, but pretty pricy.

At 5 bucks a pop, I had the green tea latte.  It tasted exactly the one you get at Starbucks, which isn't a bad thing, because it tastes great.  But the price was pretty steep.  

Also had waffles.  Again, very good, but very pricey considering you can get something similar in Oaktown for literally half the price.  it's nice and cozy inside though, so it's a good place to chill to sober up after HH.
author: Andy V.

description:
Still lovin it. So far I have added the honey toast and hot chocolate to my list of purchased items and they did not disappoint! Honey toast was thick and covered in honey/slivered almond goodness. The hot chocolate was REAL chocolate, not some powdery, watered down crap some places try to serve you. 

Only downfall is that their fivestars machine never seems to work so I'm not getting all of my rewards!
author: Michelle C.

description: I like Korean shaved ice, but I would not come back here. It's not bad, but you can get better elsewhere and this place doesn't offer anything extra special in addition to the dessert/drink options (for example, it's not like the presentation of the food is instagram worthy or the atmosphere of this cafe is super cute). The ice is too rocky. The shaved ice doesn't have enough flavor. I would be more happy with just soft shaved ice and condensed milk.
author: Annie S.

description:
Joy's is officially my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco, and I've been to quite a ton! Here's why:

-FAST and FREE wifi. Order something and get it at the counter!
-Opens EARLY and closes LATE. This is hard to find in SF and Joy's gives it to ya!
-NICE STAFF. Won't kick you out if you stay too long, also fast with orders.
-COZY INTERIOR, NICE CULTURE. It may get a bit crowded here but I started noticing strangers sharing tables, yes even on those tiny intimate 2-people ones. Just ask and get ready to do some work!
-GREAT AMBIANCE. Literally the perfect coffee shop environment, with jazzy music and light chatters.
-YUMMY FOOD. Ok I have to admit I didn't try their food yet but just from the looks of the picture? I say they must be good! Great if you're studying and doing work and feeling the stomach rumble.
-YUMMY DRINKS. Tried the Green Tea Latte iced. At first I thought it was overwhelmingly sweet but got quite used to it and it turned out pretty delicious.

I'll be back here on the regular. What a great cafe!
author: Ting Jung L.

description: Loved this cute cafe. Had their cafe mocha and strawberry short cake. It was the last one and tasted so yummy! Highly recommend both dishes. LOVE the walls, and would defintiely be back. Service was quick and there was no line. Thanks yall!
author: Ameera D.

description: This is a little cute coffee shop in TenderNob, I come here once in a while for one or several of these reasons: pretty decent coffee and pastries, fast wifi, open late (until midnight daily), and clean. It would have been nicer if the music had been tuned down for a bit so that listening to my own music could be an option, at least for my recent visits. Tempting to try their sweet potato latte and shaved ice.
author: Jaclyn C.

description: We found this small little cafe on Post St. It was cozy (definition: small) but the folks there were friendly. Drinks were okay - nothing spectacular maybe a tad bit overpriced for what you get but it's not Starbucks who can afford to give you a lot for less. We probably should've ordered something other than hot chocolate - which was mediocre at best. They had other interesting drinks but we wanted something hot. If we were by it we'd probably go again but wouldn't go out of our way.
author: Rovi D.

description: Terrible terrible service. They need to improve their customer service. Be polite and friendly to your customers. It doesn't take much effort.
author: Niccolo P.

description:
Dropped by here yesterday with my gf and I.  It was pretty packed, but we were able to get 2 seats by the window.  We got the sweet potato latte and strawberry shaved ice (small).  The latte is hella good, but EXTREMELY HOT...like SCORCHING HOT.  It will burn you.  I've never had anything really that hot before - very surprising, she burnt her mouth =(.  The latte is really good though, there are potato chunks in it which is a plus and very delicious.
The strawberry shaved ice was really good too.  Not too sweet, cold, creamy, and just very satisfying.  I'd get it again.  There were a couple of ice chunks on the bottom, but that's OK.  The shaved ice comes with a scoop of strawberry ice cream on top too!  Note that the strawberry is not fresh.  We would definitely come back, the price is a little on the expensive side though in my opinion.  About $10 total for two small things.
author: Kevin N.

description: In my continuing search for a late night reading spot, Joy's Place came up on my list so I decided to give it a try. Located a few blocks from Union Square in one of the less sketchy areas of the tenderloin, Joy's place has a nice atmosphere and decently comfortable tables to work/read at. They have decent music playing and they stay open until midnight. Additionally they have a good coffee bar with a number of options and a (very) small selection of pastries. They even have their wall diagrammed with all of the different coffee options and what they consist of. I liked doing my reading here and will probably give this place another try in the future.
author: Mark O.

description: Absolutely cannot categorize this place as 'desserts'. There are only three dessert items on the menu which are green tea shaved ice, red bean shaved ice, and ice cream waffle. Most of the menu is completed with espresso drinks, which I don't care about. Cafe also has free wifi, which means people bring their entire life belongings and sit for hours. Customers that pay more are forced to squeeze into tiny tables because the wifi users won't leave. Now onto the actual dessert, my friend and I both got green tea shaved ice. The dessert was so sweet, it's almost like diabetes in a bowl. I had a large, and it looks like I didn't touch the dessert at all. If you have a sweet tooth, this might be the place for you.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
The quick and dirty:
1. Open late
2. Friendly staff
3. Great dessert + drink selection

The scene is a small cozy cafe tucked just a few blocks from Union Square filled to the brim with Korean exchange students working furiously on design assignments and sipping on a variety of caffeinated concoctions.

The coffee drinks are good (try the sweet potato latte) but the real reason why this place earns it's 5 stars are the desserts. My favorite and probably the why I now regular this place 2-3 a week is the Green Tea Shaved Ice or ( ). Comes in a share-with-someone-special size and if you're craving a lightly sweetened chilled snack that you can split over a good conversation, this is the place to drop by. If you're looking for something warm, I'd suggest the waffles (omg you can start smelling them from about a block away).

Other things to note ~ good wifi connection, clean bathroom, and a small food menu just in case you end up staying longer than expected and the dessert has worked up your appetite.
author: Jasper S.

description: Iced Caramel Latte: sweet but not too sweet. Friendly, quick service. WiFi is on the slooooow side but at least there are a pretty decent number of tables. Plus, they have a clean bathroom which is rare around here. Great place that isn't too far of a walk from Union Square. Sometimes all the coffee shops  immediately near the Square are packed so this is a great option.
author: Susan G.

description:
I feel strange posting 5 stars unless I've been somewhere several times to really confirm. Well, joys place is across the street from my building so I am lucky to say I've had plenty of chances. Each time, each drink, has been beyond awesome. 

Coffee: I am a plain coffee kind of girl and theirs does not disappoint! The flavor is spot on. 

Other drinks: my first time coming here they had just ran out of drip coffee so they gave me Americano with a discount. Very delicious! Rich and nutty in flavor. Strong, as Americano should be. I also tried an earl grey - it was standard but they serve it in a beautiful clear glass mug ( I'm a sucker for the aesthetic)... Last on my list of adventure is the surprise I asked the barista to make. She made a "Korean citrus tea" (i think???) and even came by and asked how it was after several minutes. Very sweet and strong but the aroma and flavor was epic. I saw her making it, some kind of marmalade-looking concentrate as opposed to a tea bag. 

Ambience: CANNOT be beat. Perfect blend of cozy and lively. Wifi is fast. Just be sure to snatch a seat because the place is always full!!
author: Amy C.

description:
If possible, I would have preferred to rate this place at a 3.5, but the quality of the desserts convinced me to round up rather than down. The waffle (nicely warm fluffy with vanilla ice cream and an airy whipped cream) and green tea shaved ice (topped with red bean, mochi, almonds, and an ice cream that I can't place but was nonetheless delicious) were absolutely amazing. Had I only tried the desserts, this place would have definitely received a 5-star review. 

Unfortunately, the (hot) latte I ordered was downright disappointing. The coffee tasted a bit diluted (which I can forgive), but it came out decidedly lukewarm. I may have just gotten an inexperienced barista or they may have let the drink cool too much before they gave it to me, but I'm nonetheless displeased. 

This cafe is also a great place to study (I saw a lot of people working with laptops), so I might give their coffee another shot, but only if I'm also in the mood for dessert.
author: Ying X.

description:
ONE STAR FOR HORRENDOUS CUSTOMER SERVICE. This is a story of royal ninjas and RBFs.

Came here on a Friday night with a group of friends to grab a hot drink and chill for a bit.  I ordered the sweet lemon tea which was actually pretty damn good, too bad the cashier couldn't be bothered to change his chronic RBF.  Pretty ironic considering the name of the establishment.  

I was surprised how crowded it was for a cafe at 10:30 at night; all the tables were taken, and we waited for one to open up for about 10 minutes which we were happy to do.  It was warm and cozy, and there was a lot of chatter with some kind of loud radio on the entire time as well, so obviously it didn't feel like a place we needed to be quiet.  After we were all sitting and chatting, about 6 of us, this ninja lady dressed in all black comes and tells us we're too loud and to be quiet so she can have a conversation with her friend....they are across the room mind you.  This took me off guard because she was really unfriendly about it, GURL, if you're going to ask a group of people to do something for you, at least smile and don't be so aggressive ok?  Hell maybe even throw a "please" in there! Because she was acting like a princess we were taken off guard and did try to quiet down for her majesty.

What was so weird is that she was ACROSS the room, and the people that were actually sitting next to us didn't seem to have any problems with us, they were carrying on their conversations just fine and weren't staring at us or anything like we were being too loud.  It was just ninja lady who literally kept turning around to give us a death stare like 20 times.....wai??  

Then we realized she was buddy buddy with the staff. OH OK I SEE.  I SEE WUTS HAPPENING. She's friends with the staff, or staff herself so she feels like she is the queen of Joy's Place.  Ok Ok. I see this conspiracy. 

So 10 minutes pass and one of the other cashiers comes over and tells us to be quiet, again majorly lacking any sort of courtesy or hint of customer service. But this wasn't the least bit surprising after my initial interaction with RBF cashier # 1.  We seriously were barely louder than anyone else in the cafe.  We felt super disrespected and unwelcomed so of course we left shortly afterward.  

WONT BE BACK EVER K THNX BAI.
author: Christina L.

description:
Pro:
- open late
- shaved ice thing

Con:
- limited seating
author: Sun K.

description: The place is a cute little coffeehouse/cafe type of spot with free wifi! It's clean and nice decorated. I ordered the green tea shaved ice which was alright and nothing special than the other shaved ice I have tasted before. Overall, I give it a 4 stars for the atmosphere, decor and service!
author: kaaaathy c.

description:
A new cafe that has two things I love - their Sweet Potato Latte and their Honey Bread (two things I first had during a trip to South Korea). 

- Modern decor with their menu items written on a chalk board painted wall  
- Open late
- Jazz music playing in the background
- The cafe has an open concept with a good amount of seating for customers - it feels inviting

I could see this place becoming popular, especially with the students in the area seeing they're open late. I must admit, I was missing the pet store that was here previously, but this is a welcome change for me. Did I mention they have the Sweet Potato Latte and Honey Bread? If you haven't tried either, give it a shot :)
author: Mogi D.

description:
Great little cafe with light music, lots of desk space,  power outlets and free wifi. Light eats are on the menu, I got the ham and cheese croissant and it was served with a side of greens. Great taste.

Coffee is also noticeably good, so are their tea drinks and are all relatively reasonably priced ($3).
author: Ved P.

description: Cozy space. Service is standard. The food is fine. Will have to go back for more thorough review. The shaved ice is okay, though. I think the difference between the large and the small is pretty great. I'd probably order the large to share next time.
author: Michelle K.

description:
I had something Ghandhi would've enjoyed in lieu of a sundae. 

The red bean shaved ice was a pleasant experience almost enough to put me in a zenful mind if it weren't for the music, but I did satisfy my sweet tooth and I can always funkify it at home.
author: Darth M.

description: Definitely not the nicest cafe to enjoy some coffee/dessert at. All the tables/counter space were taken when I came here on a Sunday afternoon, so the only seating left was a very dilapidated couch that I sat at the very edge of to appease the germophobe in me. I tried the affogato, sweet potato latte, and honey toast. The sweet potato latte was the most interesting just for the sake of trying, but I'm not sure I would ever crave it or come back. The toast was disappointing - mostly butter and cinnamon with some honey at the bottom of the plate, nothing I couldn't make at home with the right ingredients. Would definitely opt for a place with better ambiance and food offerings, but can't say I didn't enjoy the novelty of drinking a sweet potato latte!
author: Chinh T.

description:
It's been 4 days since they opened and just by looking at it from the outside I had to try it. I had their tuna panini, cheese panini and waffle dessert which comes with whip cream and ice cream and iced cocoa to drink.
Their cheese panini is made of 7 different kinds of cheese! For cheese maniacs like me, that is what we call a true cheese meal. The bread is crusty yet perfect for biting into. Same with the tuna panini. The waffle dessert was the best waffle I've had. And..! It's made from scratch - not from a waffle mix. On top of that, all their chocolate drinks are made from real chocolate, which is made from scratch at home! That's something you can't just find anywhere..! The quality is great! 

And on top of that!! The place itself is so cute. The interior is designed with dainty decors. Even their bathroom is designed with cute wall decors and is very clean (:
author: J K.

description: Great place to catch up with friends or just yourself.  Can't say I have a lot of flavored or blended coffees, but I surprisingly enjoyed a caramel latte and fruit tart.  Nicely done.  A good quiet stop for relaxing, comfortable conversation, and even taking on some work (and definitely feeling productive without a mad rush).  Appreciate the ease of finding power sources, and the wifi speed was excellent.  Personnel were professional and polite!  This is a great stopping place minus the stuff and fluff you could probably see elsewhere.  Will make it a point to stop in here for a kick back comfortable relaxing experience.  Maybe a newer comfortable section would be good...update the current couch perhaps?
author: Johanna V.

description:
Small menu but cute quiet place with fair trade coffee smack in the middle of touristy union square. 

The menu is limited but has some good stuff. Had a soy caramel latte and cappuccino. Both good. Although I wish the caramel flavor was a bit stronger in the latte, I was happy with my drink nonetheless. There is also free wifi in the cafe which is plus in the busy city. 

Only thing is service could've been better here. The baristas had an "I could care less" attitude and gave us blank stares when we were looking at the menu and deciding on what to order. Also, they didn't ask for our names so when the drinks were coming out there was some confusion between our drinks vs another party's latte vs another lady's drinks. Meh. Still better than the hotel coffee...!
author: Gloria C.

description: Great place to get homework done! My favorite items here are: Green Tea Latte (with soy milk), green tea shaved ice, waffles, and tuna melt.
author: Sui N.

description: Pricey, but super yummy. I ordered the red bean shaved ice and shared it among 2 people. The ice was a milky sweet consistency, just as snow ice should be. I also really liked that they don't skimp on toppings. There was a sizeable ball of vanilla ice cream on top as well as an assortment of mochi, red bean, and other yummy things. I've been to Mealtop in San Jose and while their shaved ice is equally good, the meager portions of red bean they provide made it a much sadder experience. The decor of the place is very cute, and they have this little chalkboard detailing the differences between each expresso drink (helpful!). Overall, I really enjoyed my visit, and I'm looking forward to trying the match flavored shaved ice.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Excellent service, great coffee, and surprisingly inexpensive.  Can't recommend enough and will definitely become a regular stop for me in SF.

I needed to make a conference call at 11pm and after a depressing hour looking around SF I was losing hope. But then I found Joy's.  The WiFi was excellent, and they were nice enough to turn down the music for me so that I could make the call.  Also, the drip coffee was $2 for a big cup, and is the best coffee I've had so far in SF.
author: Tony M.

description:
I hardly yelp but this was one of the places that I had to... not only because it has my name but because it's worth a visit! A cute modern coffee place which had more seating than other independently owned coffee joints in sf. I noticed there was wifi and I didn't bother to connect to it but I'm thinking it's free because most places in SF does offer free wifi. The barista seemed pretty chill and asked if I wanted my receipt to be emailed to me. I'm totally digging the idea of having your receipts emailed to you now a days to save cost rather than paper receipts.

I ordered the Cafe Mocha and loved the richness taste while the significant ordered the Caramel Latte.  Loved both and they had a great ambiance!!! I loved how they decorated the place since it's the holidays. We sat down and enjoyed our drinks for a good hour until we headed off to do more shopping around Union Square. This is definitely one of the places that I'm coming back to when I'm in town again!
author: Joy L.

description:
Knowing hotel coffee, I knew I had to find a good coffee spot nearby. Joy's place, aptly named, was my haven during my stay in SF. 

Right around the corner on Taylor, sitting on Post, Joy's is a quaint little spot with high impact coffee and humble decor. The right side of the cafe includes chalkboard drawings, a coffee diagram, and a simple menu. Cafe lattes, cappuccino, drip coffee, mocha, pour over, 3 sandwich/panini options, and dessert. 

The few times I was there, I ordered the pour over (option: Guatemala beans), soy lattes, and the honey bread. Admittedly, the coffee art needs some help, but the coffee itself was expertly brewed. 

It might've been only 9:30am, but I ordered the honey bread. It's part of the dessert menu and what a dessert it was. It came with 3 slices of thick honey bread toast, topped with whipped cream, sliced almonds, dusted with cinnamon, and drizzled with melted butter. As if that wasn't enough, on the side was more whipped cream and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Added my soy latte and I was in heaven!

Oh yes, the left side of the cafe was decorated simply with a bookcase and a few glass vases of wall-hung terrariums. Simple and humble.
author: Lily C.

description:
Sweet potato latte is surprisingly good!! first sip was a little fibberish and grainy but after that I fall in love with it. This is new to me and I might attempt to make my own at home (but with purple sweet potato, I think rich in nutrition) because I don't live in the city but if i visit the city and walk around downtown, I will try not to miss this hot sweet potato drink. Yum! 

OK...Now! About the cafe: It is definitely asian cafe. I could senses from the vibe, the atmosphere, the decoration, and even most of the customers are asian. At lease when I hang out here for an hour. 

Are you student and need a cafe with free wifi? Yes this is the place in downtown. Not crowded not loud and have outlets. Wish they were around when I was a student in the AAU.
author: Fenny G.

description:
Glad this cafe offers waffles!!!! 
It will be my go to waffle place. 
It's very nice and clean. 
And the staff are very nice and friendly.
author: Wendy K.

description:
Came in for a quick dessert with some friends and was surprised by how many people were studying; it's definitely more of a cafe feel than a dessert place. Buuuuut, it's adorable inside and nobody complained that there were a group of us cackling in a corner.

We tried the Strawberry Shaved Ice and the Hot Chocolate. Definitely worth it to upgrade to the large shaved ice because it's humongous for only slightly more moneyz! We easily split it between 5 of us and couldn't even finish it (albeit we had already gorged on dinner only an hour earlier). I wish that the ice were fluffier and had more fruit (more like Taiwanese Shaved Ice I've had in the past), but all the ingredients were pretty tasty. The hot chocolate surprised me because it was soooo good; I keep trying to come up with reasons to be in the area to grab another one. 

Overall, better as a cafe, but their desserts aren't bad.
author: Christina R.

description:
There isn't many good taste coffee cafe in downtown SF.

I love coffee taste and other lattes 
I recommend sweet potato latte and affogato.
And this is good place for hanging out with friends in late time.
it opens until 11pm. 
Shaved ice is good for desert menu. It's pretty big. Enough for 2~3 people.
author: Sungbaek C.

description:
Very quaint Korean cafe. Lots of Korean themed music. A lot of Koreans here. After seeing so many Korean restaurants opening up in this area of the TL i think this area may be a extended K-town. Decor is artsy and mellow. Just came from Yakini Q cafe in J-town earlier but it was overly crowded and hot in there so I searched Yelp for a alternative. I've been meaning to check this place out since it opened. Ordered Americano. Prices for coffees and lattes aren't too steep but desserts and food dishes seem a bit more pricey than the norm. 

Highly recommend this place as a alternative to Yakini Q if huge crowds and slow internet is not your thing. I wish this place has more variety of pastries like scones, cookies, or fruit bars I find in other SF cafes.
author: Jude N.

description: Yum!! Everything looks absolutely delicious it's hard to pick. My boyfriend and I are staying the weekend in this area so we will defiantly be back a couple of times to visit this place. Their affogato is wonderful! So tasty. It's super cute and workers are super nice.
author: Devon S.

description: Amazing dessert and service here!! I got the red bean purple shaved ice and it was delicious! Was perfect! I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Irma H.

description:
The best straight drip coffee I've had in the city. It rivals a lot of hand pour overs I've had from various places. The red bean shaved ice is an excellent Korean dessert - the portion is large and good for 2 people.

Joy's Place looks small with little seating, but I've always been able to get a seat without a wait. It's a good place to work, but most likely not good for groups of more than 2.
author: Edwin C.

description: I stayed at the hotel across the street and needed a quick bite to eat for dinner. They were conveniently close and had decent reviews, so I thought I would give them a try. Place was super laid back and the staff was friendly. I ordered their tuna melt which was nothing spectacular. They toasted it but their were still certain bites that were cold tuna.  I wish I would have tried their coffee just to taste if it was comparable. Not sure I will be back for the food but maybe a taste of their coffee for an updated review.
author: Nina A.

description: Super unique and tasty! Fast friendly service and the inside was pretty great as well.
author: Matalyn B.

description: Great coffee shop that I can stop by on my way to work. The employees here are super nice and fast! I usually get my drink to go, so I can't say a lot about the quality of wifi, restrooms, etc. But the atmosphere is nice and they always seem busy. One thing is that sometimes I go in and it's extremely hot. I don't know if their A/C is broken or maybe they just don't have it. Again, since I get my drink to go, it's not a huge deal. Something to consider though if your going to sit and bring your laptop.
author: Bryce P.

description:
Got both the green tea and vanilla bingsoos. I recommend the green tea over the plain vanilla one. They were absolutely delicious. The only improvement I can suggest is for the establishment to add fruit and/or mochi to the dessert.

The place was very cute, although I wish there were bigger and more tables. This place is great for solo studying, dates, and groups less than 5 people.
author: Vivian L.

description: Coffee was divine! Staff was friendly and served very fast! I ate a tuna panini which did not look too good but it appeared to be very tasty. Lovely place worth passing by, I saw others were having impressively looking desserts.
author: Aistė R.

description:
Me and my wife found this place on yelp (thank you Yelp) and we've been here twice already on our 4 day vacation to SF, this place is amazing! Everything we've had was awesome. 

So far we've had the ham and cheese crescent the honey bread and for drinks the fruity black tea and the Carmel latte. All tasted like they were made with a lot of care and thought. So this is definitely our go to coffee shop every time we visit!
author: juan j.

description: This place is amazing! Cute café with delicious looking pastries and cold brew Dutch coffee I will definitely have to get on a hot day. My friends got affogatos, which were delicious. The most unusual and tasty thing wasn't sweet potato latte. I've never heard of such a thing and I'm so glad i tried! Tastes just like a sweet potato pie, and it's made with real sweet potatoes. Can't wait for my return visit!
author: Deborah M.

description: Great coffee and teas, incredible shaved ice (authentic Korean quality) and the best WiFi network in SF PERIOD!!!. This is the only place with worthy WiFi. The WiFi in all other SF cafes are a pathetic joke which others should just get rid of their wifi.
author: Scott B.

description: This place is awesome. The red bean dessert sadly has ice cream in it, but the wi-fi is fast and the place is popping. Seriously, on a Tuesday at 9pm this place was full. Good stuff.
author: B H.

description:
I'm really fond of this coffee shop. Not the best place to do work because it's always pretty crowded (especially in the evenings) so finding a seat can be difficult. The noise level is moderate to high. But their drinks are good and they're open until midnight every night, which is awesome for night owls. The drip coffee is only $2, and the wifi is fast & reliable. 

Two drinks worth mentioning:
1) The sweet potato latte here is so good! They actually put Korean sweet potato in it and you can slightly taste the sandy texture, but not in a bad way. It's sweet but not overly so, and just very warm and comforting. 
2) The yujacha (citron tea) is super good as well. An extremely simple drink that many Asian families make at home (yuja preserves + hot water), but I love that I can order this at Joy's Place. Super soothing and great to drink in the morning or evening.
Both these drinks are uncaffeinated, which is perfect for me because I usually try not to drink caffeine in the evening. Love that I can come here late at night with a friend and still have fantastic drink options.
author: Michelle J.

description: The cafe is further away from the crowded part of post street. It's a hidden jem in my opinion. There werent a lot of people when I went. It has nice seating area with outlets for your laptop. I had the sweet potato latte which tasted really good....like sweet potatoes :). The lady said that they make their own paste for it which is a plus in my book. I also liked the jazzy music in the background. It's a really nice coffee place for those that like to work out.
author: Maria T.

description: We drove 40 minutes to serve ice cream there and arrived 30 minutes before they close but they had already ran out of ice cream. We ordered hot chocolate and cheesecake instead and it was ok. They also gave us macaroons and I assumed that it belongs to the hot chocolate order and that they have not charged us for it(?)
author: Mahshid M.

description: After a yummy dinner in the TL, my friend and I decided to seek out dessert. We found this cute little Korean cafe on Yelp and we were pleasantly delighted. The decor is modern and chic and space is set up for studying or small groups to hang out. The cafe is very reminescent of the cafes I used to frequent in LA Ktown; even the prices are in line with what I am used to. We ordered patbingsoo to share and it would've been enough for 3-4 people. Every layer was delicious and the ice cream on top was extremely creamy. This is definitely a winner.
author: Yi Z.

description: Great cafe to meet up or get work done. Prices are reasonable, coffee is good, and the honey bread is delicious and very large as well (they give you three thick cut pieces of bread with generous whipped cream and ice cream). The two guys that work here aren't particularly enthusiastic or friendly but they get the job done.
author: Shabnam E.

description:
Not horrible but certainly not worth going to more than once in your life. The waffle with ice cream could be better if the ice cream wasn't Breyers and if they gave more than a teaspoon of cheap syrup. 

The chicken sandwich was somewhat more redeeming,  chopped curry chicken and craisin. It was small but not horrible. 

The decor is unorganized sadness. As if several people, one with a small amount of taste, threw a bunch of random crap together, overall it's not cohesive and is uncomfortable.
author: Danielle O.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for a while now but I just can't with all the cigarette butts that constantly (on a daily basis) litter the sidewalk out front. I live a block up on Post st and walk by here everyday. This is by far THE NASTIEST store front on Post. Take a little pride in your business!
author: Mister F.

description:
Small place along Post. We came here while staying at the hostel up the street. 

Ambience was great. Soft instrumental music was playing. It was also very quiet. Ideal for working or studying.

We all had the ham and cheese croissant and it was delicious. The coffee itself is amazing as well.  

Wish we had come here more!
author: David C.

description:
Little small place in San Francisco, but amazing really delicious food.!!
I got some perfect hot chocolate and some chicken panini and some honey bread for desert!
Totally recommend it
author: Sara A.

description:
Another Yelp success. I wish that I found this earlier in my trip, only went one time and had take away to the hotel. Green tea shaved ice with red beans & mochi was wonderful. A lot of people can't imagine beans in a dessert, but I've had them many times, and they absorb some of the flavor and sweetness while adding a great texture. Mochi also add a great chewy bite. 

The waffle topped with ice cream was good, but not as good as the shaved ice.
author: Ralph W.

description:
Stopped in at 7:30 on a Tuesday night. Every seat was full! Even after we ordered, no one had gotten up yet and we had to wait for another 15 minutes. One man saw us waiting and made sure we got his seat since we were standing so long haha. He was very sweet! Even the two ladies running the shop were trying so hard to find us some options! The customer service here is fantastic and very kind! 

We ordered honey toast, strawberry shortcake, and green tea. The green tea was of course perfect, can't mess that up! The honey toast was delicious and rich, though a little bit too sweet for me, I still loved it! It also comes with ice cream and an extra serving of whipped cream. The strawberry shortcake was light and fresh! 

The ambiance is nice and quiet and warming, and they play good music! Mostly jazz. Don't let the lack of seating keep you away! I'm sure we just came at an off time, plus the food and service are wonderful and well worth the wait for a spot if it's filled! I will definitely be back :)
author: Belle M.

description: This was a last place that i visited in San Francisco. Me and my girl-friend got a Green Tea Shaved Ice and a hot chocolate. Hot chocolate, Sweet green tea, blended Ice, Almond seeds, white Mochi such as good thing for cold weather. Recommend for people need ice cream at night like us !!!!
author: An L.

description:
Found this place while on holiday in San Francisco. 

 Tried their waffle for breakfast and it was really good. It came with a side of vanilla ice.  The ice cream was an interesting twist and tasted really good.  

The mocha was really good.  Staff was friendly and service was quick.
author: Brett R.

description: I got a strawberry shaved ice and it was alright. Looked through the pictures and saw the red bean one and it looks a lot better. The ice was alright but not worth the rating on Yelp.
author: Ashley S.

description:
The Red Bean shaved ice is DELICIOUS! 5 stars for the food.

The service, mediocre. Pretty much self serve because you have to get water and silverware yourself. And in the end you clean your own table.

The reason for only a 3 star rating is because of the carelessness of the staff. There was a homeless guy sitting inside the cafe before I got there. The whole time I was there, he was singing and talking to himself. He didn't order anything either... Just sitting there looking at the customers. It just created an uncomfortable atmosphere. The staff made no effort to try to tell the homeless man to leave. They just stood in the back and were chatting or texting away. 

Also, the bathroom was occupied for what seemed like forever. I saw like five people sitting and waiting for the bathroom. Some customers were so fed up with waiting they left. When they asked, the employees there would say "Someones inside." I mean, yeah its nice of you guys to let them do their business in peace.. but if the same person is inside for more than 30 minutes.. isn't that a warning that something might be up? 

But besides the homeless dude and the always occupied bathroom, this place is worth the visit. hopefully your experience will be different!
author: Andy C.

description: Shaved ice was so small for the price, it makes me miss Class 302 in SoCal where you get something 3 times the size for twice the price. Strawberry shortcake was good but not memorable, and seating was quite hard to find as it was pretty packed. Shaved ice tasted pretty good except that it melted ridiculously fast, toppings were quality though.
author: Joy H.

description: Came in for a Korean shaved ice dessert (patbingsoo) recently and was a little perplexed by what we got. So many of the normal ingredients were missing and the ice cream to shaved ice ratio was way off. Too much overly sweet ice cream made the whole thing just taste like an American sundae rather than my beloved patbingsoo. The cup they served the small order in was too inconvenient to eat so I would suggest ordering a large if you must get the shaved ice. Otherwise, I would order something else altogether.
author: Ann K.

description:
I don't know the details. Joy had me after my first mocha. Pne of the best I've ever had. The mocha is my coffee drink of choice. I am a choco head. I love chocolate so much that sometimes I order a hot chocolate and add a shot of esppresso to it.
         At Joy's I don't ask any questions... what type of coffee, where is it sourced, is it a blend or single crop single harvest from a sustainable living wage farm that donates a portion of profits to replanting the vericose vain of our planet the wild rainforrests and jungles. 
     In Joy's I trust. 
     They also serve an intriging sweet potato latte, cold drip dutch coffee in a wine glass (actually really good!), top notch waffles with ice cream, sweet bread. Along with items I havee yet to try like the 7 type grilled cheese and tuna melt.
author: Scott D.

description:
This cafe is super-duper Korean. If you're looking for a place to get your yellow-fever on, you've found your spot (you certainly won't be alone). It does get very loud and packed sometimes, so it might not be the best place to get work done in the evenings.

Regardless, the espresso drinks are actually very good, the wi-fi is fast, and the opening hours are incredible, so it's hard not to give Joy's 5-stars.
author: Aaron J.

description: Omg the red bean ice thing is AMAZING! And I usually hate shaved iced things. Their iced coffee is so good. Sweet potato latte is hilariously weird.
author: Ellie B.

description: ordered two large shaved ice desserts.  Ice was melting and it was more like soup!  Expensive and totally not worth it.  Shame on the kids/owner's.  Maybe they will wise up and do better by their customers.
author: L W.

description: Super cute place in SF! Ran by Korean owners, the place is good size considering the locations, quirky deco around the place... Not too much on the menu but it's enough and easy. Free wifi so you got some people in there who looked like they were studying. I forget what my friend got but it was an espresso with ice cream. I had a taste and it was really good! If I hadn't already had dinner prior and 2 cups of coffee before coming here, I would've ordered something myself. Which means, I'll definitely be back...
author: Danielle V.

description:
Sometimes I go to this place for patbingsu ( Korean ice dessert)
This is awesome!!! I really recommend to try it.
author: Yenny K.

description: Excellent coffee, service and plenty of room to get a table and hang out.
author: Pat M.

description: Came here minutes before they closed and ordered the red bean shaved snow! It was perfect! I told the lady taking my order that I wanted extra condense milk because I LOVEEEEEEE it! It wasn't too sweet at all, it was just right! I will come back and try other stuff.
author: Jessica ..

description: Cool little coffee shop. I got a latte and a bagel. The latte was great and the bagel was done well. Definitely a cool little place to grab something in the morning. There wasn't a ton of seating and there were a few people who sat in there for a while on their computers doing stuff, so that made the seating situation even worse. We were lucky to grab the last table but it was still definitely worth comin here.
author: Clayton B.

description: uhh...it was the only dessert place open around union square on a thu night..a  lot of patrons seemed very high :) and there were suspicious looking people across the street..red bean dessert was pretty good, everything else was ok too but nothing memorable or worth coming back
author: Anju J.

description: Came here after a long 13 mile trek around the city. I was craving some type of milk tea drink, but stumbled upon this place with my boyfriend and we ordered a small green tea shaved dessert to share. I was really surprised by how good this was! But maybe it's because I'm Asian and love Green tea and sweet red bean. The shaved ice mixed with the iced cream was actually pretty refreshing. There were barely any seats in the place, pretty crowded and everyone seems to be on their laptops so you'd feel awkward having a conversation with a friend.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Finally, a good espresso in this part of San Francisco. 

There are plenty of places that make decent espresso drinks, and some that make a show of exotic, new methods. But they all seem to lack the skills needed to make a simple espresso well. 

For me it all starts with the basics. I don't need theatre. I need an excellent shot well pulled.  If you want coffee as theater, go elsewhere. 

This is the first place I have been to anywhere between Mission Street to the Financial District that has pulled an excellent shot consistently. 

Don't come for the bells and whistles. Come for excellent coffee.
author: Christopher H.

description: Awesome!! Great place, great drinks, and great customer service!  Beautiful environment comfortable environment also make delicious sandwiches
author: Roxanne T.

description:
This review is for their shaved ice only. I haven't tried anything else. 

I used to love coming here every time I had a shaved ice craving. The shaved ice was one size only and the portion was very generous for around $6. However in the last year or so, they introduced two sizes (small for $5 and a large for $9). I got the small green tea shaved ice today and was disappointed - the shaved ice is now served in a drinking cup where the ice is on the bottom and a scoop of green tea ice cream on top making it difficult to eat. It felt like we were drinking a green tea milkshake since the ice melted quickly on the bottom of the cup. It didn't feel like a dessert item - for $5 I rather go get Boba Guys or a pint of Green Tea ice cream.
author: Kat K.

description:
Shave ice - not the best, but in downtown on late night, best you can find.  Love the nuts and the ice cream.

Latte - not hot enough, flavor is ok.

Opera cake - meh, dry and too sweet.

Not a lot of seats but don't complain, after 9pm, this is the only place that opens.
author: Mark L.

description: I love this place. I feel a strong personal resonance here, which developed shortly after dropping by for the sweet potato latte. Saw a Bible on their bookshelf and.....
author: Alberto R.

description: If you like an overpriced and mediocre menu with like 5 items on it, come here. Also the atmosphere was quiet and awkward, not sure if they always do this but it makes you realize how nice it is to have music playing in the background.
author: Jeannette H.

description:
The cafe is really clean and inviting and comfortable. All the food looks really good and the prices aren't too bad for a decent cafe in the city. and the wifi is free and fast and the password is easy to find. 
you HAVE to try the sweet potato latte. at first I thought it would be taro but no! it's sweet potato as in the orange fleshed ones you find in most groceries. I absolutely love it and I'm kinda worried if I'll be able to be satisfied by any other latte flavor after this.
author: Sarah S.

description: I had the ham and cheese croissant, and it was perfect!  Also had the chance to sample the waffle and the ice cream that comes with it was totally awesome, I highly recommend this one.
author: Brian J.

description: Wonderful macaroons and coffee! I can't wait to try the affogatto next time, it looked delicious!
author: Lauren D.

description: Just found a great coffee shop in the city!  Love the latte!  Comfortable and welcoming!  Coming back to try the sweet potato latte!
author: Laura B.

description: Top level coffee.  Super tasty dessert options.  They have some small dessert items pre made at another bakery, but the honey bread is made in house and it is huge and delicious. The shaved ice dishes are huge also and fairly unique.  Joy's is a cute neighborhood spot.
author: Rob M.

description: I seriously just stepped into a whole new world of delightfulness! Honey Bread and Sweet Potato Latte... fab-U-lous. Makes me feel good inside. :) The secure wifi is a nice touch.
author: Chris J.

description:
Nice cozy place with homey artistic decor. 

The food is fabulous, probably due to its very short menu. They serve sandwiches and really good desserts. I recommend the shaved ice and waffles. Giant portions good for sharing............ or not... 

The place gets crowded quickly because it's a small space. 

One very minuscule thing that bothered me was this one fly kept coming at my food. Protect your food. It's too precious to lose.
author: Judge F.

description: I live just steps away from this place and come here all the time, not just out of convince but out of 'joy' so to speak. I'm a huge fan of coffee and cafe food, most of all my one true love is caramel latés and this place makes it right! Just enough foam, not to sweet and a swift kick from rich espresso. It's a little pricy, but to me it's worth it! Weather I'm doing work there or taking a bite and cup Togo this little Korean cafe brings me Joy.
author: Morgan W.

description:
Having lived in both LA and NY where there's a big Korean cuisine scene, I was delighted to discover this cozy little Korean cafe in SF. I came here at 8pm on a Sunday night and it was packed! Most of the people there were students/young professionals with laptops. 

Luckily, a table left and my boyfriend and I were able to snag a seat to enjoy our green tea patbingsoo. It was SO good! They're generous with the portion - so much red bean, misugaru powder, and shredded nuts. 

When I'm craving my Korean dessert fix, I'll be sure to come back.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Café, check. Sweet staff, check. Salivating desserts, check.

My friend back from high school came to visit me in San Francisco and after a few hours of SF exploring, we needed to find some relaxing downtime with light, sweet foods. Walk a few blocks from Market St., and you'll find a peaceful, simple establishment on the corner of Post and Taylor.

Here's what we got:

-Honey Bread
*cue the heavenly choir music* This was three stacks of white toast infused with sweet honey, topped with cool whipped cream and almond slices and a side of vanilla ice cream. I got this at the suggestion of the fellow Yelpers and I'm glad I made this choice! It was moderately sweet and a little tangy at the same time. A+
-Waffles
My friend got this one and looked great! It was 4 slices of waffles (apparently homemade) with a scoop of ice cream, whipped cream, and almond slices! It wasn't anything too hearty so it complimented our warm drinks.
-Green Tea Latte
Superb. I saw the barista use one of my favorite matcha powders, so I knew if this drink went wrong it would be her fault... But luckily it wasn't! Warm, creamy goodness is what it was.
-Caffe Latte
Didn't get to try this personally, but my friend liked it! No complaints.

If you're in the area and looking for a place for chatting and sweets, this is the place to go. They offer free Wi-Fi, so feel free to bring a book or some schoolwork and complete your studies here. You won't regret it!
author: Lisa K.

description:
Friendly, good coffee, LARGE portions. Waffles were great, even late night! 

Good place for a quick meal, or to stay a while and chat. Many people studying/reading/on laptops.
author: Lisa B.

description: Tried the strawberry and green tea shaved ice. Big portions and good amount of toppings. Sort of a Starbucks vibe with students with laptops sitting around for hours while paying customers can't find a table to enjoy their desserts.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I really like this place. The coffee is great, they turn on nice music there and it's opened until late. But please for the sake of the universe never ever try the sweet potato latte. Ugh. The sandwiches side salad's dressing is also a bit weird, but ok (if you like raspberry) 
Putting 4* just because it's hard to get a table :)
author: Sophia S.

description: Really great place to grab a light bite to eat. It might not be the most filling, but the quality of the food is really good. The waffle smell was what enticed us to come over in the first place. I ordered a waffle with ice cream and a green tea latte. If I had known they had a sweet potato latte, I'd try that! My other friends also tried the waffle, a panini, and a tart, and all of them liked what they'd ordered. I'll be back!
author: Veronica C.

description: Pretty cool mellow loungy coffee shop...Best pastries I've had in a while. My friend says the drip coffee is the best she has had in SF
author: Alex M.

description:
I love this place! good stuff, pretty, nice crowd and great staff ppl. I Highly recommend
this place to anyone.
author: Cintia C.

description:
Great place to grab a coffee and work/study (free wifi), have a meeting, or eat lunch. I live really close to this place and it has become by go-to cafe. The staff here is nice and the interior of the cafe is cozy with a good combination of various seating and table arrangements to accommodate small to medium sized groups. 

The shaved ice here is good and a very large portion (enough to share with 2-4 people)!
author: Jonathan L.

description: Stopped in after dinner for some macaroons. We had an assortment of six baby macaroons for $9.00. I really like the menu wall where they have little cups drawn out that explain what each different coffee beverage is.
author: Karen A.

description:
Get the HONEY BREAD. 3 slice of toast soaked in honey butter + whipped cream + toasted almonds + big ass scoop of vanilla ice cream. Ugh, so amazing.

The shaved ice bowl is really good too. Huge portion (shareable for 2-3 people) of shaved ice covered in condensed milk, red bean, and toasted almonds, topped off with vanilla ice cream.

The cafe itself is pretty small. A lot of people table squatting with their laptops, so expect to wait for a place to sit.

Short walk from Union Square, lots of good sushi places nearby, will be back!
author: Will Z.

description:
Great place for coffee, nice ambiance. I do wish they had a better selection of pastries, especially in the morning.

Not a good choice for breakfast.
author: Don N.

description: The shaved ice is very good. We ordered the Green Tea Shaved Ice with red beans.  The serving was generously large, well crafted and tasty!  It was a pleasure finding a asian / hawaiian dessert so close to Union Square, open late. Small seating area, jam packed at 10:00pm on a Thursday night, with Internet surfers. Local vibe, atmosphere is basic. I would revisit.
author: R Y.

description:
Came here for the sweet potato latte in the recommendation of yelp. Ask the barista about it, who tells me they're sold out for the day. Boo. 

I ask why it's so well-received, and the guy shows me his colleague making it behind him, and that it'll be at least another 10 minute wait. I'm cool with this, and pay. 

Less than five minutes later the sweet, creamy perfection arrived. Imagine sweet potato pie had a ninja fight with a milk frother and ended up falling in love... And you've got this amazeballs drink.
author: Bonny A.

description:
came across this little gem while looking for a place to top off after lunch. their dessert menu is limited but simply delectable. we ordered the red bean shaved ice with green tea ice cream and the honey bread. they were much bigger than we expected and were glad that there were 5 of us to split; the honey bread itself could've been a meal! both were very yummy and perfect desserts for a sunny SF day.

i really liked the vibe, very warm and inviting, and it had that cozy little neighborhood coffee shop feel that seems like a cool place to study or catch up on some work while sippin' on some caffeine. based solely the desserts though, i'd recommend trying this place!
author: Franco F.

description:
Great little gem in the TenderNob! 

- Friendly staff
- Amazing Sweet Potato latte. Don't knock it until you've tried it!
- Great Green Tea latte 
- Respectful noise level (soft background music)
- Comfy seating
- Neat chalkboard descriptions of the drinks
- Tasty looking treats (admittedly have not tried them)
- Free Wifi 

- Sadly lacking in outlets though... buying a power strip would improve the experience tenfold.
author: Matt S.

description: Review is for their shaved ice. Although the portion is fairly large, the quality of ice is pretty bleh. It was more icy than the typical fluffy soft asian saved ice.
author: Christy C.

description: Sorry the picture is kind of dark. My friend and I spontaneously decided go come here after seeing pictures of their shaved ice on yelp. Was disappointed though. The shaved ice was very icy/crunchy and they didn't portion out the toppings nicely. The workers also couldn't speak English so I had to repeat myself a few times. I'm giving 4/5 stars because what made this place good was the relaxing atmosphere and free wifi! I would come back just because it's a good place to study.
author: Kimmy L.

description: I wanted to try something new, so I went here to try shaved ice. I ordered the red bean and would give that 5 stars. However, I also ordered a spicy chicken sandwich, but it wasn't spicy enough for me, so that was worthy of my 2 star review.
author: Gloria A.

description: It's a very good cozy cafe! Usually there are a lot of people with laptops because the WiFi network here is really fast! Nice desserts, sandwiches and coffee! It's a good place for sitting with a cup of coffee and working (but don't sit for a long time, there are other people who want to sit too) ;)
author: Ilia S.

description: I got the tuna melt panini! It was amazing and it was honestly the best tuna melt ever... The music was good as well. And the service was so nice and friendly ! Anytime I come into the city ... I am coming here!!!!
author: Yesenia V.

description: We only noticed this place because the sign said "Yuna Kim is the real champion". When I yelped this place and saw this had Korean shaved ice we had to come try it. The place is very cute, lots of international students studying and chatting. Loved the chalk art on the walls with the pictorial description of different coffees. Green tea shaved ice was fantastic! Very much looking forward to trying their coffee next time. Will definitely be back!
author: Betty C.

description: This is the best coffee shop I have ever been to. It holds a special place in my heart. I have bee to many coffee shops all over the world and to this day Joys place holds the number one spot. They make their own chocolate sauce that pairs perfectly with the espresso they use. Absolutely the best mocha I've ever had.
author: Ashley Y.

description: order the green tea shaved ice. Taste bomb! This might sound strange but the ice cream taste reminds me of avocado shake, in a good way :)
author: Ciyinta B.

description: I was looking for a place I could have macarons and some earl grey tea pretty late at night. This place was so perfect! The music was peaceful and calming. The person there made my earl grey exactly the way I like it, with a bit of milk. They have cute delicious macarons that are soooo fresh and perfectly made! I give it five stars. It's exactly what you think of when you want a tea and dessert type atmosphere!
author: Nauti S.

description: Good desserts. This place is open pretty late, I went around 10 pm and there were still people in there working on their laptops sipping coffee. However they either ran out or put away most of the pastry type desserts. Luckily what I went for was the shaved ice. There aren't alot of flavor options (only four I believe) but the ones I tried are delicious. I had green tea which is flavored shaved ice, a scoop of green tea ice cream, condensed milk and nuts. If you are lactose intolerant, avoid this- it's not a sno-cone, it definitely has a alot of dairy. My friend who happens to be lactose intolerant, had the red bean flavor and just omitted the ice cream/milk. I had never tried red bean and it is surprisingly good! Yes, it tastes like a bean but its sweet- kind of like the sweet potato of beans. I can't attest to the coffee selections but for the desserts, I'd say give this place try!
author: Joana Z.

description: Love atmosphere here! Nice service and well coffee. But, sometimes I feel like the background music is too loud. It would be five stars for me when they turn down the volume!
author: Minmindy W.

description:
Where to begin.

Finally decided to try this place after holding out since the area didn't seem all that great but glad to say its location is not bad at all. Not really in  the tenderloin but rather the outer TL, more restaurants and bar/lounges around and whatnot.

The ambiance of this place to say the least is really "homey" with a modern design touch as far as the interior goes. The prices seemed fair enough (drip coffee at $2), I went with a decaf americano tho since they couldn't do a decaf drip, probably since it was around 11:30 at night and they close at 12. I have got to say tho, it tasted amazing! Might honestly had been the best I've had so far out of all the other coffee shops/cafes I've been to. 

Id definitely return here again to try the other drinks or food. The fact they're open late is also a plus. But why 4 stars instead of 5 you may ask? 2 words: DOUCHEBAG BARISTA. I don't know what his deal is, but all I got from him was this "I hate my job/life so ill just take it out on the customer" attitude. I thought maybe it was just me but I read some of the other reviews and ive seen similar reviews regarding a certain barista and i'm betting we're all talking about the same one hah. So all douchebaggery aside,  a definite go-to place for some quality coffee!
author: Nate C.

description: Cute, cozy little coffee shop. I had a waffle (but it was a good waffle!) and hung out for a while for the atmosphere. I love the free Wi-Fi, and it seems like a place where they're open to you hanging out for a while. I'll be back - wish they had more of a menu, though!
author: Emily A.

description: As visitors from Texas, we were running around the area looking for somewhere to grab dessert and saw Joy's Place on Yelp. We tried the cheesecake (which was decent) and the affogato (ahh, hit the spot). The place was full of younger guys playing games on the tables that seat more people, or at least it was when we got there, so we found a cozy little table that sit just two.
author: Shirley A.

description:
Everything is pretty good just as the other reviewers have said. 

However, I haven't seen anyone mention one particularly rude staff member. The girls that work there are pretty nice and friendly, but the one guy with a beard is super cold and rude: not just to me, but to most customers. I really don't want to say that he is racist, but apparently he is a lot more friendly to Caucasian customers.
author: D Z.

description: Not sure what the rave about this place is. The shaved ice is so 2012 as it is just plain ice and not the real bingsoo where the ice is made of milk and much softer. That being said, it makes the shave ice here overpriced. The day I came, cake selection was minimal and the variety was not there. Regular coffee shop fair it seems.
author: Johnny N.

description:
A friend was in town so we decided to grab dinner before heading to Joy's for dessert. 

I had never heard of Joy's, but I should of. This place has a good selection of desserts. We picked the Waffles and Ice Cream. The waffles are nice and warm which meshes perfectly with the ice cream. They also give you maple syrup on the side, and I can tell you it was Canadian approved. 

Seemed like a nice place to work when you need a change of scenery, almost every other table has someone hidden behind a macbook, so I assume there was free wifi too.
author: Brad M.

description:
Cute place but I wasn't too excited about my red bean shaved ice. I'm pretty picky when it comes to that stuff, I like my ice the same consistency as snow and the red bean was a bit too sweet for my liking.

Great service and clean, I've just had better.
author: Lexi M.

description:
Pros: This cozy Asian cafe has the best desserts! I love how most people here are also working/studying so there's almost a library feel to it - except this place is open until midnight!

Cons: Sometimes there are loud tourist groups - I blame it on the proximity to Union Square :)
author: Mariana F.

description: Beautiful feeling in this quaint cafe near union Square. We stayed at Hotel Monaco (awesome hotel) and Joy's Place is just around the corner - and was open on the Monday after July 4th (lots of cafes were closed today). Coffee was scrumptious (we are Australian's and dislike the typical American coffee) we had a regular and soy cafe latte which were delicious and hot! The menu is limited but the food is delicious. We shared the grilled cheese panini and then the honey bread - the kind waitress informed us that the honey bread was huge as we were also going to order waffles and we are very grateful she pointed us in the right direction (see photo for size of honey bread). Very reasonable prices also! All food and drinks were totally yum and the cafe was quiet with great music playing in the background. Highly recommend visiting Joy's Place!
author: Abbey H.

description:
Joy's has got something for all types of coffee-shop goers.  Tasty food for the hungry type, strong coffee for the tired, GREAT sweet potato latte for the chill type, large tables for people to read at, a nice couch...and for the main reason that I go, the desserts.
I recommend: sweet potato latte, chicken panini
I highly recommend: red bean shaved ice and honey bread.  

Red bean shaved ice: it's BOMBASTIC.  finely shaved ice with a lot more than just red beans.  it's got vanilla ice cream, mochi balls, this nutty powder (sesame i think), almond slices...and tears of Joy's
author: James T.

description: Went to Joy's Place for a quick small bite on my last night in SF and was delighted. It is a small, cozy, minimalist place with a small but flavourful menu. I had the Grilled Cheese Panini and it was one of the best paninis I've ever had. Bf had the Tuna Melt and was delighted as well. Will definitely visit again when we're back in the city!
author: Frances L.

description:
cutest coffee shop, so korean!
I had the sweet potato latte, it was a bit sweet for my taste but it was pretty good. very well made. def will come back more often now. It is a bit pricey though.
author: Thy D.

description:
What a great find! It was a couple hours before we had dinner reservations and I needed a snack ASAP so I looked on Yelp and found this near our hotel-Minutes later I was on a mission to get us to Joy's for waffles-

Walked a couple blocks and found it-Upon entering it's a cozy little place that was filled with people with their computers, nothing loud just a soothing place to relax in-We placed our order:
-Latte
-Hot Chocolate
-Waffles

We grabbed a table and waited for our order to be ready-Inside it has a nice environment, intimate and tucked away on Post street, music playing but not blaring, and very inviting smells of coffee and waffles-

We walked up to retrieve our items that were ready and they looked as good as they tasted-

My boyfriends latte had a heart drawn on top, I love hearts so that excited me ;) My hot chocolate had no design but it was very good-And the waffles...oh how good they were-Nothing crazy about them, no obscene size, no weird ingredients..just good old fashioned waffles that were served with maple syrup and a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the side-

It hit the spot just perfect, cold day outside and inside it was warm with the smell of hot chocolate and waffles around me-

If you are in the area and need waffles try Joy's, it was a "joy" to visit :)
author: -Tristan- L.

description:
This is a small and cute cafe. My friend and I ordered 2 drinks: Sweet Potato latte and Green Tea latte. The green tea latte was creamy and sweet and you can taste the green tea. I know it's called green tea latte, but some places just make this drink taste sweet. The sweet potato latte was too sweet for my taste but you can really taste the sweet potato. 

Good job Joy!
author: Theresa D.

description:
We came to Joy's Place for dessert. We had a lot of it and it was delicious! We ordered the honey bread. It's description doesn't sound like a real dessert: bread with honey, cinnamon and whipped cream and ice cream. But we ordered it anyway and were blown away. It was so sweet and delicious. The bread was toasted and crispy, the honey smooth and sweet. The cinnamon set off the flavors and the ice cream and whipped cream topped it perfectly. If you don't like super sweet things, try something else.

I also had a decaf americano which was great.

Free wi-fi. There was plenty of seating and quite a few people studying/working while we were there.
author: Meadow P.

description: We came here to try the Sweet Potato Latte.  At $5 a cup, it was rather pricey for what it was.  I do like the innovate idea and the quality was good, but the price was rather steep.  It would be awesome if they could offer tiny toasted marshmallows to top it off even though it is a latte.  If you're in the neighborhood, maybe give it a try.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come visit though.
author: Tramy V.

description:
Great Korean cafe to eat and read/study/work.  Wifi has been stable, and I like that it's nice and bright. They have a pretty small menu that consist of a couple sandwiches, and desserts such as thick toast, patbingsoo (korean shaved ice with ice cream and mochi) and coffee drinks, pastries, and macaroons. 

A lot of Koreans hang out here.
author: Jenn L.

description: The decorations in this place are really cute, but the place is small and you'll be lucky if you find a seat. I came here to try the shaved ice which is the only reason why I'm giving this place 3 stars. The bowl of ice is HUGE, but the ice cream scoop was very small, there was maybe a tablespoon of red bean and about 10 mochi pieces. Not worth it for $8. I was hoping they would give more toppings and drizzle some condensed milk (YUM). I know this place isn't known for their desserts so I'm willing to come back and try out their coffee.
author: Cindy A.

description:
BEST cafe I've ever been to in San francisco!!!
I often go to the Joy's place when I need a place to hang out with my friends or study.
Baristas are kind, nice and they made really good coffeeeess
I recommend cafe mocha, it's one of the most delicious coffee I've tried. 
Desserts are good, too! looks pretty and tastes really good!
Honey bread, waffle, cakes, macarons, and red bean shaved ice!
I love all of them but my favorite is the red bean shaved ice :)

Another good things are they have free-wifi and open till late, 11pm!
author: Jiyoung L.

description:
Sweet Potato Latte = delicious taste of autumn in my mouth. 

I heard about is place because of their sweet potato latte. I'm glad I made the trip. They use real sweet potato purée. The final result was a slightly sweet latte with a settle essence of cinnamon and nutmeg. Much better than the artificial tasting 'Pumpkin Spice' latte that Starbucks serves. They get their expresso from Mr. Expresso in Oakland, so they get extra points for using a local roaster.

They also have a small menu with panini's and desserts. And free wifi! Jody's Place is a welcomed respite for the Tenderloin.
author: Brianna M.

description: Very good internet cafe. Opens late. Good Grill cheese sandwich. Excellent sweet potato latte. You can taste sweet potato in the Latte. Very yummy!
author: Jeni Y.

description:
Great latte and a staff that was really nice or ice cold depending on the moment or caffeine cycle?
It's modern and has bible verse on the wall, why? It felt a bit isolating to those of us non Christians . . . but whatever, In and Out Burger is the same.

Did I mention the latte was good? It was clean and modern.
author: Lizzy M.

description:
It was out late night stop to get some hot beverage and a pastry. I read the reviews of this place and decided to go here with my husband. We ordered caramel latte and tiramisu. 
Well all I can say is I had better latte and tiramisu before. This was a super average place.
author: Shazeen N.

description:
Shaved ice seems little expensive at $8 ... And their sweet potato latte is just bland... 
People working there were pretty friendly...
author: Elie P.

description: Joy's is one of my favorite cafes to visit any hour of the day, given they're open early enough for the morning risers and late enough for studious students. My favorite coffee is the caramel latte (only costing 4 bucks and some change served in a mug or cup), I strongly believe they're drink is the best I've ever tasted. I enjoy visiting this cafe if I want to relax and surf the deep web or possibly find inspiration to do something creative. On the other hand, the cafe is very small, food selection is slim and lacks social diversity. Any potential customer should consider why they would want to visit this establishment before arriving.
author: Oris B.

description: Tried the following - all excellent: Sweet Potato Latte, Red Bean Shaved Ice & Honey Bread. Humongous servings for the shaved ice & honey bread. Make sure to share!  Gave only 4 stars because of location - impossible to find parking, had to pay $6 to park for 1 hour to sample the goodies.
author: Laura F.

description: Joy's is a little Korean cafe with modern decorations and cute chalkboard art. I ordered the green tea Patbingsoo to share since it is huge. It came with red bean and a scoop of green tea ice cream which were yummy toppings, but the ice wasn't crushed soft enough making it hard to eat. The ambiance is amazing, which is why I would come back and to try the sweet potato latte everyone loves.
author: Hannah P.

description: So I came here for the second time with my friends. We ordered the green tea shaved ice again. Last time, the shaved ice was fluffy and flavorful, but it was not this time. I would give them 3 stars, but I'll give them 4 because I still have hope for a better shaved ice for next time.
author: Larry H.

description: A solid internet cafe (Asian style) that is perfect for students. Offerings are not extensive as a true coffee house though the green tea lattes and coffee/espresso options will cover most coffee drinkers' basic needs. The hot chocolate is very good, while the sweet potato latte has received quite a number of mentions. Sometimes simplicity is the way to go when it comes to finding a place to sit down, read, talk, and relax. And even better that it is not named Starbucks!
author: Nelson W.

description:
Came here twice -- 

(1) once to work, during which I mooched off their free wifi and abundance of electrical plugs for a couple of hours, listening to soothing jazz music in the background, sipping my sweet potato latte (not too sweet, pulpy, surprisingly pleasant!)

(2) another time with my boyfriend for a late night dessert: a large, green tea patbingsoo! The patbingsu was delicious, perhaps a little too sweet for my taste, and probably would have fed 2.5-3 people (all for $9). However, you have to eat quickly, because the shaved ice melts quickly. 

All in all, perfect for working AND for date night :)
author: Courtney N.

description: Visited San Fran for the first time and found Joy's on the last night in town.  What a great place.  Plenty of people hanging out and good food to boot.  Go to this place in the FiDi!
author: Michael S.

description: Probably the only coffee/cafe that opens late and free of loitering homeless people... also order the shaved iced.
author: Gina H.

description: Great place to park myself after a long flight, relax with a sandwich and some tea, enjoy the warmth and the really bad pop music, and just chill. Honestly, I wish I had been in the mood for coffee and red bean shaved ice, but unfortunately I needed something more substantial and less caffeinated. Most people look like they've been parked here with their laptops for quite a while, so maybe I should come back with my computer to sample the other goodies!
author: Deb G.

description:
Delicious coffee and green tea shaved ice. The matcha shake is my favorite! Very excited to have found a coffee shop close to my house that is great. 

The staff are all sweeties too!
author: Sara H.

description: This place has the best waffles and their coffee is excellent. If you are looking for a great quiet coffee house I highly recommend it.
author: Manny N.

description: I like this place, mainly because it's open.  WTF San Francisco!  Please stop being a cow town and stay open past 9pm?  Good Grief...
author: ein bier bitte k.

description: This little cafe is super cute and feels like you're at home for the way it is decorated! The workers are friendly from my point of view. I got the Caramel Latte and my mom got the Green Tea Latte and they both tastes just fine. Thinking of coming by again to try out their Cheese Panini and Honey bread!
author: Amanda C.

description: I don't see why this place is highly rated and why people are raving about their desserts. We ordered the waffles and the green tea shaved ice. Both were quite terrible. Terrible to the point where I felt sad about life after eating a few bites. I also got an iced mocha. This too was quite terrible. They have wifi.
