author: Alyssa M.

description: We were looking for dessert places in the area and this came up on Yelp. I've been here twice now, both times getting the red bean shaved ice and a hot tea. What a delicious treat! Perfect amount of sweetness from the condensed milk, and the ice is finely shaved. The cafe itself is nice, with plenty of seating, fast wi-fi, cute decor, and nice lighting. I'd definitely come back to settle in and do work one afternoon or something.
author: Mary N.

description:
The sweet potato latte is SO GOOD.
Get it. Seriously.
author: K H.

description: Oh. My. Gosh!!! Best cakes EVER!!! We stopped in for dessert to take back to our hotel room on Friday night and the place was packed! I wish they had more options for dessert but I absolutely cannot complain with how amazing what we got was!! We also came in late so I understand why they were running out of everything. Thanks!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Such a cute contemporary place. Seats are extremely comfortable and the desserts weren't too heavy. Music was the perfect decibel and it was the perfect chill factor to end our night. Highly recommend the cheesecake and strawberry shortcake.
author: Hussain H.

description:
I've been to this place three times since they opened it on last Wednesday.
Tried their Latte, Hot Chocolate and SWEET POTATO LATTE.

1) Latte: Smooth and high quality. This place has the right ratio of espresso and milk unlike starbucks or other coffee places nearby. Also, a barista drew me a perfect heart on top of it! :)

2)Hot Chocolate : This place melts REAL Chocolate. 

3)Sweet Potato Latte: A lot of place use sweet potato powders, but I think this places uses mashed steamed sweet potato. It is the best sweet potato latte ever:)

Menus are little bit pricey compared to quantity though...
Sweet Potato Latte was $5. 
But I've satisfied with the quality of drinks.

Joy's Place is worth a try!
author: Sara I.

description: Accidental review...looked in, simple coffee shop, did not eat here.
author: Naji S.

description: Fantastic cappuccino, great atmosphere, clean, comfortable seating, and love the Asian menu!
author: Nicola L.

description: The drip coffee is really good. Yum. Fairly quiet place to get some work done, but not too quiet. I didn't get a chance to try the other pastries and treats they had on display, but there were quite a few desserts to sample from as well. I will be back!
author: Mel G.

description: Perfect middle ground between mom/pop "squeeze in if you can" and gigantic "take a number" places.  And espresso best yet!!!!
author: Randy H.

description: Better coffee than Starbuck, better internet and better atmosphere. Ideal for wireless workers.
author: Sebastian R.

description: Sweet, quiet little coffee shop not far from the hustle and bustle. I had a delicious caramel latte. They also have panini and desserts including two types of shaved ice. The staff is friendly and efficient. Five bar stools facing the street, seven two-top tables with electric outlets, a few tables in the middle and a comfortable couch. A bathroom that you don't need a code to get into! Simple and cozy decor. Quiet music playing. Several people studying/working but also people chatting. A total oasis not far from the honking horns and tourists a few blocks over in Union Square.
author: Hanna H.

description:
Had the spicy chicken panini-- it was great with lots of flavor.  Also got an iced coffee, which was smooth and not bitter at all!  Great atmosphere.  Loved the 90's music.  This was one of the few places I was able to find where I could actually take my computer and get work done. Service was also prompt and friendly.

I will be back later to try their desserts, which look and sound phenomenal.
author: Jillian S.

description: Joy's Place is so adorable! I stopped in after dinner with a friend, and we shared their red bean bingsoo. Portions are definitely enough for more than two people; the ice is so soft, and the toppings are delicious. The cafe was surprisingly busy for a weeknight, but it seems like a lot of students come to study. Will definitely be back!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Coffee is really good!! The caramel machiato was perfect not too sweet and not bitter. The shaved ice is really good plus service is great super fast
author: Sharon K.

description: Environment, staff, tea, snacks were all quite good.  Greentea bingsoo wasn't super sweet and had more substance instead of being super water and thin.  The lighting was good.  I dont know how it is in terms of working, but for meet up with friends it is quite good.
author: David L.

description: Such sweet staff. I am not the typical clientele-- not asian, not in the tech industry-- but I feel right at home. They remember my order, are super polite, and keep this place spotless. Plus the wifi (password john611post) is very fast. Check it out. And the honey bread is epic.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I like:
The pre-made desserts in the case are decent.
The coffee is OK - I prefer dark bitter roast, but they offer the new trend taste of no burnt taste coffee.

Needs improvement:
Long bleached-haired woman behind the counter doing food prep needs to put her hair up, don't play with your hair, and don't do your makeup behind the counter!
The workers are nice, but don't have experience with customer service, and doesn't look like anyone experienced is supervising/coaching them.
author: MT Y.

description: Cute space for studying or killing time. Menu items are adorable but overpriced for what you get. For example - a grilled cheese panini with a side salad and a cafe latte was $12. At most I'll come here armed with my laptop or book and order a regular drip coffee or tea.
author: Elaine W.

description: Took forever to get or order, standing room only no seats (which I suppose is a good sign). Felt like they had forgotten about our order, finally asked for it to go. It was pretty unique desserts, but not amazing and I think they need to source a better ice cream. Keep it up, maybe you will have something here.
author: Cori A.

description:
A GREAT FIND!

Came here on a whim on my way to Infinite. the fog was rolling in so I needed something to warm me up, ordered a Mocha and this was just perfect. Tasted great, smooth and creamy. The food/desert the other patrons had ordered simply looked amazing. The pictures here on yelp does it no justice. A small boutique coffee shop just off Union Square. I recommend anybody to stop by if they're in the area.
author: James P.

description: A very quirky and pleasant cafe! Modern design, clean, and not too loud. The hot chocolate and caramel latte were both very rich and delicious. A great spot to hide away from the buzz of the city but still be able to people watch through the big windows facing the street. Thumbs up!
author: Joshua M.

description: Had a great latte and macaroons! Also the service was amazing! Super friendly staff!!
author: Sam S.

description: Great little cafe for relaxing after a walk in downtown, this is my favorite cafe in san francisco so far, I always go there for an espresso and a panini. The desserts seem very tasty, I will try some next time.
author: Marcos E.

description: This place is nice to hang out and it's open late. Cafe feels very Korean/Asian. I like to pretend I'm in a kdrama when I enter. The people working there are cute. I enjoy their Korean makeup and sparkly eyes. Yep.
author: Xue H.

description: This place has some of the best coffee on the block, but I just ordered a green tea latte with soy milk and it made me feel like I was walking on fucking sunshine. I think I just found my new "I'm so hungover I can't see past the counter" drink. And it's Thanksgiving and they're open. Thanks, Joy's, for brightening my life.
author: Mase M.

description:
This place is hella pricy. 4 bucks for hot chocolate, WTF?
I have tried most of the drinks on their menu, and while they are all good, I definitely feel they are overpriced. 

The place fills up quickly with 20 somethings working on their laptops.
author: A B.

description: Its my favorite cafe in san francisco. Its very close to my home and internet is fast!! I love their latte and waffle. Great atmosphere  but sometimes there's a lot of group came and I couldnt talk with my friend and do my work!
author: Terisa R.

description: Went here with a favorite colleague last week and tried the sweet potato latte, of which I was a fan.  It tasted like perfectly cooked yams with a light touch of brown sugar.  I don't even know whether there was coffee in it, and I kind of didn't even care.  Said friend/colleague ordered some kind of citrus tea, which she liked, but also mentioned was rather strongly flavored, particularly toward the end of the cup, when it tasted as if she was drinking kumquats.  She also had the tuna melt, which seemed to be decent, very tuna-ey (in a not-unpleasant way), but nothing to write home about.  The best part of this place was the ample seating and the fact that it's close enough to the center of downtown to walk to, but far enough away from it that it isn't jam-packed with people.
author: Maisie G.

description: Small cafe mocha packed a caffeine punch!  Quite deliciously not-as-sweet as Starbux.  It looked closed on the outside with a padlock looking thing on the door and the windowglass was dark, but lo and behold there were people inside and it was very open.  The green ice cream looked really good but I was there for caffeine.
author: Kim S.

description: Sweet place, calm or chatty ambience, fun snacks. I found my nice sweet potato latte here that can be made with almond milk.
author: Jeannie C.

description: My favorite coffee shop in Downtown SF! I love their saved ice and honey bread. That place attracts a lot of students and professionals who come sit there for hours and study/work on a regular basis. Also it's a perfect dating spot as they serve some amazing sweet treats.
author: Ah M.

description: My husband and I popped in for a quick dessert when we were in town. We had read about the honey bread, and it absolutely lived up to our expectations. Chill atmosphere. We enjoyed the decor and every last bite of our pile of toast! Yummmm!
author: Kati H.

description: Maybe I'm just accustomed to LA's k-town, but this place was not up to par despite the review. I was excited to try out a Korean shaved ice place in SF, but it all just boiled down to disappointments.. I went tonight and the place was packed with mostly people on their computers, which I didn't mind. I ordered the green tea shaved ice in large and it definitely did not look like the picture everyone was posting nor was the portion size the same. The order did come out very fast though.. but with no bowls and spoons. So I asked the girl working if there were any bowls and spoons and she just turns around and tells the dude working to help that girl out in Korean. So this dude turns to me and just stares at me.. so I ask again are there any bowls or spoons since I was sharing and he said we don't have bowls, but we have these coffee cups.. and I was like and the spoons? Which he replied they're right behind there. The whole time I was there I got no thank yous, even after ordering, no just a moment, no sorries, and just flat out no good customer service. I wish this was it... but it's not. After we sat down on a table after waiting for a while to clear up, the dude that was working the register stepped outside, pulled the door wide open and started smoking a cigarette. The smoke was coming inside the cafe, which was not pleasant. After he was done and came back in, I did not see him wash his hands. The girl working fixed her hair as well and did not wash her hands either.. nasty. I saw the 98 health score, but I think they definitely deserve less. Maybe I came at a bad time, but I'm not coming back. Oh, forgot to mention, the shaved ice wasn't that great..
author: Hae Rim H.

description: The location is very near my new digs, so I stopped by to work in this cafe the other day. I liked the atmosphere, but the house coffee was burned and yucky. I guess if you're a cafe, the one thing I'd expect you to do well is coffee, but that's just me.
author: Jen R.

description: One time my girlfriend and I walked 1.1 miles from Kearny to Joy's Place. It was an off-the-cuff dessert moment. We were willing to walk for that shit. The experience was kind of like a self-introductory passing through the city's heart of tourism, wiring together the circuits of the SF map in our minds. Ever since then, we've taken the same path to get there, so we always pass the hotels on Post that look better than your home, or your second home, or your second home in your dreams. The lobbies look red-warm, and I've always wanted one of the guards at the front door to look at me. I don't even care if he nods in acceptance. Just so long as he acts like this is where I belong. The first time at Joy's Place I tried the green tea shaved ice, since fancy and shaved ice usually never dance together, just sit along the walls of their high school's auditorium. While shoveling in all the red beans, I noticed a wall painting that was possibly made by one of the international students I tutored at school once. It's a hella detailed painting of a cup of coffee with her name (I swear) scribbled on the bottom, and I wish I could go back to that appointment and maybe think of her as something other than a student struggling to learn our broken-glass-ball language. The other time, I ordered the honey bread and no one helped me eat it. My girlfriend has this habit of extracting enjoyment from forcing me to finish what I start. Specifically food. The leftovers sat in the fridge of our temporary home in Sacramento, where we stayed with a very welcoming family. It was a cold, soggy dessert that soothed me as I searched craigslist for a permanent home in SF, or Oakland, so I didn't have to commute 2 hours for grad school. Or maybe I ate it while I was buzzed and pleading craigslist for a hit. Either way, it was an impossible search. But I always took the same path.
author: Logan E.

description: What a fantastic place! The paninis are amazing, so fresh! My favourite thing about this place is the hot chocolate! Words cannot describe how amazing it is  such a pretty place with delightful food it's a fantastic place
author: Claire C.

description: The food is ok, the environment is peaceful. But the cashier is kind of rude, barely heard what she say. Her attitude sound like she don't want to serve me.
author: Mabel M.

description: Overpriced, kind of rude. Oversweet sweet potato latte.
author: Nik A.

description:
It's nice place to chill but not really for working because it's small and crowded.
Good hand-sketching menu on black board and I go with a Green Tea latte, it's soon yummy and attractive.
author: Phuong N.

description: Delicious and cute cafe near Union Square! My friends and I came here for iced coffee and green tea lattes. The green tea lattes had good matcha flavor. Joy's place also has free wifi with cute decor inside. The dessert section looked awesome and I have to come back to try their fruit tarts!
author: Jennifer D.

description: This place is open until midnight and it serves good coffee. WHY DOESNT EVERYONE KNOW ABOUT THIS PLACE!! There have been countless amounts of times where I have wanted good coffee late and only been able to find a Starbucks. Joy's is doing us all a public service. I strongly recommend ordering the sweet potato late.
author: Marlene F.

description: Coffee in a wine glass.  What about this do I not love?  A cute little spot with free wi-fi and "Dutch coffee".  Conveniently located near Union Square, this place has an assortment of pastries; along with beverages.  The people working there are nice and the vibe is chill.
author: Hiromi N.

description: I stayed at a hotel near this cafe and decided to venture out to find a late night snack. I tried the fruit tart and had a decaf Americano. Both were good. The fruit tart had really fresh fruit and it was not too sweet. Very quaint little cafe. I will come back when in the area.
author: Tran N.

description: Don't eat the chicken or tuna sandwiches - bread is good but the filling is seriously terrible.  Desserts look good, but didn't try them.
author: Tyler B.

description: We stopped by this modern coffee shop on the way to union square without any expectations. I ordered a soy cappuccino and it was pretty good, but what really caught my attention was the spiced chicken. It was a sandwich with deliciously spiced chicken, some cranberry, and arugula/lettuce. It was a tasty surprise and I could definitely go for some in the future. The iced teas are pretty refreshing as well. The cafe itself is very mellow and well decorated, overall a good place to just sit and relax.
author: Tal M.

description: Super clean place with a limited menu but my oh my, where else will you get a heaping bowl of red bean shaved ice?, also comes in green tea :) the music they play is..well, interesting. If you're into the whole  k-pop scene, then you're in heaven. But screw the music, the fresh raspberry dressing salad was bomb and the workers were nice. Left joyful from Joys.
author: Lucy F.

description: Move over Starbucks because this place kicks your ass!  I love sweet potatoes, hot milk and coffee and these guys created the trifecta.  Meow!
author: Pedro R.

description: Joy's Place was only a block or so from our hotel and when looking for a good cup of "good-night" coffee, our concierge recommended this one.  Not disappointed at all.  The guys behind the counter were nice and friendly and the coffee delicious!!  Young and hip atmosphere....we're not very young, but feel rather hip, loved the place ~ everyone seems to fit in.  This is the only place we stopped in twice during our 5 day stay and the affogato is amazing!!  Hey, when you put ice cream and coffee together, there's no going wrong!!
author: Carol M.

description: Really great coffee shop! Had the grilled cheese and it was awesome. Just randomly stopped in here, what a good find.
author: Nathan C.

description: It was a bit pricey here, but the Sweet Potato Latte was on point! I was a bit concerned that it would taste much like Starbucks' chestnut praline drink (all HFCS). Instead, the drink had little bits of sweet potato and the texture was amazing! I love love LOVE this place! The music wasn't too loud, the service was decent and the drinks were great. My best friend ordered the green tea matcha latte and that was way better than any green tea we get in San Diego. I will for sure come back during my stay here in SF and whenever I come back! But like I said, it is a bit pricey, but just order one drink and you'll be set :3
author: Kate D.

description: We ordered a Honey Toast and the Green Tea Patbingsoo. The Shaved ice as a lot bigger than expected but it as tasty. Everything you would expect from the picture. The Honey Toast was surprisingly good. It reminds me of the French Toast Crunch cereal but don't get it confused with french toast. If you are a fan of cinnamon and ice cream you will love it. Definitely coming back. They are open late so that is a big plus. Just dont go fri/sat night all the clubbers are out and no parking.
author: Sean C.

description: Coffee is always great there. Food is delicious. It does get busy sometimes, so finding a seat can be an interesting task. I can understand why though great place and great service.
author: Amy W.

description: I ordered a double shot cappuccino. Best coffee I had in SF - seriously.
author: Tzvi K.

description: Sweet Potato Latte was amazing.  Since the location is small there wasn't anywhere to sit so I didn't really get a good thorough look at the menu since I ordered to go but I saw this yummy looking dessert someone else had ordered so I am definitely coming back
author: Monica H.

description: Great alternative snacks (try the waffles or honey bread), delicious affogatos (ice cream with espresso), comfortable environment, friendly service.
author: Danielle L.

description:
Finally some excellent coffee in the TenderNob! 

I've been in Joy's place twice. Once on a week day and it was pretty empty. The other time was on a weekend, and it was almost full of people working on their laptops and doing homework.

What does a good coffee shop need?
- Good coffee: check (on par with Blue Bottle/Ritual)
- Free Wi-Fi: check
- Good music: check
- Lots of places to sit: check
- Food: I haven't tried it, but the pastries look like they are from my favorite bakery in the city (Gerhard Michler in Dogpatch)
- Large windows: check
- Clean bathroom: check

It could use better signage though. It is sandwiched between other establishments, so unless you stand right in front of it, it's pretty hard to spot.
author: Eugene O.

description: Great and cozy place for good coffee. I ordered the expresso macchiato and was delicious and strong.
author: Keep I.

description: Very nice staff, good dessert selection, and open late! Also very close to my apartment, so I might be biased :) Very happy this place exists, though - sometimes I just want to enjoy a sweet treat and some tea in the late evening, and now I have a place to go when I do!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Was glad this place was open on Independence Day after running in to so many places that were closed for the holiday.  Latte was good and so was the waffle.
author: Sang J.

description: Super excited to see shaved ice as I was wondering down the street.  Unfortunately, like most places in the continental 48, this was not "shaved ice", just ordinary crushed ice.  False advertising & crushed dreams...
author: Greg V.

description: Sweet potato latte is amazing! Also tried some desserts and a sandwich which were all very good.
author: Christi G.

description: Was in town for a few days and was looking for a late night coffee shop(closed at midnight).   I was  looking for wifi and a place to sit down that wasn't Star Bucks.   This place was small, not too loud (for a Friday I guess), and prices appeared to be reasonable   I ordered the Honey Bread for $7.   It was three very thick slices with whip cream served so warm the cream was sliding off.   Also served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.   Wondeful comfort food.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Red bean shaved/snow ice! Enough to share for two or three and a cute little atmospher. If you're in the tenderloin/nob hill area looking for dessert and conversation post-dinner date, I'd recommend. Plenty of snacks/pastries to choose from.
author: Andrea V.

description: Excellent spot for getting work done.  FYI: Wi-Fi password, though listed in capital letters, is actually lower-case.  Seats are comfortable, especially the high leather swivel stools.  Bright lighting and conveniently located near San Fran's commercial district.  Get the spiced chicken panini--the flavors of curry, dried cranberries, and arugula mix is delectable success!  Caramel latte hits the spot.  If i lived in San Fran, I'd definitely be a regular.
author: Aimee C.

description: It's open til late and has great lattes. Mostly a spot for 20-30 something's when they are studying. Serves delicious waffle dessert.
author: Madelynn W.

description: long preparstion time. food a bit over priced. Espresso did was not that good though latte was better
author: Ben K.

description: What a fun, fabulous little cafe!  I loved my green tea latte and the waffle-ice cream dessert.  This place was perfect for a much needed break.
author: A L.

description: Great place for a latte and some pastries. Good location for working with WiFi. Highly recommend.
author: Yoshito K.

description: Came to Joy's place for some grilled cheese late in the evening. The sandwich was pretty good and the side salad was surprisingly good. The ambience is hipsterish - lots of people on their MacBooks. I will definitely return to try their coffee - it looks great.
author: Joyce H.

description: Sweet potato latte isn't too sweet, yet you get the creamy sweet potato essence. Honey toast with almonds and icecream is straight forward but you definitely get enough to share for the table!
author: C K.

description: it's the best place in downtown to drink high quality coffee and dessert. since the store is opened, i have checked in here to study or work with coffee.
author: Taehoon K.

description:
Been living in this neighborhood for over 5 years. I was exited when I walked by and smelt waffles. Been sick of the cafes in the areas,- so was looking forward to a possible go-to place. Unfortunately I was disappointed. 
Maybe it was the time of day or the full moon, but it was full of loud kids, un energetic staff, pretentious coffee, and the red bean shaved ice was pricey and not tasty to my palette. 4.5 stars makes me think I should go back on a better day. 
Wish it was a rustic and bistro style spot with fantastic coffee. But unfortunately just found another 'modern' cookie cutter cafe in SF.
author: Derek B.

description: The red bean shaved ice was pretty standard, nothing fancy. It had vanilla icecream with redbean paste and mini mochis sprinkled on the side. The environment is pretty unique for its neighborhood, with sofas and benches and stools.
author: Gianni C.

description: Great cafe in the Tendernob/Union Square area. Very comfortable, good food (the Chicken Panini was quite good), and great coffee drinks. Strong wifi, too!
author: DJ C.

description: I was seriously losing hope to find good(drip ) coffee in SF until I bumped into this place. Apart from the minimalist/arty decor this place has brilliant coffee. I tasted the Colombian drip coffee and couldn't have enough! I also like the pretty explicit 'avoid the dark side' (with a picture of Darth Vader) Starbucks mock logo..it's important for independent 'non-exploiting'cafes to let people know of this!  The Wi-Fi connection is great, the place has good music and not too loud so one might actually get some work done. I only wished they have more food options (esp vegetarian) but I guess that's not the most important aspect!  Highly recommend it!
author: Sindhuja S.

description: Got the green tea shaved ice, and honey brick toast to split with a friend. WONDERFUL.
author: K D.

description:
The first cafe that I have found to be open AT NIGHT!!! 
This is something which I have struggled to find since I moved to SF 3 months ago. At home (NZ) we have heaps of cafes open at night, so it was nice to find somewhere that is open later avo and a place that doesnt then turn into a bar!
Love it. 
The chocolate that they use in their drinks is ACTUAL MELTED CHOCOLATE.

A place to relax, not too loud, small and cozy. 

Staff are lovely and very helpful too :)

Cheers!
author: Noeline W.

description: This came up high on a yelp dessert search. The fruit tart and macaroons were good. When asked about gluten free options we were told they got their desserts from somewhere else so they were unsure. Just OK and ironically absent of very much joy.
author: Beth K.

description: Nice little cafe, pretty friendly service, good chicken salad sandwich , I order tea from them pretty often , I never have to wait more than a minute. I like the decor cute plants :)
author: Joonier Y.

description: Excellent little cafe. Coffee was off a high standard and relatively cheap. I would recommend a green tea latte or a simple cappuccino! Fantastic cafe atmosphere with top notch music. The cafe also has great wifi if you are looking to work and relax at the same time. Would recommend to my friends
author: Greg R.

description: Was looking for a place that had some wifi on a late rainy night when my aprtment internet was out. This place is perfect! Super chill atmosphere, great desserts and of course good wifi. I got an awesome afagota and just chilled. Exactly what I was looking for. Definitely will be back.
author: Carter H.

description: The Red Bean Shaved Ice is so good!  Sweetened shaved ice mixed with red bean, soy powder, mochi, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream was a party in my mouth.  This cozy cafe is definitely a cool place to go to hang out and grab a drink or dessert with a friend.
author: Stephen W.

description: Just an update on the Sweet Potato Latte. I decided to give it a try again adding a shot of Espresso and it was ...Fantastic! I'm sure the last time I ordered it, it was not properly made because this tasted so much better and I know it wasn't just the added espresso. There was more flavor and sweetness and not oddly watered down as previous time. Soooo good and just as i  expected it to taste the first time (but didn't).
author: Mila B.

description: Great, small spot that I like to go to for a great quality coffee and small plates of sweets.  Waffles are delicious. Wifi is free and convenient for laptop users. Mood is very New York so i like that, the staff is friendly and professional and the music selection is AWESOME. (At least when I'm there, the Smiths, Depeche Mode, all good indie brit pop).
author: Fashionista M.

description:
Nice place but not originally
They're good to incorporate multinational
foods.
I think this place is for Korean students.every time I saw a lot of Korean students.

Waiter was so mean when I ordered.he said ha?ha? Maybe his favorite phrase
So not bad not too good
author: S V.

description: Cute cafe with nice desserts & espresso. It was packed on Saturday night, mostly with students.
author: Nabila S.

description: Lattes were good. Smooth and well balanced. Didn't feel the batistas there were very friendly though which is the critical component to be a good coffee shop. Atmosphere was average.
author: David B.

description: Joy's Place is my favorite coffee shop in the neighborhood. Super fast Wi-Fi, excellent coffee and very friendly staff. They are open late and have a small but solid selection of Panini's and Korean inspired desserts.
author: Rubail B.

description:
This place is very nice and comfortable.
And the honey toast was awesome. I love it.

There are not so many choices but so far I tried this and affogato and both of them were good. I want to try panini next time. But this place is not for meal.

We can use outlet and fast Wi-Fi in the cafe, so it's perfect to study or work.
But because of that, many people stay alone for long time and some of them occupy two or more seats for theirselves. So the seats are often full.
author: Mai I.

description: americano was smooth and hot, however, the green tea shaved ice was mediocre compared to the ones in LA
author: Christina K.

description: Love coming here. They have the best lemon tea it is so good and they have some pretty good desserts. They are all friendly and have good customer service. It is a nice place to get work done. It can get busy with students during the year, because it is a pretty popular little place. Free wifi and overall a nice place to study, work, collaborate or enjoy some tea and dessert.
author: Brittany S.

description:
I almost don't want to give this place a good review because I don't want my fav study spot to get crowded! There aren't many good, relaxing cafes around and, as a student, I need a place to get things done.

Unfortunately, no one else in here is quiet! Music is pretty loud and so are the customers, but the place is cute and inviting. There is always plenty of space to sit and enjoy your coffee which, by the way, isn't stellar but also isn't enough to push me away. 

It's also realllly hard to concentrate when you smell delicious waffles all around you!! Don't come here if you can't control your sweet tooth, like me!
author: Sam D.

description: Good location. All cool, clean, bright and shiny inside. First impressions: the servers were rather uninformed about the menu. The coffee was good.  I'll try again when the kinks are out and they can help more with menu descriptions...
author: Jen S.

description: I enjoyed my iced americano immensely, served in a mason jar.  Good ambiance.
author: Conor K.

description: I love the atmosphere and music at Joy's Place. It's the perfect spot to meet up with friends, do some work alone, or to grab a quick cup of tea. It's a little pricey, but anywhere in SF is expensive.
author: Evelyn C.

description: sweet potato latte!!! heck yes. delish. the ham and cheese croissant was sooooo gooood and it came with a salad, bonus! very pleased, very happy. wish it was closer to me so i could go back all the time!
author: Korene D.

description: Had the green tea patbingsoo, it was too icey, but the red bean was good. I wish they would put fruit on it to make it more flavorful. There's just way too much ice. Def had better elsewhere.
author: E S.

description: Nice decor & amazing sweet potato latte!  It was rather expensive ($5) but worth every penny.  Would totally come back to this place the next time I visit SF.
author: Junho P.

description: Great desserts and drinks. Very laptop-friendly, fast wireless connection, open until midnight. Highly recommended for a late-night treat.
author: Jonathan V.

description: Sweet potato lattes are awesome, esp with a shot of expresso. And they play awesome tunes.
author: A G.

description: I really like this place a lot. This is a very cozy cafe good for studying or reading. Stable wifi. I enjoyed the latte a lot, strong and thick. The sandwiches were pretty good too. They also have citrus tea (not on their menu), awesome drink if coffee is not what you are looking for!
author: Wendy L.

description:
the place is small and full of students
but still nice
we had 2 hot chocolate 
2 macaron 
1 chocolate cake (which was super delicious)
we paid between 16 and 18 not sure how much exactly
author: Nada A.
